runners.name: Detain
runners.comment: 2-2 (AW) before down the field in Doncaster Group 1; retains considerable potential
runners.spotlight: Won 7f novice races at Kempton (Polytrack) last August/October on his first two starts, impressively on the second occasion; soundly beaten sixth of eight in Group 1 Futurity at Doncaster (1m, soft) next time but drops back in grade on reappearance and retains considerable potential for his top yard.

quotes.race: Unibet More Extra Place Races Novice Stakes (GBB Race) (Div II)
quotes.quote: There was never much pace on paper and a lot of newcomers, so I wanted to just give Detain a little bit of a stretch, try to get a feel of him and he's put the race to bed nicely. It felt like a piece of work. he's a talented animal - Kieran Shoemark, jockey, speaking to Racing TV.

runners.name: Hott Shott
runners.owner: P Cook, P Merritt & T Verrier
runners.comment: Runner-up to Godolphin favourite on reappearance; improvement necessary but possible
runners.spotlight: After finishing fifth of seven in a Group 3 at Sandown he made it 2-4 when winning Kempton novice (7f, Polytrack) in October; no match for the Godolphin favourite in Kempton conditions race (1m) in February and improvement is needed, but he could have more left in the tank; yard won this last year.

quotes.race: British Stallion Studs EBF Maiden Stakes (IRE Incentive Race) (Colts & Geldings)
quotes.quote: I'll take it. I was gutted as they crossed the line as I truly believe Hott Shott is a pretty good horse. When I ran him at Kempton he walked into the paddock and I felt I'd gone too early with him. He had an easy race, which is great and I gave him loads of time to get over that. He's got a great attitude and is by a great stallion - Richard Hughes, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: We like him a lot. I threw him in the deep end at Sandown to find out what we have and he ran a solid race in fifth. He'll finish his two-year-old career with a novice race in October before we put him away. 18-09-24

runners.name: Luther
runners.comment: Listed winner at Haydock in September; one of the leading form contenders on AW debut
runners.spotlight: Listed runner-up at Salisbury (1m) last August on second start, behind subsequent Grade 1 winner, then won Listed race at Haydock (1m); soft ground and the undulations may not have suited at Newmarket in the Royal Lodge; one of the leading form contenders on his reappearance and AW debut.

quotes.race: Betfair Daily Tips On Betting.Betfair Ascendant Stakes (Listed Race)
quotes.quote: Luther is a strong, powerful colt with as good a mind as I've trained. He's in the Royal Lodge and that's the most obvious place to go next. Then we'll see if we stay here for the Racing Post Trophy and call it a day, as the Breeders' Cup is also an option. Hopefully, he's a Guineas horse next year - Charlie Fellowes, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: He's as nice a two-year-old as I've had. He ran a screamer at Salisbury where a bit of inexperience got him beat. He's entered at Haydock on Saturday and is in the Royal Lodge and the Dewhurst. If it goes well I'd love to send him over to the Breeders' Cup Juvenile Turf. 11-09-24

runners.name: Port Light
runners.comment: 2-3; this is much tougher but he's a likeable prospect who could hold his own
runners.spotlight: Posted a win (at Southwell) and a near-miss (over this C&D) from his first two starts; then gelded and won by 5l at 1-4 over C&D in February; this is much tougher but he's a likeable prospect who could hold his own.

runners.name: Quai De Bethune
runners.comment: Won at Kempton on second start but held there since; has work to do
runners.spotlight: Won in good style at Kempton (1m, Polytrack) in January on second start then fourth of six there (1m) in February, when just over 1l behind runner-up Hott Shott; still early days but he has work to do.

runners.name: Wolf Of Badenoch
runners.comment: Disappointing in the autumn but looked promising previously when Group 2 runner-up
runners.spotlight: Down the field in Group races last autumn on final two starts; however, before those he looked promising when runner-up in the Group 2 Vintage Stakes at Goodwood (7f) on his second outing, and it's possible a break will have helped; not ruled out.

quotes.race: HKJC World Pool Vintage Stakes (Group 2)
quotes.quote: Wolf Of Badenoch ran very well but he was quite inexperienced over the first half mile. I had to engage him down to the two pole but he put up a big performance around the field - Jamie Spencer, rider.

quotes.race: Ice Cream Direct EBF Maiden Stakes (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Jamie was very impressed with Wolf Of Badenoch. He said he sustained a really good, long run while still being quite babyish. He said he galloped out very well and the feeling is there's plenty more to come from him - Hugo Palmer, trainer.

runners.name: Yaroogh
runners.comment: Four wins (including Listed) during progressive 2yo campaign; could be a player
runners.spotlight: Four wins during his progressive juvenile campaign, including on Polytrack and in a Listed race in October; below best in Qatar in February but he's a player if tapping back into his 2yo promise.

quotes.race: Prix Saraca (Listed Race) (2yo) (Turf)
quotes.quote: Yaroogh loved the ground and he won well. He'll either go for the Horris Hill in two weeks or go back to France for the Prix Herod at Saint-Cloud with a penalty. He'll definitely run again - William Haggas, trainer.

6:00.race_name: Watch Live Racing At bet365 Handicap (GBB Plus Race)

runners.name: Paradoxical
runners.comment: Bumped into highly progressive winner when denied Wolverhampton five-timer; strong claims
runners.spotlight: Four consecutive wins at Wolverhampton (8.6f/9.4f, Tapeta) this year when these cheekpieces went on; clear second under penalty behind highly progressive winner at Wolverhampton (8.6f) ten days ago and runs off 2lb lower today; won over 1m2f on the Lingfield Polytrack in December; strong claims.

runners.name: Free Speech
runners.comment: Suited by these cheekpieces last year; C&D winner; chance if fully tuned up on return
runners.spotlight: Won two in a row on turf last July/September when these cheekpieces went on (1m4f/11.6f); absent since lesser run later in September and the drop back in trip isn't an obvious plus, but she won over C&D in 2023 on her sole previous course visit and retains potential; chance if fully tuned up.

runners.name: Odin Legacy
runners.comment: Well beaten on heavy on final two runs last October but promise previously; lightly raced
runners.spotlight: Well beaten on heavy ground on final two runs last October; however, this lightly raced 4yo looked promising previously (including over C&D) and is not ruled out for his in-form yard in first-time blinkers after a break.

runners.name: Timeless Charm
runners.comment: Impressive on debut in 2023 but lightly raced since and has struggled to get competitive
runners.spotlight: Impressive on debut at Kempton (1m, Polytrack) in November 2023, but lightly raced since and she struggled to get competitive in 2024 and on her sole outing this year (stable debut); has plenty to prove.

stable_tour.quote: She was disappointing at Doncaster. I think she wants better ground. She's worked nicely through the spring and I certainly haven't lost hope in her. I can give her another chance. 04-04-24

runners.name: Curran
runners.owner: Mrs S Russell & A M Russell
runners.comment: Has dropped down the weights; wind op since last run, which needs to make a difference
runners.spotlight: Won two 2yo novices in autumn 2023 and he's dropped down the weights; however, he was unable to threaten on his last three starts last July/September and the subsequent wind surgery needs to make a difference.

runners.name: Golden Circet
runners.owner: W Trenchard, A Coupland & If Only Ptn
runners.comment: Clonmel maiden winner; the betting may be informative on his stable debut
runners.spotlight: 5yo who was inconsistent during light career in Ireland for Willie McCreery but he won a 9.5f turf maiden at Clonmel last September; has changed hands since and been gelded; not discounted in a first-time tongue-tie on stable debut, and market support would pique greater interest.

quotes.race: Slievenamon Maiden
quotes.quote: Golden Circet came on the bridle in the straight and quickened up well. He galloped all the way to the line in spite of going left, I just didn't want to break his stride and I let him come across - Billy Lee, rider.

runners.name: Cavalry Call
runners.comment: On a competitive mark but there are doubts about his current form and this new trip
runners.spotlight: He's on a competitive mark on his best form but he's been unable to show it in these cheekpieces on his last two starts; now 1-14 and he's unraced beyond 8.6f; a return to form is needed now up in trip.

runners.name: Shahbaz
runners.comment: Returned to form with close second at Wolverhampton and he could be in the mix back up 2lb
runners.spotlight: Has a poor strike-rate but, having dropped down the weights, he was suited by the step back up in trip when second at Wolverhampton (9.4f, Tapeta) last month; also effective on Polytrack and could be in the mix back up 2lb.

stable_tour.quote: He progressed as the season went on last year culminating with victory over 1m1f in a Newmarket nursery off a mark of 82. This season he has had two runs, not troubling the judge on either occasion, and he was a bit disappointing last time out at Ascot over 1m2f, where they went no gallop which did not suit him. I am still not convinced he gets 1m2f as if you watch a replay of that race he is weakening as they approach the line. I did put him in the London Gold Cup last Saturday, but it was too dry to run him. I will give him another try over 1m2f and see, but I would not be surprised if we drop him back to a milen. The key to him is the race must be run at proper pace. 28-05-23

runners.name: Three Yorkshiremen

prev_owners.owner: John Rhodes Peter Timmins & Dale Wilsdon

runners.comment: C&D winner; return to form needed but step back up in trip and the cheekpieces could help
runners.spotlight: Won over C&D last April and is now 5lb lower; below par since but he's been tackling 7f on his last few Flat starts and the step back up in trip and return of cheekpieces (worn for last win) are possible positives.

8:00.race_name: Best Odds Guaranteed At bet365 Handicap

runners.name: Gdaay
runners.comment: On a good mark and last two runs haven't been too shabby; capable with J Doyle booked
runners.spotlight: Seven-time winner who is 6lb lower than for his Lingfield win (7f, good) last summer; solid efforts in defeat the last twice and dangerous if able to dominate; James Doyle booked.

runners.name: Super Hit
runners.comment: C&D win off 3lb lower last October; yet to fire for new stable; change of headgear today
runners.spotlight: Ended his time with Marco Botti with a C&D win off 3lb lower; not found top form in three runs for new stable and hopes rest on a change of headgear sparking extra.

runners.name: Master Dandy
runners.comment: On a winning mark but not fired in two runs for new yard; back up in trip; new headgear
runners.spotlight: On a winning mark but two runs for his new yard haven't suggested he was ready to take advantage; back up in trip in a change of headgear.

runners.name: Nammos
runners.comment: String of good runs to end 2024; still feasibly treated; big player back down in class
runners.spotlight: Returned to Jane Chapple-Hyam last August and she won two of her next three starts, both over C&D; ran well for a close fourth in a stronger race here when last seen in December; strong contender despite the widest stall.

stable_tour.quote: She had her first run for me the other day at Doncaster, having come from Phil Kirby. She ran well under a positive ride by Laura Coughlan, a jockey I like, and wasn't beaten far. She's had a few different stables but is a lovely-natured filly. Hopefully we can build on that and I'd be confident of getting a win with her. 26-07-24

runners.name: Kracking
runners.comment: Not at best in 2025 but slipped to a dangerous mark; did too much too soon here last week
runners.spotlight: Not at his best in 2025 but he's slipped to a dangerous mark; did too much early over C&D last week (sent off favourite); others make more appeal.

quotes.race: Al Basti Equiworld, Dubai Apprentice Handicap (Whips To Be Carried, But Not Used) (RE Series)
quotes.quote: Kracking jumped well and travelled along really well. He was always doing enough and I never really felt any pressure from another horse. Mr [Stuart] Williams was confident so I just let him bowl along. I'm happy to be back with Mr Hannon doing what I love. I could do with an agent to keep the ball rolling into the winter and get a few more rides - Tyrese Cameron, jockey.

runners.name: Roach Power
runners.comment: Thrown in on best form; the combination of S Levey/first-time blinkers could spark revival
runners.spotlight: Ended 2023 with a pair of slow-ground wins for Tim Easterby (7f and 6f); disappointed last year and he hasn't found his best form in three runs since joining Michael Wigham; tumbled down the weights though and the combination of new blinkers and Sean Levey taking over in the saddle (six wins and four seconds from 24 rides for the yard) offers hope of a revival.

stable_tour.quote: He just needed the race first time out at Doncaster and he's in good form now. He's won over seven furlongs, but he's quick and is just as good at six furlongs. 23-04-24

runners.name: Twitch
runners.breeder: P I Foreman & S A Sharrock

prev_owners.owner: Patrick Ting Siu Yin & Timothy Ting Hao Feng

runners.comment: Two C&D wins last September; promising return last month but this a rise in class
runners.spotlight: Won two Class 6 handicaps over C&D last September; encouraging seasonal return at Lingfield last month; more on his plate up in class.

runners.name: Lilkian
runners.comment: Losing run stands at 24 and looks vulnerable from out of the handicap
runners.spotlight: 12-time winner but losing run stands at 24 and he's on the downgrade; new headgear tried but opposable from 4lb out of the weights.

6:30.race_name: bet365 Restricted Maiden Stakes (For horses in Bands C and D) (GBB Race)

runners.name: El Cobre Fuego
runners.comment: Has place claims on this year's Newcastle form
runners.spotlight: Has finished 150-1 third and 12-1 second in 5f maidens at Newcastle this year, improving on his 2yo efforts; again has place claims.

runners.name: Mc Moan
runners.comment: Finished about 5l behind Walnut at Wolverhampton
runners.spotlight: Finished about 5l behind Walnut in 6f maiden at Wolverhampton but was a lot shorter in the betting than that rival and may improve.

runners.name: Sir Kenny

prev_owners.owner: Catch Us If You Can Racing Two

runners.comment: Plenty to find dropped further in trip
runners.spotlight: Drops further in trip needing major improvement on his 1m/6f efforts; handicaps likely to be more suitable soon.

runners.name: Cape Sovereign
runners.comment: AW debutant who has a major chance on his turf form
runners.spotlight: Made the frame in four turf races last year; had wind/gelding operations since; this AW debutant has a major chance on the figures.

runners.name: Gorgeous Mr George
runners.comment: Fared better dropped to 5f at Southwell; in the mix
runners.spotlight: Weakened over 6f at Newcastle then fared better dropped to 5f at Southwell where he beat all bar the favourite; in the mix.

runners.name: Walnut
runners.comment: Should build on Wolverhampton effort with this drop in trip likely to suit
runners.spotlight: Promising third, despite being headstrong, in 6f maiden at Wolverhampton; respected with this drop in distance likely to be in his favour.

runners.name: A Day In Bloom
runners.comment: Ulysses half-sister to three winners; check the betting
runners.spotlight: Ulysses half-sister to three winners, notably Beau Roc (5f; RPR 73); one of two newcomers in the field; check the betting.

runners.name: Honest Courtesan
runners.comment: Kodiac filly who wears cheekpieces on debut; market helpful
runners.spotlight: Kodiac filly who is the first foal of a Listed-placed 5f winner (RPR 99); wears cheekpieces on debut; market instructive.

5:25.race_name: Racing Value At bet365 Apprentice Handicap

runners.name: Stintino Sunset
runners.breeder: S Clarke, G Parsons & A Wideson
runners.comment: C&D winner and a reliable type; hasn't been seen since November but should go well
runners.spotlight: C&D winner and a reliable type who is back in trip on this first outing since November; no reason why she won't give another good account.

runners.name: Night Arc

prev_owners.owner: J Palmer-Brown, N Woodcock And Partner

runners.comment: Not won since 2023 but shaped as though coming to hand last time; player back up in trip
runners.spotlight: Hasn't won for nearly two years but has slipped in the weights and shaped as though coming to hand at Wolverhampton last time; worth another go over this trip and he's a player.

runners.name: Its Tim
runners.comment: Respectable effort on handicap debut last time; bred to stay 1m2f and may do better
runners.spotlight: Respectable effort in tongue-tie on handicap debut (1m) at Southwell; shouldn't be a problem with this trip; needs to raise game but may be capable of better.

runners.name: Dubai Immo
runners.comment: Won over C&D and over 1m6f at Wolverhampton last year; form patchy since
runners.spotlight: Won over C&D and over 1m6f at Wolverhampton last year but form patchy since; down in trip with something to prove after a break of over three months.

stable_tour.quote: He is unlucky to still be a maiden after five runs with form figures of 23224 illustrating how genuine he is. He ran well last time at Nottingham over 1mÂ½f when only beaten a length, and with the winner rated 82 he is a high 70s performer already. I think he is better with a little cut in the ground - in fact the softer the better. We will stick to a mile, and I expect him to opening his account sooner rather than later. 25-05-22

runners.name: Tactical Control
runners.comment: Running well of late but has an ordinary strike-rate and drawn wide back up in trip
runners.spotlight: Ordinary strike-rate but has run well on last two starts; blinkers replaced by first-time visor but more to do back up in trip from stall 12.

runners.name: Cryptos Dream
runners.comment: Running respectably of late but needs to raise game again if she's to win this
runners.spotlight: Multiple turf/AW winner who has run respectably at Wolverhampton of late; however, she'll have to do better if she's to return to winning ways.

runners.name: Global Resolve
runners.comment: Best effort came over C&D but he's a regressive maiden who has something to prove
runners.spotlight: Best effort came over this C&D but he's a regressive maiden who was well beaten on hurdle debut last time; enough to prove back on the Flat.

runners.name: Oyamal
runners.comment: Has run well over C&D but well beaten on last five starts and easy enough to take on
runners.spotlight: One of better efforts came over this C&D just over a year ago but soundly beaten on last five starts; back in trip with tongue-tie on but easy enough to take on.

runners.name: Balqaa
runners.comment: Bit below best on last two starts but couldn't rule out back up in trip
runners.spotlight: All wins on AW - including one over this trip - but bit below best on last two starts; couldn't rule out back up in trip, though, especially if the market speaks positively.

stable_tour.quote: She runs in the well-known green silks of owner John Fretwell and has had three runs over a mile this summer. She needs more racing to come to herself as she has not shown too much so far. I do like her and in time she will win races. I may consider dropping her down to 7f at some point, yet she looks as if a mile should be her trip 23-09-21

runners.name: Foinix
runners.comment: Running respectably of late; back in trip from wide draw
runners.spotlight: Dual middle-distance turf winner last year and has run respectably on last two starts; however, no easy task back in trip from stall 13.

quotes.race: Tips For Every Race At raceday-ready.com Classified Stakes
quotes.quote: Looking back at his form Foinix is well capable of having a sudden change in fortunes. He feels like he's really enjoying his racing. At Brighton he didn't look like a classified horse and didn't do so again today. He can just be a little bit gassy but he gets into a beautiful rhythm. He's definitely worth a go at further trips, but keep him where he is for now because he's doing nothing wrong - Joe Leavy, jockey, speaking to Sky Sports Racing.

runners.name: Hijo De La Luna

prev_owners.owner: David Spratt & Sean Jones & Mrs Lynne Lyons

runners.comment: 2lb ahead of his mark judged on latest Newcastle form but yet to win after 20 Flat starts
runners.spotlight: Went close over this trip at Newcastle last week and is 2lb ahead of his mark but he's 0-20 on the Flat so, although he has obvious claims, he wouldn't be one for maximum faith.

runners.name: Cracking Filly
runners.comment: Regressive maiden; has shown ability over C&D but needs to raise game to win this
runners.spotlight: Regressive maiden; has shown ability over this C&D but she'll have to raise her game if she's to win this.

runners.name: Forest Haze
runners.comment: First run for new trainer and no surprise should she be able to raise her game
runners.spotlight: Hasn't shown much but isn't exposed after only four runs in handicaps and has been switched to Peter Chapple-Hyam's yard; no headgear this time and market should be a reasonable guide.

runners.name: Wedgewood
runners.comment: Four AW wins elsewhere; near miss off this mark last month; below par last time
runners.spotlight: Good record on AW, including a placed effort over C&D, and she's on the same mark as when headed in the final stride at Wolverhampton last month; backward step back at Wolverhampton 12 days ago and there is other pace to worry about today.

runners.name: Midnightattheoasis
runners.comment: Made it 4 in a row at Lingfield on Tues, coming from tricky spot; big penalty; good chance
runners.spotlight: In the form of his life at present, winning three times in March and completing a four-timer when extricating himself from a tricky position at Lingfield on Tuesday; huge penalty to shoulder but Brandon Wikie's claim offsets some of it and the five-timer beckons.

quotes.race: BetUK: It's Where The UK Bets Handicap
quotes.quote: Rossa [Ryan] has clicked with him and that was an unbelievable ride he gave Midnightattheoasis. I was worried about him going down the hill and that played out in the race, but luckily Rossa switched him inside round the bend and that galvanised him. The drop back to five has worked a treat. He travels very strongly and we ran him a lot over six furlongs but I'll hold my hands up and say that was trainer error. It was more by accident we popped him in at Wolverhampton two weeks ago but we've found the key to him now. He'll still only be off 61 [at Chelmsford next Thursday], and he was rated 70 at one point. We're lucky to have plenty of turnout and he won't have the tack on him until he goes to Chelmsford, which works well for these sprinters - Phil McEntee, trainer.

runners.name: Sir Rodneyredblood
runners.comment: Prolific AW winner, including C&D five weeks ago; 3lb higher mark not insurmountable
runners.spotlight: Recorded the 16th win of his career (15 on AW) when gamely landing a C&D handicap five weeks ago; 3lb rise doesn't handicap him out of things and he's one to take seriously.

runners.name: Buraback
runners.comment: Good run of form came to an end last time but he wasn't well drawn; bounce back quickly
runners.spotlight: Good run of form came to an end at Wolverhampton 19 days ago but he was poorly drawn on that occasion; type to bounce back quickly.

quotes.race: Watch Racing Free Online At Coral Handicap
quotes.quote: We've always liked Buraback but he's had issues with the bend here in the past and I told John Egan to get something on his outer this time. He got a nice run up the straight and maybe we'll run him on a straighter track next time - John Best, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: He's new to the yard from Jessica Macey and has had just one run for us when down the field at Wolverhampton. He had a few small issues, which we have ironed out, and the plan is to go down the turf route now. Hopefully when he gets on the grass he'll start to find some improvement. 22-03-23

runners.name: Southbank
runners.owner: David N Reynolds &  C D Watkins

prev_owners.owner: Qatar Racing Limited & China Horse Club International Ltd

runners.comment: Impressed over 6f here in December and solid in defeat since; drop in trip a query
runners.spotlight: Impressive over 6f here in December and he's run some good races in defeat since; dangerous mark but likely he'll need them to go too fast early now dropping back to 5f.

runners.name: Rebel Star
runners.comment: Improving sprinter; collared late by Midnightattheoasis last week; capable of better yet
runners.spotlight: Improved for the addition of a visor and switch to handicaps, stepping up on her Wolverhampton second when headed in the final strides by Midnightattheoasis at Lingfield six days ago; weighted to reverse the placings today and she's not fully exposed.

runners.name: Sir Benedict
runners.comment: Last time can be ignored but this is his first visit here and he'll need a strong pace
runners.spotlight: In and out this year but he's down in the weights and last week's Newcastle eighth (behind Midnightattheoasis) isn't the run to judge him on as he ran into traffic at a crucial stage and lost all his momentum; first run at Chelmsford.

8:30.race_name: Each Way Extra At bet365 Handicap

runners.name: Rogue Destiny
runners.comment: Didn't beat many home in three novice runs in late 2024; tongue tie on for h'cap debut
runners.spotlight: Didn't beat many home in three runs in novice company in late 2024; could take a step forward now handicapping in a new tongue tie; ideally needs to settle better but Hector Crouch takes over for the first time.

runners.name: All Cost
runners.comment: Narrowly failed to land a gamble on handicap debut; less good since but now down in trip
runners.spotlight: Narrowly failed to land a gamble on his handicap debut at Kempton (1m)  in February; hasn't built on that effort twice since and now drops in trip; could yet do better.

runners.name: Aim For The Bull
runners.breeder: David John Brown & Whistbury Manor Stud
runners.comment: Promising 6f run here on handicap debut; gelded since a low-key stable debut in November
runners.spotlight: Late headway into third over 6f here on his nursery debut in October; left Brian Toomey after that and made a low-key stable debut in November (7f); gelded since; still has some potential.

runners.name: I Follow Rivers
runners.comment: Poor form at two but up in trip for handicap debut and his brother is a useful C&D winner
runners.spotlight: Modest form in three sprint runs last summer; his brother Giant stays 7f well (C&D winner) and he could prove a different proposition handicapping having been gelded since last seen.

runners.name: Hype Merchant
runners.comment: Second over C&D in February; less good over 6f last time and now tried in blinkers
runners.spotlight: Improved effort switched to AW when second over C&D in February (winner won again since); failed to build on it at Southwell five weeks ago (6f) and now moves back up in trip with blinkers given a go.

runners.name: College Witch
runners.comment: Promise on penultimate start and had a poor draw last time; return to 7f no problem
runners.spotlight: Signs of promise at Southwell (6f) on her handicap debut in February; couldn't build on it last time but she was poorly drawn; return to 7f can help and not fully exposed.

runners.name: Adelaide Bay
runners.owner: Mrs B V Sangster & Jane Chapple Hyam
runners.comment: Beaten fav over C&D on nursery debut but met trouble in running; gelded since; considered
runners.spotlight: It wasn't a strong C&D nursery in which he finished seventh of 12 when last seen in September but it's notable that he was sent off favourite and he would have finished closer but for meeting trouble in running 1f out; looked a tricky ride there but he's been gelded since and remains capable of better; interesting to see if his backers return.

runners.name: Due Respect
runners.comment: Unplaced all seven starts; down in weights but comes with risks attached; new cheekpieces
runners.spotlight: Beaten favourite on her stable/handicap debut over C&D in February; unplaced over 6f twice since; edging down the weights but needs the cheekpieces to have a positive effect.

runners.name: No Gain
runners.comment: First promising signs at Wolverhampton (8.6f) in February; unexposed; yard run two here
runners.spotlight: First signs of promise when a close fourth on her handicap debut at Wolverhampton nine weeks ago (8.6f), racing freely and messed about a bit early in the race; open to improvement; market useful with connections also running All Cost.

runners.name: Runnindown A Dream
runners.comment: Failed to beat a rival in three sprint runs this winter; up in trip for handicap debut
runners.spotlight: Failed to beat a rival in three sprint runs this winter; up in trip for handicap debut; hard to recommend.

runners.name: Late Star
runners.comment: No solid form claims but is at least facing a more realistic assignment today
runners.spotlight: Well beaten in three 7f runs as a 2yo (two of them here); faces a more realistic assignment now handicapping at a low level but drawn widest and not easily recommended.

4:05.going_detailed: GOOD TO SOFT, Good in places on Mildmay course (GoingStick: Mildmay Hurdle 5.0, Mildmay Chase 5.4, Grand National course 5.2) (Watering)

runners.name: A Jet Of Our Own
runners.comment: Unable to lay a glove on Joker De Mai at Taunton last month; very opposable
runners.spotlight: Prolific winner in points and he won at last May's Cheltenham hunter chase meeting (2m); however, he couldn't lay a glove on Joker De Mai at Taunton last month and is very opposable on the back of that.

stable_tour.quote: He won some 3m point-to-points because he was the best horse in the race, but I never truly thought he was a 3m stayer and we proved that when we dropped 28-11-24

runners.name: Annamix

prev_owners.owner: P W Mullins & Paul Kelleher & Cian Kiely

runners.comment: Poor last time but has a good record over these fences so can't be dismissed
runners.spotlight: A three-time hunter chase winner for Willie Mullins but it was a forgettable first run back with that yard when tailed off at Gowran a month ago; cheekpieces are now added and returning here might float his boat as he was third in both the 2022 Topham and this race 12 months ago.

quotes.race: INHSC Supporting Point-To-Points Tetratema Cup Hunters Chase
quotes.quote: That's Luke's first winner over fences. He rode a winner for Barry Fitzgerald at Galway in a bumper. He's with us for two years now and he's a very natural rider. Annamix is a brilliant jumper and Aintree will be right up his alley - Patrick Mullins, owner.

quotes.race: Randox Topham Handicap Chase (Grade 3) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: We're very happy with Annamix. Danny got a great ride from him and said he just came alive once he went out on the track. He really enjoys it around here - Willie Mullins, trainer.

quotes.race: Visit Kilkenny.ie Chase
quotes.quote: I think this fellow has improved with age and I don't mind going up in trip with him either. That might be his optimum trip but I'd prefer to go up in trip rather than come back. He jumped well so hopefully he can improve for the rest of the season - Willie Mullins, trainer

quotes.race: Irish Stallion Farms EBF Beginners Chase
quotes.quote: He put it together nicely and it takes a fair horse to come and win in Fairyhouse first time out over fences. Hopefully there will be more to come over fences than he showed over hurdles but he still ran to a solid level over hurdles all last year. He'll probably get further but the way he threw in a few of those jumps early on he'd be a nice two-mile chaser through the spring. Better ground might bring out more in him but that's still a solid performance on slow ground after plenty of rain today - Danny Mullins, rider of Annamix

quotes.race: Goatenbridge Maiden Hurdle
quotes.quote: Annamix will probably be kept on the go and will run wherever we can for the rest of this season. I'm keen to go chasing next season - Willie Mullins, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: He's been having a good, solid season and looks like he could land a decent handicap chase somewhere. His next start will probably come in the Ladbrokes Trophy at Newbury. Nice ground suits him so we won't run him hugely over the winter. If he's not able to win in the early autumn, it might be the spring. 02-11-21

runners.name: Autonomous Cloud
runners.comment: Second to Bennys King last time and he needs slower ground at this sort of trip
runners.spotlight: Fourth in last season's Midlands National but below that level this campaign, latterly proving no match for Bennys King on hunter chase debut; needs slower ground at this sort of trip.

quotes.race: Pektron Novices' Limited Handicap Chase (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Autonomous Cloud is an enormous horse and a great jumper. Win, lose or draw we're going to the Welsh National after this - Paddy Brennan, rider.

quotes.race: Extra Furlong With Trinity Create Novices' Handicap Chase (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Autonomous Cloud has loads of ability and he'll be one for the staying handicap chases down the line. He has plenty of scope and the Midlands National could be a race for next season - Adrian Heskin, jockey.

stable_tour.quote: He's a lovely young horse but is still a baby and probably won't be out before Christmas. He's a gorgeous, big horse and will make a fine chaser in time. He looks great and is well bred too, as his dam was placed in a Grade 3 novice chase. I think we'll stick to bumpers with him this season and look forward to him in the future. 09-11-20

runners.name: Bardenstown Lad
runners.owner: The Stay Between The Ditches Syndicate
runners.comment: At 66-1 he offered little in the hunter chase at Cheltenham last month
runners.spotlight: Won a point and a hunter chase in February but at 66-1 he offered little in the hunter chase at Cheltenham; would be a surprise winner of this; blinkers return (tried once, tailed off over hurdles) instead of cheekpieces.

quotes.race: Albert Bartlett Novices' Hurdle (Grade 1) (Registered As The Spa Novices' Hurdle) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: We're delighted with the run. The ground was probably a bit slow for Bardenstown Lad, but he's a big chaser in the making - Derek Kierans, connections' representative.

quotes.race: 888Sport What's Your Thinking Novices' Hurdle (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: It was a good performance in the end. Bardenstown Lad raced very lazily early on and when I gave him a reminder at the top of the hill he came back on it [the bridle], winged the last three hurdles and he's gone and done it well.  I was all out at 1-10 at Cartmel and I thought I was going to get beat halfway round as he's just that type of horse. He might need headgear later on in his life but something like the Albert Bartlett is a race you need a real stayer in and he is that. I hope John's hoping that's what he can be - Sean Bowen, rider.

stable_tour.quote: I'm going to get him fully checked out after his run at Cheltenham over the weekend as it's not just his jumping over fences that is an issue - he's not really travelling either. Maybe he really doesn't like chasing but he was bought as a point-to-pointer so we'd expect him to be fine in that regard. He's also schooled well at home and the engine is still there because he works very well. I wouldn't be too worried yet. 21-11-22

runners.name: Bennys King
runners.comment: Runner-up in this for the last two years and got his head back in front last time out
runners.spotlight: Inconsistency has crept into this 14yo's game but confidence should be buoyed by his win at Leicester in February and he loves it around here, having finished second in the last two editions of this race; probably vulnerable for win purposes but has place aspirations for sure; races prominently.

quotes.race: Randox Foxhunters' Open Hunters' Chase
quotes.quote: Bennys King is an absolutely fantastic horse. I remember being stood here last year saying I'm not sure he will make it back here next year. I will probably be stood here now saying I'm not sure he will make it back next year, but who knows. He has just been a phenomenal horse that loves life. He was a bit slow to get going in the early part of the season. He hit some soft ground. He loves it in hunter chase races where they go that bit slower, and he loves those fences. It is a shame he is getting older as I would love him to be around a little longer - Dan Skelton, trainer.

quotes.race: "For The Love Of Racing" Handicap Chase
quotes.quote: Bennys King has become progressive over fences and is still lightly raced. He always takes a run at the start of the season and we had him in the Silver Cup later on the card, but were unsure about the trip on this ground. I don't feel we're finished at three miles, but if we do it again, it needs to be on a flat track. He'll go up, but he's lightly raced so I think he can still be effective - Dan Skelton, trainer.

quotes.race: Sir Peter O'Sullevan Memorial Handicap Chase
quotes.quote: Two-mile-three around Stratford isn't Bennys King's thing, but I knew I had to get a run into him. He's a bit fragile and you can't gallop him as much as you'd like at home, but we couldn't find a race and that was available. We're disappointed not to get in the Ladbrokes Trophy today. Where we go next we don't know but it's upwards and he was progressive last year when we didn't overrace him and we won't do that this year - Dan Skelton, trainer

quotes.race: Garthwest Chase (A Novices' Limited Handicap)
quotes.quote: Bennys King has only had two runs for us and has done well so far. There's a nice two-and-a-half mile handicap for him at Warwick in February - Tom Messenger, assistant trainer.

quotes.race: Douglas Family Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: Bennys King has been knocking on the door and the step up in trip has helped massively. I was keen to make it a bit of a test and he's stayed on to the line - Charlie Deutsch, jockey.

stable_tour.quote: He's very good around Ascot and goes back there on Saturday. It may be that the handicapper needs to give him a chance but, when he does, there's still a big day in him. 16-11-21

runners.name: Bothwell Bridge
runners.comment: Held by Bennys King and Autonomous Cloud on their Leicester clash in February
runners.spotlight: Winning chaser for Nicky Henderson; remains a capable pointer but at these weights he's held by Bennys King and Autonomous Cloud on their Leicester clash in February.

quotes.race: Betfair Daily Rewards Novices' Limited Handicap Chase (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: I'm not sure Bothwell Bridge wants three miles at the moment, but he loves soft ground. His jumping is his greatest asset and the others were trying to press on the gallop, and he could sit still and make it in the air. He had a good blow and will come on a fair bit. I suspect we'll go for a novice chase with a penalty next - Nicky Henderson, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: We've always thought a bit of him and he was brilliant on his chasing debut at Sandown in December, but he wasn't so good after that and we never got him back. However, he's still got plenty of potential and he's grown again, so there's optimism he can regain that form. 24-10-22

runners.name: Captain Tommy
runners.comment: Ran at Kempton on Tuesday when remote second behind a runaway winner; non-runner.
runners.spotlight: Finished tailed off in this 12 months ago; has recently won two small-field hunter chases (3m1f/2m4f) but finished second behind a runaway winner at Kempton on Tuesday; non-runner.

quotes.race: Sky Sports Racing Sky 415 Staffordshire Plate Handicap Chase (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: It's a wonderful prize to win and being out of the handicap didn't make a difference. Captain Tommy was fit when we got him and the change of scenery has worked for him - David Bridgewater, trainer.

quotes.race: Download The Star Sports App Now! Novices' Hurdle
quotes.quote: Captain Tommy wants good ground; it was not his ground at Fontwell last time. He's got a great attitude and will stay further. He'll probably stay in through the summer and I don't know how good he's going to be, but maybe he might be good enough for some of those nice races at Market Rasen - Harry Whittington, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: He produced a good performance when second on his penultimate start at Bangor. He missed the last and I like the winner, Manofthemountain, a lot. He just hated the quick ground at Wincanton on Thursday, but I'm sure he'll bounce back on softer ground next time. He's economical over his fences. 09-11-20

runners.name: Dorking Cock

prev_owners.owner: S R B Crawford/S F McElroy
Galloping On The South Downs Partnership

runners.comment: 33-1 when never a factor in this two years ago and a similar scenario seems likely
runners.spotlight: Hasn't been running badly in Ireland this year but the form isn't strong enough to warrant a second glance in this race, in which he was never a factor two years ago.

quotes.race: Bar One Racing "Bet 10 Euros Get 50 Euros Sign Up Offer" Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: Dorking Cock is back to his normal self again and for the age of him he is not overly raced. The hunter chase scene at the moment is very hot and I thought he was well treated for a handicap - Stuart Crawford, trainer.

quotes.race: Introducing Racing TV Handicap Hurdle (Qualifier For The Northern Lights Two Mile Hurdle Series)
quotes.quote: Dorking Cock will never get to run in a 0-115 again so we had to chance it and it paid off. He deserves a break now and we'll look for a big handicap at the end of the season - Tom Lacey, trainer.

quotes.race: starsports.bet Conditional Jockeys' Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: The penny is just dropping with Dorking Cock. Two miles round here on this ground was always going to be right up his street. He is still learning but going the right way - Tom Lacey, trainer.

runners.name: Evas Oskar
runners.comment: Formerly smart but he'll need to find plenty on his recent hunter chase exploits
runners.spotlight: Running well in the 2023 Grand National when he unseated at the 21st; confined to only four runs in the meantime and he'll need to find plenty on his recent hunter chase exploits (narrowly beaten by Captain Tommy last time).

quotes.race: Dahlbury Handicap Chase (Premier Handicap) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: The Welsh National is definitely a thought, why not? If it came up soft we would definitely look at it. The view was if Eva's Oskar didn't come here and win he wasn't going to win a Welsh National. I said if we win at Cheltenham we can go with a penalty if we want to. He would need to take another step forward to win a Welsh National but a longer trip and softer ground would put more things in our favour - Tim Vaughan, trainer.

quotes.race: Jewson Handicap Chase (Premier Handicap) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: It was a lovely run and while it's a shame we couldn't quite get our noses in front, there was nothing more we could have asked from Eva's Oskar. We'll probably consider the likes of the Welsh National and we did think about the cross-country race here as well. They're two options at the moment but I think something like an Eider Chase would be right up his street, just something ever so slightly below that level of the Welsh National. If we can get him up to his eyes in muck and over as far a trip as possible, that would be perfect - Tim Vaughan, trainer.

quotes.race: "The Smart Money's On Coral" Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: I was optimistic about Eva's Oskar before Cheltenham last time, but that day was a slow pace from the off and not enough of a stamina test for him. This time they went a good even gallop. He's a nice animal, reasonably well handicapped, and these are his conditions. He's won on better, but I think this plays to his strengths staying; that's what he loves. I think he's going to be a chaser who will get better and better with time - he's very well-bred. Today was the plan, but he's still a novice so I'd love to go for something like the River Don to see if he's that level - Tim Vaughan, trainer.

runners.name: Famous Clermont
runners.breeder: S C E A Elevage De Clermont
runners.comment: Ran out a comfortable winner of this two years ago and everything again looks ideal
runners.spotlight: Smart performer who can be vulnerable to stronger stayers at 3m+ but this intermediate trip is ideal and he was pretty much in cruise control throughout when a very comfortable winner of this race two years ago (good to soft); returns in good order and another big run looks on the cards.

quotes.race: Randox Foxhunters' Open Hunters' Chase
quotes.quote: Three miles two stretches Famous Clermont a little bit and we were rolling the dice going there (to the St James's Place Festival Hunters' Chase). This was the target from the start of the season. Rupert Nuttall has done a fantastic job with his jumping as his jumping was very dodgy to start with - Chris Barber, trainer.

quotes.race: Betfred Steve Hope Walrus Open Hunters' Chase
quotes.quote: That was impressive. We knew Famous Clermont had the engine and we've just done a bit with his jumping. He's grown up now and we're unlocking where we want to go. Cheltenham is definitely on the cards and Will [Biddick] is keen to go to Aintree. All options are open and we'll take stock and have a look - Chris Barber, trainer.

runners.name: Fix At All
runners.comment: Others have more impressive CVs and he made a quiet stable debut
runners.spotlight: A six-time winner under rules (four chases) but others have more impressive CVs and he made a quiet stable debut in a hunter chase at Carlisle.

stable_tour.quote: He's back in. We might look at the Aintree Foxhunters' with him if we can get him qualified in time. It's not guaranteed but a possibility. He ran well around Market Rasen and his form is good. He should make his presence felt in races like the Summer Plate. 06-03-24

runners.name: Frere Darmes
runners.comment: Recent defeats at the hands of Bardenstown Lad and Captain Tommy do not bode well
runners.spotlight: Has won a 2m5f handicap and 3m hunter chase this season but defeats at the hands of Bardenstown Lad and Captain Tommy in his last two races do not bode well for his prospects here.

quotes.race: Coral Racing Club Novices' Limited Handicap Chase (For The Fulke Walwyn Trophy) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Frere d'Armes has got a fabulous attitude and jumping is obviously his game. He was impressive at Kempton last time. It's much better ground today but that didn't worry us as he's an accurate mover - I don't think he's a really soft ground horse.  It was a brilliant performance and I'll need a vet's opinion on a cut he has on his leg. I hope it's cosmetic and I'm not in a massive rush with him, so I don't think we want to ask him too many big questions too soon. I'd rather give him time and the cut will force that, but I don't think that's a  bad thing. Even if he didn't run until February I wouldn't mind and we'll see how the novice looks, but something like the Pendil could suit - Dan Skelton, trainer.

quotes.race: EBF "National Hunt" Novices' Hurdle (Qualifier) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Frere D'Armes has done it well. He bumped into a nice one the last day. I couldn't have asked for any more from him and it's a good platform to build on - Harry Skelton, jockey.

stable_tour.quote: He ran pretty well in a good handicap chase over two miles and one furlong at Ascot last time. He's been consistent but hasn't won for a while, although I'm sure it's coming his way. 12-11-24

runners.name: Go Go Geronimo
runners.comment: His fifth defeat in hunter chases when beaten in a small field at Fakenham 20 days ago
runners.spotlight: Likeably consistent but it was his fifth defeat in hunter chases when beaten in a small field at Fakenham 20 days ago (first-time visor).

runners.name: Gracchus De Balme
runners.comment: Poor last time but a repeat of his Haydock second would see him competitive
runners.spotlight: Ran poorly behind Bennys King at Leicester last time and the heavy ground shouldn't have bothered him; a repeat of his previous second to My Drogo (2m6f, good to soft) would see him competitive.

quotes.race: Derrygrath Maiden Hurdle
quotes.quote: Gracchus de Balme was helped by the ground coming back in trip. He battled well from the last. He'll get further and could go up to 3m - JJ Slevin, rider

stable_tour.quote: He won his beginners' chase well at Roscommon before finishing second at Listowel and he'll run in a novice chase over Christmas. He looks like he is getting his jumping together and looks like a horse who could be progressive as he goes up in distance. We definitely want to try two and a half miles with him again. 27-11-23

runners.name: Jet Plane
runners.comment: Behind My Drogo at Haydock where a late mistake didn't cost him the race
runners.spotlight: Did well in handicaps last season; it was a winnable hunter chase in which he justified favouritism in February and a fortnight later he came up short behind My Drogo at Haydock, where a late mistake didn't cost him the race; looks vulnerable.

quotes.race: Central Roofing Novices' Handicap Chase (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: I thought we could win, I'm not going to lie. We learnt at Worcester Jet Plane wanted a proper trip for the first time. Bridget [Andrews] rode him and he couldn't be any further forwards but he couldn't go any faster so we knew he wanted three miles and here we are. This was worth 18,200GBP, if they keep putting that money up then we'll keep targeting these races - Dan Skelton, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: He's a highly consistent horse and ran really well when placed at Wetherby on his reappearance. He has a great attitude and all he does is try his best, so I'd like to win a good one with him. A race like the Rowland Meyrick, back at Wetherby on Boxing Day, might be ideal. 12-11-24

runners.name: Joker De Mai

prev_owners.owner: J-P Monclin, F Fonteyne & Ecurie Equus Racing
Arnaud-Alain Ameline, Florent Fonteyne Et Al

runners.comment: Recent win was over 2m and others will probably be stronger stayers at this distance
runners.spotlight: Winning chaser in France; has done well over hurdles and fences for current yard, finishing third (2m5f) and first (2m) in his two hunter chases; it's likely that others will be stronger stayers at this distance.

quotes.race: Leicestershire And Derbyshire Yeomanry Open Hunters' Chase
quotes.quote: I didn't really want Joker De Mai to run but Josh Moore rang me yesterday, told me Jamie [Moore] had done a bit of work with him around Lingfield and said, 'David, you have to run this horse.' - David Maxwell, jockey and owner.

stable_tour.quote: Our main objective is the Foxhunters' at Aintree. He has good chase form at Auteuil, so we'll run him in a Class 3 handicap this side of Christmas and everything after that revolves around trying to get him qualified for Aintree. He's an exciting horse for David [Maxwell, owner-rider] to go hunter chasing with. 01-11-24

runners.name: Lifetime Ambition
runners.comment: Classy operator who has form over these fences and won his last two points easily
runners.spotlight: Classy operator for Jessica Harrington and has form over these fences having finished fourth in the 2022 Grand Sefton; continues to pay his way in points, winning both his races this year with the minimum of fuss under today's rider Rob James; major player.

quotes.race: Jack Tyner Memorial Hunters Chase
quotes.quote: Lifetime Ambition is a lovely horse to have. He doesn't qualify for Aintree this year. He might go to Punchestown, if the griound is heavy we will wait for Killarney - Pat Doyle, trainer

quotes.race: BetVictor Hugh McMahon Memorial Novice Chase (Grade 3)
quotes.quote: It was Lifetime Ambition's first start over three miles on the track and Robert (Power, jockey) said he wanted every bit of it. He'll have an entry in the the novice handicap chase over two miles and five furlongs at the Punchestown festival, as well as the Grade 1 novice chase over three miles and one (furlong). Robert said he's a proper Grand National horse in the making for Aintree next year and that he loves that nicer ground. We might campaign him differently next year; have him ready for the autumn, keep off the heavy ground and have him for a spring campaign. Today he was jumping like he did at Down Royal on his debut over fences - Kate Harrington, assistant to Jessica Harrington, trainer.

quotes.race: Tote Ten To Follow Beginners Chase
quotes.quote: Lifetime Ambition got his act together at the end of last season and when we schooled him over fences his jumping was different league. He could be exciting. He'll probably get an entry for the Drinmore - Kate Harrington, assistant trainer.

quotes.race: I.N.H. Stallion Owners EBF Maiden Hurdle (Div II)
quotes.quote: Lifetime Ambition deserved that. It's a surprise that he hasn't won before now, he has run into a few good horses. When he jumps a fence you will see a much improved horse - Robbie Power, jockey.

stable_tour.quote: I can't wait to go over fences with him - his schooling has been magic. He won his last two races over hurdles and wants a bit of nice ground, which is why I'm happy to get him out earlier. He was just no good on heavy ground last winter and then came alive in the spring, with his best run when bolting up at Punchestown. He's declared for Down Royal on Friday and we just hope there isn't too much rain for him. He'll be a two-and-a-half mile novice chaser and we hope he's Graded class. 29-10-21

runners.name: Master Templar
runners.comment: This demands a career best by some margin; blinkers replace cheekpieces
runners.spotlight: Odds-on when beating Bardenstown Lad and Bothwell Bridge in successive points through the winter but he was only fifth of seven back in a hunter chase last month; this demands a career best by some margin; blinkers replace cheekpieces.

runners.name: Milan Forth
runners.comment: Made it 2-2 in hunter chases last time at Down Royal and this 6yo could be improving
runners.spotlight: Won three points but lost six; however, finished a close third to last month's Cheltenham sixth Carnfunnock on latest defeat and has since made it 2-2 in hunter chases when a comfortable winner at Down Royal (2m3f, good; stays 3m) on debut for Adrian Murray; this 6yo could be improving.

runners.name: My Drogo
runners.comment: Grade 1-winning hurdler and rolled back the years with recent hunter chase win at Haydock
runners.spotlight: In the same colours when winning a Grade 1 novices' hurdle at this meeting for Dan Skelton four years ago; subsequent progress has been stalled by lengthy absences but he looked back on good terms with himself when not overly troubled to see off Gracchus De Balme and Jet Plane in a hunter chase at Haydock in February; could be dangerous.

quotes.race: Walrus Open Hunters' Chase
quotes.quote: My Drogo stayed on well and the class is there. We were initially thinking about Cheltenham but we're not sure whether he'll get up the hill, and I'll have to talk to the owner. He's jumped mega and we're back on track, so it's very exciting - Edward William Walker, trainer.

quotes.race: bearrene.com Novices' Chase (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Harry was happy with My Drogo. We are all relieved it is over and that it is out of the way. He got a little keen after the third. We are not afraid to run him and we will have to give him a bit more experience. We will enter for The Dipper and if it is not The Dipper we will go somewhere else. It would be two and a half (miles) at the Festival as you couldn't dare go three and I think over two you would have to be super aggressive - Dan Skelton, trainer.

quotes.race: SSS Super Alloys Novices' Chase (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: My Drogo jumped the fence fine and then crumbled on landing and slid. I was delighted with him the whole way around, he jumped beautifully. He was a bit big at a couple down the back, the first ditch and the next plain. He jumped the ditch at the top of the hill better than the mare and came back onto the bridle. He'd have won we all know that. He's alright - Dan Skelton, trainer.

quotes.race: Betway Mersey Novices' Hurdle (Grade 1) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: We're a long way off the Gold Cup, but it is a dream. My Drogo is a horse with an awful lot of ability and has had a fantastic season, progressing all year. The owners just want to make him into the best possible chaser we can, so we decided to miss Cheltenham and come here. To think he only made his debut in a bumper in October, it's remarkable what he's done. Just keeping the lid on him is the main thing as he's quite highly strung - Dan Skelton, trainer.

quotes.race: bet365 Premier Novices' Hurdle (Grade 2) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: My Drogo is a lovely horse, we're very lucky to have him. The plan for him is Aintree: he'll have entries in the two-mile and two-and-a-half-mile races. I think he's very progressive, to do that under a Class 1 penalty is quite impressive. Hopefully he's got a big future. He can get a little edgy on a workday but the really impressive thing about him is that as the season's progressed he's got stronger and heavier. We don't weigh our horses but if we did I'd say he's probably a heavier, better horse than he was when he ran in a bumper at Cheltenham in the autumn. He's come a long way since that day - Dan Skelton, trainer.

quotes.race: Sky Bet Supreme Trial Novices' Hurdle (Grade 2) (Registered as The Kennel Gate) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: My Drogo didn't surprise me because he's high-class, but the improvement with his jumping from Newbury to today has surprised me. We'd done loads of schooling with him but the improvement from that to today was incredible. We've got no wild ambitions as a hurdler and his ability isn't going to force us into making mistakes. We could look to step him up in trip and he could go to Huntingdon for the Sidney Banks, perhaps miss Cheltenham and then go to Aintree. If Cheltenham was really soft, we might go there, and I wouldn't be afraid over two and a half miles of running him on better ground - Dan Skelton, trainer.

quotes.race: Watch Racing Free Online At Ladbrokes "National Hunt" Maiden Hurdle (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: I was expecting plenty from My Drogo especially after his good run at Cheltenham. I know he was 50-1, but that didn't reflect what we thought would happen that day. We're not necessarily known for our bumper horses at Cheltenham, which is why he went off a big price, but at home he's always been very precocious. I think it shows what a big engine he's got to overcome a lot of that (some modest jumping). The favourite was too keen to run to any sort of race, so what the form is worth time will tell, but I think mine is a very good horse. I think we'll go one more race low key before something fancy because I don't think he's ready for that type of race or day, so we'll look after him. He's going to be a chaser and will end up a two-and-a-half-mile horse as we get into the spring - Dan Skelton, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: The only positive about his last run in the Old Roan Chase at Aintree is that it's in the rearview mirror. That said, it was important to get him out on some acceptable ground on his first start back from injury, and while he never really got into the race he wasn't actually beaten too far. He's got some phenomenal form in the book and we can work hard on him now ahead of his next start in the Peterborough Chase. 21-11-23

runners.name: Ontheropes
runners.comment: Even Cheltenham's extended 3m2f seemed too sharp a test last month
runners.spotlight: Contested some strong handicaps when with Willie Mullins, winning the 2021 Munster National and not beaten far in last season's Scottish National; however, even Cheltenham's extended 3m2f seemed too sharp a test last month and it's unlikely that he'll have the gears for this.

quotes.race: JT McNamara Ladbrokes Munster National Handicap Chase (Grade A)
quotes.quote: It's my first time riding Ontheropes, and in fairness he was very straightforward. He got away well, had a little peck at the first but after that he jumped super everywhere. I was always comfortable, I had a lovely position, and I was conscious not to let him try to sprint too much. I built it up from the top of the hill and he was good at the last and he was always holding on a bit - Sean O'Keeffe, rider.

stable_tour.quote: He was very good in the Munster National on his first start after a break. His aim is the Ladbrokes Trophy at Newbury and it's so far so good in terms of his preparation. 02-11-21

His runs have been okay and he needs to hit better form. He is another who does not appreciate the heavy winter ground. He won the Munster National well and is a proper staying chaser so these are the races I will be entering him in over the next couple of years. 09-03-22

runners.name: Percussion
runners.comment: He has form figures of 33237 in handicaps over the Grand National fences
runners.spotlight: Will need to step up on his recent hunter chase efforts but he has form figures of 33237 in handicaps over the Grand National fences; a bold show would be no surprise.

quotes.race: Boylesports Becher Handicap Chase (Premier Handicap) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: I was quite worried about the ground as it was ten times worse than his run here last month. Percussion jumped class and I'm delighted with him. He nearly got up for second. He's very genuine and galloped all the way to the line - Laura Morgan, trainer

quotes.race: BoyleSports Grand Sefton Handicap Chase (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: It was a great run and I'm delighted. Percussion loves it here and we'll come back for the Becher. The ground could have been better for him and he probably wants further than two miles-five. It will be exciting coming back - Laura Morgan, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: He's as genuine as they come and his first two runs this season were fabulous efforts, finishing third in both the Grand Sefton and the Becher at Aintree. He was only fifth at Kempton at the weekend but I hope at some point there's a big Saturday race in him. We could be looking at the Scottish National or the Midlands National but we'll have to wait and see. The going isn't a key concern as he goes on slow and quicker ground. 18-01-23

runners.name: Presentandcounting
runners.comment: Beaten in recent hunter chases won by Bardenstown Lad and Captain Tommy
runners.spotlight: Beat just two rivals to win a Catterick 3m1f handicap chase in November and has been below that level in hunter chases won by Bardenstown Lad and Captain Tommy, latterly in the hands of Derek O'Connor; up against it.

quotes.race: Price Promise At bet365 Novices' Hurdle (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: It has taken Presentandcounting a while to get his confidence back after a fall at Ayr in the spring, but he was entitled to win like that with his rating. He will stay three miles so I was keen to make it a test - Brian Hughes, jockey.

stable_tour.quote: He's a fine-looking, talented horse with a good pedigree who's still very raw. He raced a bit back to front at Cheltenham and you can't do that round there. I think the only thing that will steady him is a fence. He's done a lot of schooling over them and I think that's what we'll do now. He wouldn't want bad ground. 09-11-20

Our biggest earner so far this season and most prolific with four wins. He did us proud last summer, when among his wins was the valuable Fixed Brush Hurdle Series Final at Worcester in September. Last time out he finished third in the Grade 3 Persian War Hurdle at Chepstow, after which we gave him a well-deserved break, but he is back now and will be ready for when we get the better ground. He will have a busy spring and if I can get him there I know his owners, The Turner Family, would love him to run at Cheltenham. That will be the plan and we would be looking at something like the Coral Cup or Martin Pipe Hurdle, but after that I think he could go chasing again. 09-02-23

runners.name: Pyleigh Court
runners.comment: There's nothing on his CV that entitles him to trouble the best of these
runners.spotlight: Record of 3-7 in points; well beaten in his first two hunter chases before winning an uncompetitive race at Leicester (2m4f, heavy; effective on good); there's nothing on his CV that entitles him to trouble the best of these.

runners.name: Ramillies
runners.comment: Has a modest rules strike-rate for one of his ability and looks a declining force
runners.spotlight: Modest rules strike-rate for one of his ability and he looks a declining force; pulled up in his latest hunter chase and before that he was brushed aside by Willitgoahead at Thurles.

quotes.race: Irish Stallion Farms EBF Beginners Chase
quotes.quote: Ramillies has always been a good work horse but he has nalways probably needed nice ground and a fence. He has always been running in good company but just needed to put it together - Willie Mullins, trainer

quotes.race: I.N.H. Stallion Owners EBF Maiden Hurdle
quotes.quote: Ramillies showed improvement from last time. He just doesn't have a huge amount of respect for hurdles and probably wants a fence. We'll maybe look at the Albert Bartlett but he'd want to jump a lot better than he did there. He'd be an outsider for that but I think he'd acquit himself well. He was staying on the whole way to the end and that little circuit [on the inside course] here wouldn't suit him. I think he'd be way better again on a bigger track in a more competitive race - Willie Mullins, trainer.

quotes.race: Midland Legal Solicitors INH Flat Race
quotes.quote: He's a very nice horse. He did what I was hoping he'd do last year. He looks top drawer and I'd imagine we'll look to come back here for the festival. The Grade 2 bumper there would have to be the target - Willie Mullins, trainer of Ramillies

stable_tour.quote: He seems to have improved and I think he'll progress for jumping fences as well. He probably wants nice ground, rather than heavy winter conditions, but he's another who could go well in our staying novice chasing division. 07-11-22

He's been first past the post in both of his races over fences this season, although he was demoted last time at Naas. That was over 3m1f and he could go for either the National Hunt Chase or Brown Advisory. 08-03-23

runners.name: Senior Citizen
runners.comment: Placed in a Grand Sefton and a Topham; easily won his latest point; could play a part
runners.spotlight: Placed in a Grand Sefton and a Topham for Alan King so these fences hold no fears; returned from a lengthy break to win a February point by 15l and he's had wind surgery since; this veteran could have a part to play.

quotes.race: bet365 Handicap Chase
quotes.quote: I'm delighted to get Senior Citizen back on track. Alan has done a great job to freshen him up and try a new trip and the cheekpieces helped him. He felt like the best horse the whole way round and he got the trip well - then when they came to him, he really picked up - Adrian Heskin, jockey.

quotes.race: Symphony Group Prelude Handicap Chase (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: That was very nice. Senior Citizen is a good horse fresh and he was on a nice mark for the start of the season. Aintree is the plan. He's jumped well round there twice and they've brought the race [Grand Sefton] forward a month this year so the nicer ground will be a benefit to him hopefully - Adrian Heskin, jockey.

quotes.race: Faucets & Rada For Commercial Washrooms Maiden Hurdle
quotes.quote: That was a lovely performance from Senior Citizen as he ran a bit free with me early on in the race so to win the way he did I would say that he is a very nice horse for the future over hurdles and later in his career fences - Adrian Heskin, jockey.

stable_tour.quote: He seems to love the Grand National fences and he's entered again in the Grand Sefton Chase, which he finished second in last year. He stays a bit better nowadays so we could look at the Becher Chase afterwards but he doesn't want the ground too heavy. 19-10-22

He's become something of a specialist over the Grand National fences and he's being aimed again at the Grand Sefton Chase, which he finished second in last year. He stays a bit better nowadays so we could look at the Becher Chase afterwards but he doesn't want the ground too heavy. 07-11-22

runners.name: Willewonga
runners.comment: On the balance of this season's form he has no more than place aspirations
runners.spotlight: Might have beaten Eva's Oskar at Bangor had he not clouted the last fence and he again found one too good at Southwell latest (again over 3m); in points this season he's been beaten by Gracchus De Balme and Bardenstown Lad; has no more than place aspirations.

runners.name: Willitgoahead
runners.comment: Fast-improving 7yo who stayed on well to reach the frame at Cheltenham last month
runners.spotlight: Very progressive in Ireland since October and, after making light work of Ramillies at Thurles in January, he was bought to join Gordon Elliott; made a highly encouraging start for his new yard when a boxing-on third (from off the pace) in the big hunter chase at Cheltenham where again he impressed with his jumping; everything points towards another competitive show.

runners.name: Yccs Portocervo

prev_owners.owner: Mrs M C Litton & Countess Cathcart
Mrs M C Litton & Mrs F D McInnes Skinner

runners.comment: Knows how to win but he's still well down the pecking order in a race this competitive
runners.spotlight: Can be forgiven his latest run behind Joker De Mai as 2m was too short, and at about this trip he won two hunter chases and a handicap last year; he's still well down the pecking order in a race this competitive.

quotes.race: ABP 'Summer Plate Trial' Handicap Chase
quotes.quote: It was a fair effort. I thought Mr Handicapper was mean putting Yccs Portocervo to a career high, but he's proved that sometimes you have to let the horses do the talking. He's a pleasure to ride and was incredibly game - Sm Twiston-Davies, rider, speaking to Racing TV.

runners.name: Yippee Ki Yay
runners.owner: Mr And Mrs Ben Herbert And Family

prev_owners.owner: Mr And Mrs Ben Herbert And Family

runners.comment: Won two hunter chases last year but those wins were in much easier races
runners.spotlight: Won two hunter chases last year but those wins were in much easier races and he doesn't look in the same form now.

stable_tour.quote: He won two hunter chases last season at Exeter and Kelso. He'll probably have some hunter chase engagements again, although whether he'll be up to top-class hunter chases with penalties and whatever is a bit doubtful. But he certainly improved from his first to his second season with us and I can see him improving again. He seems much more mature now and it was a terrific win at Kelso in May. 28-11-24

2:55.race_name: Brooklands Golden Miller Chronograph Bowl Chase (Grade 1) (GBB Race)
2:55.going_detailed: GOOD TO SOFT, Good in places on Mildmay course (GoingStick: Mildmay Hurdle 5.0, Mildmay Chase 5.4, Grand National course 5.2) (Watering)

runners.name: Ahoy Senor
runners.comment: Has performed well in this race for last two years, taking record at this meeting to 1122
runners.spotlight: Comes with some risk having failed to complete in his last three starts (had wind surgery prior to latest); however, comes alive at Aintree and has performed well in this race for the last two years, taking form figures at this meeting to 1122 (gained the wins in Grade 1 novice events over hurdles/fences); big player provided that pattern is sustained.

quotes.race: Virgin Bet Old Roan Limited Handicap Chase (Grade 2) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: That's the best race Ahoy Senor has run first time. He's an unbelievable talent and I'm delighted. You want to win every race but he has to be made. You have to have patience with him. He was galloping all the way to the line and if he can do that from three or four out at Haydock, then he has a chance. God willing, we can get to Haydock; that's always been the intention. I'd love to get him back to a Gold Cup, but he's got to learn to race like that - Peter Scudamore, trainer's assistant.

quotes.race: William Hill Bowl Chase (Grade 1) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: It's like he's won. Ahoy Senor's jumping was phenomenal, he travelled brilliantly. He's back. I think it's the time of year but he loves it round here, it's a flat track and that really suits him. We'll look at the Oaksey Trophy at Sandown. He's come of age now, he can travel, he doesn't have to be in front. He's a lot more tractable and his jumping was fabulous - Lucinda Russell, trainer.

quotes.race: Alder Hey Aintree Bowl Chase (Grade 1) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: I'm delighted with Ahoy Senor, he's so good. He just got tired going to the last. He got tired eight strides out from the last and that's why he made a mistake. But Shishkin is a fabulous horse, he's a flying machine. That will be it for the season now. We'll devise a nice plan for next season but I'm sure we'll be back here - Lucinda Russell, trainer.

quotes.race: Paddy Power Cotswold Chase (Grade 2) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Ahoy Senor just a monster. In my mind we would take a lead but Derek (Fox) said he was going to go forward. He's just fantastic with the horse and they both trust each other. It's just nice to see our monster back. He's just starting to grow up and he's a phenomenal horse. We'll have to go for the Gold Cup. We said we would see what happens today but I think he's earned his place there - Lucinda Russell, trainer.

quotes.race: bet365 Charlie Hall Chase (Grade 2) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Derek said that Ahoy Senor ran a bit free and it took his energy away. I'm just delighted he's back safe - that's the important thing. We'll see how he is over the next few days. It's his first run of the season. I think we'll stick with the plans that we had and probably go to Aintree for the Many Clouds Chase - Lucinda Russell, trainer.

quotes.race: Betway Mildmay Novices' Chase (Grade 1) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Ahoy Senor is a serious classy horse and I think he's still learning on the job. He was pretty free early on and then he got into a nice rhythm jumping and he's done it really well. The best I ever felt with him was over hurdles here last year and for some reason this track might just play to his strengths. He's been a marvellous horse all season and he hasn't run a bad race - Derek Fox, rider. You are dealing with an elite athlete and I just wanted him to prove it. That's why I get emotional. He's as good as I've come across, and I'm talking about Carvills Hill and Granville (Again) there - Peter Scudamore, assistant trainer.

quotes.race: Brown Advisory Novices' Chase (Grade 1) (Registered As The Broadway Novices' Chase) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: I'm absolutely delighted with Ahoy Senor. That's made a man of him today. He's won his novice chases by jumping better than anything else and it's been at a steadier pace. He had to really fight out there - Lucinda Russell, trainer.

quotes.race: William Hill Towton Novices' Chase (Grade 2) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: I'm absolutely delighted with that. Ahoy Senor took a few fences to warm up but this is a brilliant track to bring him to as it's a galloping course with big fences. He's a huge horse and he needs big fences to respect them. We didn't lose anything in defeat at Kempton and he will probably go for the Brown Advisory. He is still a novice, he's got an immense talent but we're still crafting him - Lucinda Russell, trainer.

quotes.race: Ladbrokes John Francome Novices' Chase (Grade 2) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Ahoy Senor has got no experience but has jumped round there and it's the ability he has. It's phenomenal to be part of it. We knew he was a good horse at home; you just have to look at his stride and how he gallops. He was entitled to win on his handicap mark. The Kauto Star is on the agenda - and he did jump a bit right. He's not the finished article yet - Lucinda Russell, trainer.

quotes.race: Doom Bar Sefton Novices' Hurdle (Grade 1) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Isn't Ahoy Senor just a super horse? He just gallops and jumps. I saw his point-to-point win and he did the same. This was only his second hurdles run but we had such confidence in him at home. He ran so well over two miles four at Ayr and we knew he'd keep on galloping. I can't believe we managed to get him beat in a bumper but jumping takes him to another level. I can't wait for him to go chasing - Lucinda Russell, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: His main aim before Christmas is the Betfair Chase, so he went to Aintree for the Old Roan and we were thrilled. It was the best race he's ever run for us first time out and will have put him spot on. Sometimes things just don't go your way and they didn't last season - it was small things like foot problems and abscesses and we didn't get that really clear run. He seems much stronger and more robust now and I think we've sorted out his jumping. You'd hope he can be competitive in the best chases like the Cheltenham Gold Cup and the Aintree Bowl again. 30-10-24

What a wonderful horse to have in the stable. He progressed all last season, which culminated in victory in the Grade 1 Mildmay Novices' Chase at Aintree, following a brave second to L'Homme Presse in the Brown Advisory at Cheltenham. It was in the spring that he really made serious progress and it looks as if history is about to repeat itself this term. At home he gives the impression that he's really starting to come to himself again. It looks to be all systems go again and he'll run in the Cotswold Chase at Cheltenham on Saturday or we may wait a few days and save him for the Denman Chase at Newbury. After that all roads will lead to the Gold Cup followed by the Bowl at Aintree. He loves that time of the year and he's set for a busy few weeks when we get there. 25-01-23

runners.name: Djelo
runners.comment: Well suited by 2m7f in the Denman Chase on penultimate run; unexposed over staying trips
runners.spotlight: Always behind and well beaten in the Ryanair but may benefit from this step back up in distance, having been well suited by 2m7f in the Denman Chase at Newbury (one of two soft-ground Grade 2 wins this term) the time before; largely progressive prior to latest start and unexposed over staying trips.

quotes.race: William Hill Bet10 Get10 On Racing Denman Chase (Grade 2) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: We've got Djelo in the Ryanair and Champion Chase and I would say it will be straight to the Ryanair. We left the tactics to Charlie [Deutsch, jockey] and we didn't want him to be too keen, so he dropped him right out and settled beautifully. Once he set him alight, the turbo kicked in very quickly - Venetia Williams, trainer.

quotes.race: Trustatrader Peterborough Chase (Grade 2) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Djelo is so clever at the obstacles - whether it's long, short, tight or whatever he's so quick and he's such an intelligent horse.
