He was third at the Cheltenham Festival in the Turners and he won three races last season, but he's been progressive ever since his attention was turned to fences and let's hope that's continuing - Venetia Williams, trainer.

quotes.race: BetMGM Haldon Gold Cup Handicap Chase (Grade 2) (Limited Handicap Chase) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Djelo has done very well. He just had a bit of bad luck. He met the last one on a bit of an awkward stride and he met a few like that. He just ran out of racecourse to catch him. In fairness the winner was always cantering, but I have to be really pleased as he has run a super race and he has galloped all the way to the line - Venetia Williams, trainer.

quotes.race: Howden Noel Novices' Chase (Grade 2) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: I'm very pleased. Like many of ours, once they go chasing they tend to step up. We always thought Djelo was a nice horse. He won a low-key race fairly easily last season and then didn't manage to progress but with these young, potential chasers you just have to let it go. He's not the biggest horse in the world but he's very nimble. Charlie came back in with a big smile on his face. I think he could go up or down in trip as he's showing speed and a degree of stamina. We haven't tested that stamina hugely yet, but he's galloped right to the line -  Venetia Williams, trainer.

quotes.race: BoyleSports Money Back 2nd Meeting Handicap Chase
quotes.quote: Djelo is really hardy and kept finding. He jumped well and has lots of scope. He stays well and has grown up a bit - Charlie Deutsch, jockey.

stable_tour.quote: He won his first three races last season, including a Grade 2 novice chase at Ascot in December. He was favourite for the Lightning Novices' Chase at Lingfield but got totally wiped out by one of his rivals at the first fence and was lucky to escape any injury. After that he was second in the Scilly Isles and third in the Turners, so he had a strong season. He's versatile from two to two and a half miles but he's not short of pace and I see no reason to go looking over further. All being well, we'll probably start him off at Exeter in the Haldon Gold Cup on November 8. 23-10-24

runners.name: Embassy Gardens
runners.comment: Came up short in the Irish Gold Cup, taking overall Grade 1 form figures to P6P6
runners.spotlight: Stablemate of Gaelic Warrior; record of 3-6 over fences features a very useful performance at Tramore (2m7f, heavy) on New Year's Day; subsequently came up short in the Irish Gold Cup, taking overall Grade 1 form figures to P6P6; still has something to prove at this level.

quotes.race: O'Driscoll's Irish Whiskey New Year's Day Chase (Grade 3)
quotes.quote: I said to Michael [O'Sullivan, jockey] to bounce out and be positive if no-one was going on. I thought Embassy Gardens was a Grand National horse last year and that's why we went for the National Hunt Chase, but I'm not so sure those extended trips suit him. He might be better being ridden positively over two and a half to three miles. He seems to run better fresh, so we'll have to factor all that in as to where he goes next - Willie Mullins, trainer, speaking from Fairyhouse.

quotes.race: Finlay Ford At Naas Novice Chase (Grade 3)
quotes.quote: Embassy Gardens loves jumping and that's one of his best assets. He stays and he's learned to settle from jumping fences. I think he can keep improving. He looks a natural for one of the staying novice chases at Cheltenham and nearer the time we'll decide which one - Willie Mullins, trainer.

quotes.race: Irish Stallion Farms EBF Beginners Chase
quotes.quote: Embassy Gardens had the perfect introduction there. He relaxed and jumped well. I didn't have to be hard on him. He raced properly and he did things right - Paul Townend, rider

quotes.race: W.T. O'Grady Memorial Irish EBF Novice Hurdle
quotes.quote: Embassy Gardens appreciated that step out in trip. I imagine the way he gallops through the line, he'll take up his date in the Albert Bartlett at Cheltenham - Willie Mullins, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: He looked for all the world that he was a perfect fit for the National Hunt Chase last season, given all he does is gallop and jump, but I think the trip caught him out. Those exertions told on him at Punchestown afterwards, when he was pulled up. I'd imagine we might bring him back in trip and he could be one for the Thyestes at Gowran. 25-11-24

We tried him over 2m and 2m4f to start with but it was when we upped him to 2m7f that he showed what he can do with a 35-length win at Thurles. He clearly appreciates a longer trip. He galloped them into the ground that day and heads for the Albert Bartlett. 08-03-23

runners.name: Gaelic Warrior
runners.comment: 2024 Arkle winner; sole attempt at about 3m resulted in his best hurdles performance
runners.spotlight: Impressive in last season's Arkle but has failed to reproduce that form kept to about 2m since; has good form beyond that trip and his sole attempt at about 3m resulted in his peak hurdles performance, namely an emphatic success in Grade 1 novice at Punchestown (yielding) two years ago; has the ability to play a huge role, provided the belated return to this sort of distance prompts a revival.

quotes.race: Paddy's Rewards Club Chase (Grade 1)
quotes.quote: Gaelic Warrior just took a blow before the third last and I had to sit on him, but he has run on well. The winner is hard fit and probably got away - Patrick Mullins, jockey.

quotes.race: My Pension Expert Arkle Challenge Trophy Novices' Chase (Grade 1) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Gaelic Warrior jumped a lot straighter, there were two fences he shifted right just to sort himself out. Stamina came into play today and we know he stays. I just pointed him the right way! That's the best ride I've got off Gaelic Warrior in a long time. He was very manageable once we got out on to the track. Willie's done an unbelievable job on him - Paul Townend, jockey, speaking to ITV Racing. You can see what a difference a hood made to him, he wasn't inclined to jump right and Paul could ride the race on him. I was sort of asking myself as he was coming down the hill, 'what were we doing in three-mile races last year with him?' I think he has enough class now to do two miles, and he will probably stick at that game now, after that performance - Willie Mullins, trainer, speaking to ITV Racing.

quotes.race: Guinness Faugheen Novice Chase (Grade 1)
quotes.quote: Two of Gaelic Warrior's defeats have been at Cheltenham going left-handed. Cheltenham doesn't really suit him. The Turners is run on the New course, which is not as tight as the Old course, but he is better going right-handed. Going left-handed at Leopardstown in February is one option, maybe we should try it and see. The way he jumps, this might be his best trip, perhaps two miles on soft ground. He is very versatile. A lot of credit goes to Rachel Robbins, who rides him out and looks after him - Patrick Mullins, jockey.

quotes.race: Ballymore Novices' Hurdle (Grade 1) (Registered As The Baring Bingham) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Gaelic Warrior took out his earplugs on the way to the start and he didn't settle as well as we'd want him to, but Patrick said he could go up to three miles. He'll be a big, strong chaser down the line - Willie Mullins, trainer.

quotes.race: Festina Lente Charity Liffey Handicap Hurdle (Grade B)
quotes.quote: Gaelic Warrior has a bit of class and he proved it there, to do that in a competitive handicap was very good. We always thought he had a serious engine and he's progressing all the time. He's in the Supreme and Ballymore, I'll have a good chat with Paul later on and see what direction we go with him.  We'll see what the fall out of this weekend is and see what we have for different races. He's inclined to go right but that seems to be only when he has the space to do that. He was very good even when he went right - Willie Mullins, trainer.

quotes.race: Munster Hurdle
quotes.quote: Gaelic Warrior was quite fresh in himself at the start but he was grand after that. He's a lovely horse, it was hard work out there and he is quite hard on himself. He prefers to go right handed - Paul Townend, rider.

quotes.race: Boodles Juvenile Handicap Hurdle (Registered as The Fred Winter) (Grade 3) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Gaelic Warrior ran a great race. On the whole he jumped well. We would have probably liked a bit more juice in the ground. He is a nice prospect for next season. It didn't help him how he jumped the last but that is racing. There was only a short head in it and you can if an and all day but he ran a great race. I hope there will be plenty of good days with him as he is a real jumping type. We will stay novice hurdling next season as he is still a maiden and he will be back here for the Ballymore next year - Willie Mullins, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: I was disappointed with him on Sunday. He looked to be going so average at the fifth-last and it looked like Paul might pull him up, and he said the same afterwards. He got his second wind and stayed on well then. The Ryanair now comes into the equation or he could wait for Aintree or Punchestown, but we'll see. 5-2-25

He was beaten a short head in the juvenile handicap hurdle at the festival 12 months ago on his debut for us, which although disappointing was a big effort. Since then he has really found his stride and improved with each run - in fact, the handicapper thinks he's 24lb better now. He won his first two races this season by an aggregate of 101 lengths and we then had the option of taking on Facile Vega and Il Etait Temps in a Grade 1. But it would have been a sin not to go for the big handicap at the Dublin Racing Festival off his mark of 143. We had the option of that race or the Betfair Hurdle, but we thought it best to stay at home with Cheltenham so close. And he did just as we expected by winning it nicely. There's the option of going for the Supreme, but at the moment he's more likely to go for the Ballymore. He's still progressing. 08-03-23

runners.name: Grey Dawning
runners.comment: Confidence booster at Kelso was a positive performance with Aintree in mind; respected
runners.spotlight: Very smart novice chaser last term, the highlight a Grade 1 win at Cheltenham, and ran well (clear second) in a gruelling Betfair Chase at Haydock on reappearance; unable to recover from a bad early mistake in the King George, then had a confidence booster at Kelso (good to soft) where he comfortably beat leading Grand National contender Iroko and delivered a positive performance with Aintree in mind; respected.

quotes.race: bet365 Premier Chase (Listed Race) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: That was really good. We wanted to see Grey Dawning back to what we know he can do and that was superb today, he jumped beautifully. Harry was delighted with him. He's very good, everyone knows he's very good, we've just not had the conditions and situations to show him off this season. My feeling about Haydock is if the ground was different you get a different result. Fair play to the winner, I'm not bemoaning it, it's just sport, sometimes it works out for you, sometimes it doesn't. He'll go to Aintree now - Dan Skelton, trainer.

quotes.race: Betfair Chase (Grade 1) (Registered As The Lancashire Chase) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: I'm gutted to get beat, but at the end of the day the winner is a hard horse to beat and I take my hat off to him. It looked like we had him beat, but he found a little bit more. Grey Dawning has improved on last year, that's for sure. He has to have improved on last year, look what he's just done. I'm not hitting the panic button and saying that's our ceiling. We'll get home and get him right and you mightn't see him for a while now, for obvious reasons. Christmas will be too soon by probably six weeks, there's no way you'll see him at Christmas - Dan Skelton, trainer.

quotes.race: Turners Novices' Chase (Grade 1) (Registered As The Golden Miller) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Grey Dawning is a lovely horse, isn't he? He's just a top-class horse. We had such hopes for him. When you go and win two bumpers at the start of your life and you're destined to be a chaser, you just want it to happen, and to win a Grade 1 novice here is great and gives us all that future to look forward to. People who were surprised that we chose this race won't be surprised now. I just thought it was a good novices' chase that he and Ginny's Destiny ran in here in December, and that's been proven - Dan Skelton, trainer.

quotes.race: Trustatrader Hampton Novices' Chase (Grade 2) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Grey Dawning was really impressive. He's quite unassuming and you watch him going round and it doesn't look like he's going anywhere then Harry (Skelton) wakes him up and he comes alive. He put the race to bed really quickly. It was a really competitive race so it was a very good performance. If he comes out of this well, we could look at the Scilly Isles. He's very exciting - Tom Messenger, assistant to trainer Dan Skelton.

quotes.race: Betfair Exchange Graduation Chase (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: That was good. Grey Dawning was a good horse last season, he won a graded and we saved him for Aintree, we didn't want to over-race him as a novice hurdler, and he tipped up down the back. I think he'd have gone very close to winning that day so I was particularly irritated. We've got to try and out that right as a chaser and win a big graded race where we can. These races are worth plenty of money and he got weight off Gaillard Du Mesnil so we thought we'd have a go. He has a slight preference for left-handed and in the new year at Warwick there is a 50,000GBP graded race on our doorstep so we'll go to that. He's a very nice horse - Dan Skelton, trainer.

quotes.race: Ballymore Leamington Novices' Hurdle (Grade 2) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: There are not a lot of negatives to say about Grey Dawning. We've always liked him and that's easy to say with a horse who wins two bumpers, but you've got to go and convert that and he has done. There was no disgrace to get beaten on his hurdling debut and he may have needed the run. He's progressive and is smart, very smart. Harry said he wasn't loving the ground - he gets away with it. It's probably better it's rained and a bit loosey, rather than being tacky. He's going the right way and my immediate reaction is he should be going three miles so he'll be entered in the Albert Bartlett and if we weren't happy with that we'd go to Aintree - Dan Skelton, trainer.

quotes.race: Ladbrokes Fanzone "Your Team Your Game" Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: Grey Dawning ultimately got the race won in the end. He is a very nice horse and he is a horse down the line that will be a chaser. He has got stacks of ability. For sure I will look for a nice handicap for him. By the end of the season he should be running over three miles. You'd like to think he will be running outside of handicap company by the end of the season but we have got to let him get there - Dan Skelton, trainer.

quotes.race: William Hill Racing Radio Open National Hunt Flat Race (Category 1 Elimination) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Grey Dawning is a lovely horse. He's only a baby and he'll probably have one more run in the spring then go jumping next season. He has a very patient owner - Dan Skelton, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: We'll have a conversation, maybe next week, and see how the horse is. My intentions at this stage are still Kelso and Aintree, but the Gold Cup might be something we have to have a little bit of a think about. The race looks like it's cutting up a little bit and I've left him in it because I'm not ruling it out. He started the season well when second in the Betfair Chase but the King George was a complete disaster after he made a mess of the first. After Haydock, I think you can say confidently he stays 3m1Â½f but there's always a question mark over the extra furlong in a Gold Cup. We all want to do what's best by the horse and that's what we'll do, but he looked in great physical condition when he worked at Huntingdon. 10-2-25

runners.name: Spillanes Tower
runners.comment: Progressive in the main and his John Durkan form (split two stars) is very persuasive
runners.spotlight: Finished only fifth when favourite for the King George (good) on last appearance; otherwise a progressive chaser and remains of strong interest with a rebound on the cards; completed a Grade 1 double (2m4f/3m1f) last spring before running very well in a cracking John Durkan at Punchestown (2m3f) where he split the Willie Mullins-trained stars Fact To File and Galopin Des Champs; that bare form is very persuasive.

quotes.race: John Durkan Memorial Punchestown Chase (Grade 1)
quotes.quote: I'm absolutely over the moon with Spillane's Tower. He hasn't been on grass since he won here at the festival. We couldn't, the ground has just been too firm. We have everything to look forward to now. Without a doubt that's the best race I've ever been involved in. You couldn't get any better - Jimmy Mangan, trainer.

quotes.race: Dooley Insurance Group Champion Novice Chase (Grade 1)
quotes.quote: Spillane's Tower is a special horse to us. We're dreaming now, he has something special about him. He is the most relaxed and easy horse and got a beautiful and cool ride - Jimmy Mangan, trainer

quotes.race: WillowWarm Gold Cup (Chase) (Grade 1)
quotes.quote: I'm delighted for Jimmy [Mangan, trainer] especially because he hasn't had a good horse in a while. When he gets a good horse like that he's well able to do the job. I was keeping my powder dry as I didn't want to be in front too soon but I had to go with the gallop they were going and, to be fair, Spillane's Tower jumped well. I'm delighted and he's one to look forward to - Mark Walsh, jockey.

quotes.race: Betting Better With SkyBet Novice Chase (Grade 3)
quotes.quote: Spillane's Tower was helped by the step up in trip and he stayed well. All of his runs have been good and he is improving all the time - Frank Berry, racing manager to J.P. McManus.

quotes.race: William Hill Ireland Rated Novice Chase
quotes.quote: Spillane's Tower had two great runs and he delivered today. It turned into a sprint, we would have preferred a good gallop, but he has that little bit of class - Jimmy Mangan, trainer.

quotes.race: Cavan Developments Supporting Kill GAA Maiden Hurdle
quotes.quote: Spillane's Tower is a nice horse and he will be better next year. He needed the trip and that ground is probably as quick as he would want it. A Summer's grass will do him the world of good - Jimmy Mangan, trainer

runners.name: Stage Star
runners.comment: Very useful 2m4f chaser; put up a good fight when upped to 3m1f at Cheltenham last time
runners.spotlight: Best known for his 2m4f exploits that include Grade 1 novice wins over hurdles/fences; however, put up a good fight against odds-on L'Homme Presse when upped to 3m1f in Grade 2 at Cheltenham (soft) most recently, emerging as the best horse at the weights; one of a few runners who remain unexposed at this sort of trip.

quotes.race: Betfair Cotswold Chase (Grade 2) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: That was a super run and the step up in trip suited because Stage Star was able to travel. In those handicaps carrying 12st you're out of your comfort zone the whole way and that was brilliant today. He's got every bit of the trip and galloped all the way to the line. I didn't put him in the Gold Cup and we're going to keep him fresh for the Bowl at Aintree - Paul Nicholls, trainer.

quotes.race: Paddy Power Gold Cup Handicap Chase (Premier Handicap) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Stage Star has to go left-handed so there was no point going anywhere else with him and the Ryanair will be the aim now. He jumps left so he has to go that way and Harry said if he is in front turning in he won't get beat. He gave that a brilliant ride. That was fantastic. He has definitely improved on last year's form. He has won off 155, and he has won a tad cosily, even with a mistake like that, and that puts him right in the mix for the Ryanair and that is what will be his target. If he didn't run before then I wouldn't lose any sleep over it - Paul Nicholls, trainer.

quotes.race: Turners Novices' Chase (Grade 1) (Registered As The Golden Miller) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: I'd say next year Stage Star will probably be a Ryanair horse. He has got plenty of boot and he travels really well. I'm not sure he needs to go the full Gold Cup distance yet; one day he might. He is a horse we believed in. It didn't go to plan last year, but he has come back this year and that's fantastic. It was a good race and he put it to bed really well. The last run was really good when he carried a big weight here and won very nicely. He was an improving horse but we needed him to take it to the next level. Today was going to test that - Paul Nicholls, trainer.

quotes.race: Timeform Novices' Handicap Chase (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: It's a big weight to carry around there and do that well. I'm thrilled with that. Stage Star is only a novice and he has a bit of experience around here and it means we can come back here in March if we want to in one of the novice chases. He was a Grade 1 winner last season and he is obviously a very nice horse, 142 was a very nice mark if he put it all together. That (the Cheltenham Festival) is a long way off. He would get three miles but it depends on the ground and opposition. He will be well worth running. He is only a novice once - Paul Nicholls, trainer.

quotes.race: MansionBet Challow Novices' Hurdle (Grade 1) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Stage Star is a proper horse and that was a very taking performance. Harry was quite surprised how well he won and said that although he stays, he's got so much speed. He'll be a lovely chaser in time. He'll need a little break after this and I'll talk to the team about the festival. I'm not afraid to wait until Aintree with them. I wouldn't want to go three miles with him so the only race at Cheltenham would be the Ballymore. He coped with that ground, but I always say those good horses cope with any ground - Paul Nicholls, trainer.

quotes.race: Watch Racing Free Online At Ladbrokes Novices' Hurdle (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Stage Star is pretty smart and had some good bumper form, but was always going to improve hurdling. We wanted a couple of runs under his belt before the Challow and he's done everything right, albeit against opposition he should have beaten. We'll find out more about him in the Challow. He's a good-moving horse, but I don't think proper winter ground would bother him - Harry Derham, assistant to trainer Paul Nicholls.

stable_tour.quote: As a dual Grade 1 winner and hero of last season's Paddy Power Gold Cup, he's been a fantastic flagbearer for the Owners Group, and when he's on song he's a very smart chaser. I hoped he'd win the Old Roan on his comeback eight days ago and at first I was a bit disappointed he could finish only fourth; I've seen him jump better and when it turned into a sprint to the line he was caught a bit flat-footed. But on reflection he's run well, beaten around four lengths off his highest handicap mark. He normally needs his races spaced out and isn't the easiest to train, so although I could bring him out again fairly quick in the Paddy Power Gold Cup, he's more likely to wait for the December Gold Cup at Cheltenham next month. It gives him a bit more time and he likes to be fresh. As he has to go left-handed our options are limited, and I can't help feeling he's not going to be easy to place this season; he could find himself in no man's land - on a mark that's a few pounds too high for handicaps and holding few options in Grade 2s as a lot of them are run at right-handed tracks that are no good for him. I'd love to give him a spin over three miles at some point as that would open up new avenues: the Denman Chase at Newbury perhaps? 04-11-24

runners.name: The Real Whacker
runners.comment: Still seeking a first Grade 1 success outside novice company; something to find
runners.spotlight: Charlie Hall winner at Wetherby in November; creditable fourth in the last two runnings of the King George but hasn't fared so well in the last two Gold Cups and is still seeking a first Grade 1 success outside novice company; balance of form gives him something to find.

quotes.race: bet365 Charlie Hall Chase (Grade 2) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: I never wrote The Real Whacker off. We just had no luck. Every time we went to run him, the sky opened the night before. He got his ground today. I'm delighted to get him back, I had him fairly right going to Listowel and he unfortunately unseated but we were happy with the ground today. The ground is the key to him. He won't go for the Betfair Chase, he'll maybe go for the King George and then the Cotswold Chase, then hopefully the Gold Cup - Paddy Neville, trainer.

quotes.race: Ladbrokes King George VI Chase (Grade 1) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: The Real Whacker travelled well and jumped well for his first time in open company. He stayed on really well at the end, which I was happy with. He missed the start for some reason today, and we were always chasing after that. I like the way he stayed on at the end and the Gold Cup is still on the agenda. Cheltenham is a place that he likes. I think we might go straight to the Gold Cup - Patrick Neville, trainer.

quotes.race: Brown Advisory Novices' Chase (Grade 1) (Registered As The Broadway Novices' Chase) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: I was toying with the Gold Cup this year but we made the decision to try to give The Real Whacker a bit more experience and mind him with the view to coming back next year. We'll give him a good summer as he might have done enough now for this year. He could go to Punchestown but we'll see how he comes out of this. He'll probably go to Listowel in the autumn because it's one of my favourite tracks - Patrick Neville, trainer.

quotes.race: Paddy Power Novices' Chase (Registered as The Dipper Novices' Chase) (Grade 2) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: I was thinking in my head that The Real Whacker had improved for his last run and I knew he had improved at home. I took my time with him and I saw this race and said we will go for it and make it a test of jumping. Looking at Monmiral you had to respect him as he is a Grade One winner, but this horse is progressing and is on the up. Hopefully he will be a Grade One winner soon. We will come back for the festival and enter him in a couple of them. We might even go for the Gold Cup! - Patrick Neville, trainer.

quotes.race: mallardjewellers.com Novices' Chase (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: The Real Whacker is a smashing horse and we've always loved him. Fences are his game. He's gorgeous and would probably be better on softer ground. Gavin Sheehan was brilliant on him and his jumping was outstanding - Patrick Neville, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: I might have made a couple of wrong decisions with him last season, but with a horse like him there aren't that many races. People were doubting him but I never lost the faith and I was delighted to win the Charlie Hall last month. We had him right for his return in the Kerry National and he was running a massive race but, unfortunately, he hit a fence and unseated Sam [Twiston-Davies]. The ground dried up at Wetherby and the race came at the right time. He's come out of it really well and we had him in the Betfair Chase but took him out on the day because of the ground. With the form he's in, he could possibly run in the King George after all. We'd have to supplement him but we've looked into it. It would be ground dependent but we'll have a good idea of the ground and weather forecast by then. He finished fourth in it last year and ran very well for a first run in open company. You can run him at any track - it's the ground that's key. There's a race at Wetherby on Boxing Day as well, but we'll look at the King George because it's a wide-open race. We're still thinking of the Cotswold Chase and then the Gold Cup, but it'll depend on the ground. If the Cheltenham Festival came up soft like it did last year, we'd go the Aintree route. There's the Bowl and we'll probably put him in the Grand National as well. Everyone keeps telling me that's a good race for him, so we'll see. 11-12-24

3:30.going_detailed: GOOD TO SOFT, Good in places on Mildmay course (GoingStick: Mildmay Hurdle 5.0, Mildmay Chase 5.4, Grand National course 5.2) (Watering)

runners.name: Constitution Hill
runners.comment: Fell in Champion Hurdle; not at brilliant best in victory this term, but a leading player
runners.spotlight: Won this in 2023, didn't run in it last year; lost unbeaten hurdling record when falling mid-race in last month's Champion Hurdle and he made a bad mistake at the final flight when winning Cheltenham Grade 2 (2m1f, soft) in January; there's a worry he'll produce another major blunder and he hasn't matched his brilliant peak RPRs when winning twice this season, but he still beat Lossiemouth by just over 2l in the Grade 1 Christmas Hurdle at Kempton (2m, good) in December and is a leading player granted a clear round.

quotes.race: Unibet Champion Hurdle Challenge Trophy (Grade 1) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: The horse and Nico [De Boinville] are both okay, along with State Man and Paul [Townend], and that's the main thing. We'll surely have a rather fun day in Punchestown in the spring. It's cruel and tough on Michael [Buckley], who has had to wait two years to get back here. Constitution Hill was back and we couldn't have had him any better than he was today. State Man had the race won but we didn't get that far to see what would have happened - Nicky Henderson, trainer.

quotes.race: Unibet Hurdle (Registered As The International Hurdle) (Grade 2) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Constitution Hill is such a good jumper and usually doesn't get it wrong very often so hopefully he got it out the way (the mistake at the last) before he runs next time. He was very long at the last when he won the Champion Hurdle and has done it the other way today. We know where we are with him. He'll have a quiet week now and then we'll start the engines up again. If we can get to the Champion Hurdle in the sort of form we are in today, we'll go there with a big hope. We have four to five weeks to play with - Nicky Henderson, trainer.

quotes.race: Ladbrokes Christmas Hurdle (Grade 1) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Constitution Hill is him. The great thing he is back. You can see where he belongs and is capable of being. I do think he is very nearly as good as he was. Nico said there is a lot of improvement. He has had a good blow going down to the last, which he is entitled to off that gallop, as that was rapid stuff. I've never seen him look better. That Newbury gallop wasn't everything that we were looking for. Maybe we will see Sir Gino tomorrow and that will make the gallop look good now. I'd like to see how he takes this race as we have had to be quite hard on him the last three weeks. I'd love to run him again and if he says no then we will have to go straight there (to the Champion Hurdle) - Nicky Henderson, trainer.

quotes.race: Ladbrokes Christmas Hurdle (Grade 1) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: You have to put it all into perspective and Constitution Hill can only beat what is put in front of him. Obviously there will be a lot more to come in March. We missed the Fighting Fifth so there is no reason why we shouldn't look at the Unibet International Hurdle at Cheltenham on Trials Day as an extra run, which he is here to do. We want to race him - Nicky Henderson, trainer.

quotes.race: William Hill Aintree Hurdle (Grade 1) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: It was obvious this morning Constitution Hill was going to have to make it, so I said don't mess about, keep it simple. He jumps so beautifully, doesn't he? He was enjoying himself. When you're travelling like that, in a slightly slower gear over two and a half miles, it makes it even easier for him and his jumping is just so deadly accurate - Nicky Henderson, trainer.

quotes.race: Unibet Champion Hurdle Challenge Trophy (Grade 1) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: You can do anything with this horse. You could jump a fence, you could go three miles. Constitution Hill has had six races now and has barely come off the bridle, but it won't last forever so let's enjoy it while we have got it. He is a freak. I said to Nico let's keep it as simple as you possibly can, and he did - Nicky Henderson, trainer.

quotes.race: Ladbrokes Christmas Hurdle (Grade 1) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: My gut feeling was always that Constitution Hill would go straight to Cheltenham as I'm not sure Haydock will do anything for him and neither would the Kingwell. Most trainers would agree that having an 'away game' as close to Cheltenham as the Irish Champion Hurdle is not the way you'd choose to prepare a horse for a race like the Champion Hurdle - Nicky Henderson, trainer.

quotes.race: Betfair Fighting Fifth Hurdle (Grade 1) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: It was very straightforward. My main instruction from the governor was to keep it as simple as I can. Newcastle have done a great job with the ground, it's lovely good to soft ground. I could hear them behind me and once I turned in I just gradually quickened it up and went through the gears. Constitution Hill was very slick today. He's a joy to ride.  It was sensational, particularly how he quickened up in the straight. That was really good.  I've schooled the likes of Binocular at home and the best hurdlers hardly leave the ground. When I really quickened it up he was very slick. He'd jump a fence but for now we're fully down the hurdles route and let's see what the year brings - Nico de Boinville, jockey.

quotes.race: Sky Bet Supreme Novices' Hurdle (Grade 1) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Constitution Hill must be an extraordinary animal. This is a very, very good horse. Jonbon is a very good horse and for him to do that to him is remarkable. He's got an enormous turn of foot, he's always just racing two gears below everybody else because it's all so easy for him. Aintree comes very quickly; he could go to Punchestown and we'll say hello to Willie (Mullins) again and see what happens - Nicky Henderson, trainer.

quotes.race: Unibet Tolworth Novices' Hurdle (Grade 1) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: The big question that everyone's asking me now is what will I do with Jonbon and Constitution Hill. I asked Nico if he thought Constitution Hill would go any further and he said 'no' so we'll be sticking to two miles. Would Jonbon go further? I don't know but nothing he's done so far would suggest he needs to. Nico said he knew within ten strides going to the start that the horse would be happy on the ground and that he was happy the entire way. He also said he couldn't believe how far clear he was without even having to give the horse a click - Nicky Henderson, trainer.

quotes.race: Andy Stewart - Sandown Park's Great Friend "National Hunt" Novices' Hurdle (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Constitution Hill is the most extraordinary creature I've come across in years. He will go back to his stable and go to sleep now. I hope he's high class and he's definitely a chaser for the future - Nicky Henderson, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: I said recently, tongue in cheek, that I could probably do without public gallops because his last two didn't end well, but doing these things in public makes sure everybody is kept properly informed, as long as people take these things in context. After his last gallop at Newbury, which everybody slammed him for, the horse he was working with, Sir Gino, came out and won the Fighting Fifth and was mind-boggling at Kempton. So everybody then says Sir Gino is the best thing they've ever seen, but they forget he was the horse Constitution Hill was working with. It's not always straightforward.I don't want to keep him hidden away ? I'll have people coming to see him every day before the Champion Hurdle, half media and half private ? but although he may go away for a gallop, where and when is yet to be decided, and I'm not even sure he needs to. Nico [de Boinville] will sit on him this week and we'll make our minds up from there. Beyond that, though, he's very well, couldn't be better, and I have a plan, working back from the festival, knowing how many pieces of work I want to do with him and when I want to do them. That's where we are, and I can't spend all my time worrying about what's going to take us on. He'll run how he runs, we've just got to get him, and all the others, in the best shape we can on the day, whatever lines up against us. Whatever they throw at us, we'll throw it back. 16-2-25

runners.name: Salver
runners.comment: 5yo; running well in defeat this season but he needs others to underperform
runners.spotlight: 5yo who has been running creditably in defeat this season and was in the mix in the Grade 2 Relkeel Hurdle at Cheltenham (2m4f, soft) in January when falling at the final flight; also effective on good to soft (unproven on good); however, others need to underperform if he's to reward each-way backers.

quotes.race: Virgin Bet Victor Ludorum Juvenile Hurdle (Go North Grey Bomber Series Qualifier) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Salver has done it nicely, it was a case of he's done what he had to do. It's proper heavy ground out there and he goes on it and copes with the conditions. Cheltenham will be ground dependent - I think he'll only be going there if it's soft or worse than soft. If it's a good ground Triumph, I can't see him running there. He's a nice horse - Josh Moore, assistant trainer.

quotes.race: Coral Finale Juvenile Hurdle (Grade 2) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Salver loves soft ground and enjoyed the conditions, whereas the rest probably didn't. He has already done more than I expected and he isn't just going to be a juvenile, either, because he is a big horse and can only improve. His jumping today was unbelievable as well. He was gaining lengths at every hurdle. I'll have to think about a better race now and we might have to look at the Triumph Hurdle, but if it came up quick at Cheltenham we wouldn't have to run him. We could wait for Aintree or just put him away - Gary Moore, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: He had a fantastic season as a juvenile, winning four on the bounce and finishing third in the Triumph. It's going to be a hard season for him because he's a big horse who is still filling into himself and it was surprising just how well he did as a juvenile for a horse with his size. We won't be too hard on him this term because ultimately he'll be a three-mile chaser. Something like the Relkeel at Cheltenham on New Year's Day might be his sort of level. He'll stay very well. 29-10-24

runners.name: Tellherthename
runners.comment: Lightly raced and the step up in trip may suit but he has bundles to find on form
runners.spotlight: Easily won two novice hurdles at Huntingdon (2m, good/good to soft) last season and reappeared with respectable fourth in Grade 1 Fighting Fifth at Newcastle; the step up in trip may suit this 3m point winner but he has bundles to find on form and was pulled up in the Morebattle Handicap latest.

quotes.race: Arkle Finance EBF "National Hunt" Novices' Hurdle (Qualifier) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: We are back on track. We turned a lot of stones to try and find out what happened at Aintree. We found a few little bits and bobs, but nothing that put us out for that long as you could see. I was just keen to get his season back on track before we dwelt on it for too long. The ground there was soft enough, and it is not the good to soft that they have advertised, but Tellherthename has handled it very well. He is an unbelievably class horse. That now gives him his fourth run so he has got the option of the Betfair Hurdle, but the ground would have to be spot on for that otherwise we will go straight to the Supreme with him. I think he is a class horse with gears galore and I sometimes think they are best fresh. They go such a gallop in that race (Supreme) and if you are anything but absolutely ready for the day then you might get flat footed - Ben Pauling, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: The Greatwood Hurdle would be the plan to start with. He's only five but would jump fences no problem. However, we thought a rating of 135 was workable and there are some nice handicap hurdles for him this season. If the ground was too soft at Cheltenham, we could look at something like the Gerry Feilden instead. We're hoping he'll be able to do some damage off his mark in handicap hurdles. 06-11-24

runners.name: Break My Soul
runners.comment: Another good 2nd on stable debut, in Gowran Park Grade 3, but needs lots of improvement
runners.spotlight: Went close in handicaps (1m7f/2m, good/good to soft) for Nicky Henderson towards end of last year and posted another good second on stable debut in a Grade 3 at Gowran Park (2m, soft) in February; it's possible today's trip will suit this 3m point winner but lots of improvement is needed.

stable_tour.quote: We got her after winning a point-to-point but things did not go according to plan last season at first. However, we resolved a few issues and she finished with two extremely easy victories at Chepstow and Fontwell. She's had a good summer at grass and we'll now resume over hurdles. Good ground is important to her. 22-10-24

runners.name: Lossiemouth
runners.breeder: Sarl Elevage Des Vallons & M Ian Kellit

prev_owners.owner: Mme S Haynes-Kellitt, Elevage Des Vallons & Y Fouin

runners.comment: Beaten by Constitution Hill at Kempton but could turn the tables over this longer trip
runners.spotlight: Missed a golden opportunity in the Champion Hurdle at the Cheltenham Festival, instead running in the Mares' Hurdle (2m4f, good to soft) in which she was extremely impressive; fell mid-race in the Irish Champion Hurdle in February and beaten just over 2l by Constitution Hill in the Christmas Hurdle; however, she wasn't seen to best effect around Kempton's sharp 2m and is 4-4 at about this trip, all in Grade 1s; no surprise if she turns the tables.

quotes.race: Close Brothers Mares' Hurdle (Registered As The David Nicholson Mares' Hurdle) (Grade 1) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Lossiemouth was very good. I was disappointed we didn't run in the Champion Hurdle but I worked her against State Man the other day and it wasn't a Champion Hurdle bit of work so the obvious thing to do was to come back to this race. You just look at where you can get winners and Rich hasn't a big team this year so we did the right thing for him - Willie Mullins, trainer. She wasn't too keen, she carried me and we went no gallop but I wasn't going to give Jade De Grugy a free reign. She's a high-class mare and I was doing a half-speed everywhere - Paul Townend, jockey.

quotes.race: Ladbrokes Christmas Hurdle (Grade 1) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: It was disappointing. We were struggling way too early and I don't know why. Her heart kept her going. Lossiemouth ran okay, but we weren't good enough on the day. You would always like to take them on again, but I'd like to find out why we underperformed here today first - Paul Townend, rider.

quotes.race: Bar One Racing Hatton's Grace Hurdle (Grade 1)
quotes.quote: Lossiemouth has that bit of speed. She has a nice Flat pedigree and when they went steady, it was bar a fall or something like that. She did make a bad mistake at the fourth last but when it came down to a speed race, I thought she was going to win that anyway. She went to the International Hurdle last year but we'll have to look at the conditions of that as it mightn't suit - Willie Mullins, trainer

quotes.race: Coolmore N.H. Sires Bolshoi Ballet Irish EBF Mares Champion Hurdle (Grade 1)
quotes.quote: Lossiemouth didn't jump with the same fluency but I think probably Paul was trying to settle her so that she didn't get going too quick. They went a very fast gallop and he was happy enough to let her settle. Off that gallop it was a great performance. Paul wanted to keep the lid on for want of a better word. I think she has done enough for the year now. All being well, she will go for the Champion Hurdle next year - Willie Mullins, trainer.

quotes.race: Close Brothers Mares' Hurdle (Registered As The David Nicholson Mares' Hurdle) (Grade 1) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Lossiemouth is a Champion Hurdle mare, I think. Once again, Paul was just so cool on her. She can improve, she can go on, a year older, running like that in that ground, the way she jumps, she's got everything. We made the right decision [not to run her in the Champion Hurdle], end of story, because she didn't get a grueller in the Champion Hurdle. She won as comfortable as she liked, she's only five, and getting a grueller in the Champion Hurdle as a five-year-old mare isn't what you should do with them. She'll be trained for Punchestown, and then I'll chat to Rich and Susannah and I imagine the Champion Hurdle - Willie Mullins, trainer, speaking on Racing TV.

quotes.race: Unibet Hurdle (Registered As The International Hurdle) (Grade 2) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Lossiemouth is very good, and she has an entry in the Champion Hurdle, which I think she will probably keep. My guess we would go for the Mares' Hurdle then the Annie Power at Punchestown and then maybe something in France. Maybe next season she is a Champion Hurdle type. Constitution Hill is a monster, and I'm not running away from him, but she is a great filly, and you just want to mind her to see how she goes - Rich Ricci, owner.

quotes.race: Ballymore Champion Four Year Old Hurdle (Grade 1)
quotes.quote: She's been very good to us and I'm looking forward to maybe the Mares' Hurdle with Lossiemouth next year. Normally those juveniles work into staying hurdlers so it could be the Mares' Hurdle or the Stayers' Hurdle but, I just wonder, could she be a Champion Hurdle filly in two years' time. We'll see. She has huge reserves and she's sound as a pound. Half the battle of being a good horse is being sound - Willie Mullins, trainer.

quotes.race: JCB Triumph Hurdle (Grade 1) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Lossiemouth is a a star mare. But for the traffic problems she encountered at Leopardstown she'd be unbeaten - Willie Mullins, trainer.

quotes.race: Donohue Marquees Spring Juvenile Hurdle (Grade 1)
quotes.quote: [Paul said] the best horse didn't win the race, although that's not taking anything away from the winner because the winner was good the last day. Clearly when the race was starting Lossiemouth lost a furlong and we did because of my other horse in the race! I'm disappointed, of course, but I think we've got a fine mare there and I think Cheltenham will be a different story. It was a great performance to get back up but it's disappointing nonetheless. I think Paul was letting the other horse know he was there but the other fella is a young rider and he made a mistake, signals got crossed, and these things happen. Unfortunately it happened today - Rich Ricci, owner.

quotes.race: Knight Frank Juvenile Hurdle (Grade 2)
quotes.quote: Lossiemouth did that nicely, jumped well and still managed to win well enough despite being hard on herself. I'm very pleased with her, and how Gala Marceau ran on to be second. It looks like Lossiemouth deserves her favouritism for the Triumph, I think. She could be the real deal for that. I hadn't asked her too much since her last start, I didn't feel I had to. I'm hoping she'll improve again as the season goes on.  The Dublin Racing Festival would look the obvious target at the moment. It looks like we have a nice three-year-old team. Hopefully they all keep improving - Willie Mullins, trainer.

quotes.race: Bar One Racing Price Boost Juvenile Hurdle (Grade 3)
quotes.quote: Lossiemouth was very good. She came with a nice reputation from France. She had been working nicely at home but nothing compared to that. This was a finding out mission and I think we found a good one - Willie Mullins, trainer

stable_tour.quote: I don't know what happened to her on Sunday, I was looking at the head-on video of the back stretch and a flock of seagulls just took off before. Something took her eye off it because she pricked her ears two strides before it and then just didn't get up. It was as if she was looking at something ahead of her and just didn't get up high enough. Thankfully she's good after the race. She was taken out of her comfort zone at Kempton only because she's not used to running over two miles. At the moment we're going for the Champion Hurdle. We've been training her for this for two years. 5-2-25

I've liked her from the day I first saw her and she has done nothing to change that opinion. She started off winning a Grade 3 at Fairyhouse and a Grade 2 from Gala Marceau. We went to the Dublin Racing Festival for the Grade 1 juvenile race but she was very unlucky to be in behind the wrong horse, which took her back. Despite that she made headway but Gala Marceau was away and gone. It was disappointing but she was just plain unlucky and I expect her to redeem herself next week in the Triumph. It's going to be a very hot division this year. 08-03-23

runners.name: Take No Chances
runners.comment: Enjoying a fine campaign but was no match for Lossiemouth at the Cheltenham Festival
runners.spotlight: Enjoying a fine campaign, winning a Grade 2 mares' hurdle at Ascot (1m7f, good) in January and finishing third in the Mares' Hurdle at last month's Cheltenham Festival (2m4f, good to soft); however, she was no match for easy winner Lossiemouth last time and would be a surprise winner today.

quotes.race: BetMGM Mares' Hurdle (Grade 2) (Registered As The Warfield Mares' Hurdle) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: I thought I was flat out at the home turn but Dan and Harry [Skelton] said Take No Chances would stay really well and to keep after her. I saw Paul Townend's head come upsides me and I thought I might just be in trouble. I suppose he didn't have race fitness on his side and we did - Kielan Woods, jockey.

quotes.race: bet365 Mares' Hurdle (Listed Race) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: We dropped back in trip like we did with Molly Ollys Wishes and she's a similar type of horse. Take No Chances has a fabulous attitude and jumps very slickly. I'm going to be adventurous and put her in the Fighting Fifth, just in case Constitution Hill frightens everybody off. There's a few quid on offer and she'll be getting weight. We won't be beating Constitution Hill but we might turn up for a few pennies on offer. She's improving and when mares get confidence they do even more for you - Dan Skelton, trainer.

quotes.race: Download The Rhino.Bet App Mares' Novices' Hurdle (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Take No Chances had some really good bumper form without winning, but we have always liked her a lot. We were relatively confident coming here. I'm sure Dan has got something in mind for her. I should think if she goes in again in another race like this then she would be stepped up in class. I do think she is up there with our better mares - Bridget Andrews, stable spokeswoman.

stable_tour.quote: She's had a fantastic season and put up a great performance to beat Kargese at Ascot last time. She's in flying form and is versatile between two and three miles, so she's a likely runner in the Mares' Hurdle.  10-2-25

runners.name: Wodhooh
runners.comment: Won Martin Pipe; tough task in first Grade 1 but can pick up the pieces if big two misfire
runners.spotlight: Made it 7-7 over hurdles with something to spare in the Martin Pipe Handicap at the Cheltenham Festival (2m4f, good to soft); has also won on good ground; faces tougher task in first Grade 1 but this 5yo could have more to offer and is the likeliest to pick up the pieces if the big two misfire.

quotes.race: Martin Pipe Conditional Jockeys' Handicap Hurdle (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: I won on Wodhooh here in December. Since then, it's been the plan to come here. Gordon [Elliott, trainer] told me going out, 'Ride her with plenty of balls'. I didn't think I would be in front as soon as I was, thankfully she stayed galloping all the way to the line. I think she's getting better with every run, and she's unbeaten. So she's well entitled to step up into graded company - Danny Gilligan, jockey.

quotes.race: SBK Fillies' Juvenile Hurdle (Listed Race) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Wodhooh has done nothing wrong so far. She's a big scopey filly so who knows where she'll take us? Sir Gino looked awesome at Cheltenham so we'll get her home, see what Gordon Elliott says and take it from there - Ian Murphy, owner.

quotes.race: 'Bet In-Race' With Coral Fillies' Juvenile Hurdle (Listed Race) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: I've not had many runners here. Wodhooh will have to improve to be a Triumph Hurdle filly, but there's plenty of prize-money to win and this race has been the plan for a while. It's an amazing pot with Â£25,000 to the winner, so it's great to be here - Gordon Elliott, trainer.

quotes.race: Lisburn And Castlereagh City Council 3-Y-O Hurdle
quotes.quote: Wodhooh is tough. She would have been suited by a quicker gallop early on. She probably learned more than she did last day. She might go to Newbury now for a Listed hurdle next month - Gordon Elliott, trainer.

quotes.race: Paddy Power 3-Y-O Hurdle
quotes.quote: We knew Wodhooh had come on from the run in Listowel but I think on softer ground there is another half-stone in her. She's a very honest filly. Jack said it was like she only jumped in at the third-last. She was flat out for the first half of the race and then the further she went the better she was. We'd like to get a bit of black type over hurdles with her now. There is a race in Newbury the first week in December that she could go for - Gordon Elliott, trainer.

quotes.race: Kerry Group 3-Y-O Hurdle
quotes.quote: It was a tricky situation but the stewards had to do their job. Wodhooh is a filly you could see maybe going for that juvenile fillies' race at Aintree. I think she'll pay her way and will be black type over hurdles. Jordan said she was a bit deliberate at one hurdle and jumped a couple of others a bit big, but we'd done a lot of work with her at home - Gordon Elliott, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: She's a very smart mare who just keeps on winning. She surprised me when she won at Cheltenham in December as I thought she would need the run. She's come on plenty since then. She's entered in the Coral Cup and the Martin Pipe but if Brighterdaysahead goes for the Champion Hurdle we will strongly consider supplementing her for the Mares' Hurdle. She doesn't have a whole heap to find on ratings with a lot of the fancied ones in that and I think the race might suit her. 19-2-25

1:45.race_name: EBC Group Manifesto Novices' Chase (Grade 1) (GBB Race)
1:45.going_detailed: GOOD TO SOFT, Good in places on Mildmay course (GoingStick: Mildmay Hurdle 5.0, Mildmay Chase 5.4, Grand National course 5.2) (Watering)

runners.name: Boombawn
runners.comment: Grade 2 winner who is better off at the weights with Rubaud this time; not ruled out e-w
runners.spotlight: Won Grade 2 Rising Stars at Wincanton (2m4f, good) in November and 1l second to Rubaud in Grade 2 Pendil at Kempton (2m4f, good to soft) in February, when conceding 5lb to the winner (level weights today); relatively exposed (2-8 over fences) but this course hurdles winner is not ruled out each-way.

quotes.race: Boodles Rising Stars Novices' Chase (Grade 2) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: I'm stopping short of calling it top-class form but for horses that like that ground it's got to be a good race. The second has worn his heart on his sleeve but some days you win sometimes you lose. We'll see what happens, the Pendil could be the starting point.  We can't have a bad season as Boombawn has just won a 75,000GBP race - Dan Skelton, trainer.

quotes.race: Read Nicky Henderson's Exclusive Unibet Blog Handicap Hurdle (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: We had Boombawn ready for the Silver Trophy at Chepstow in the autumn, but the ground was unusually wet. I sent him home to his co-owners to give him a month to freshen up and he's been aching for this better ground, although I know it's not officially good ground. He's entitled to be progressive. He'll have Aintree, Ayr and Sandown on his agenda and we might even consider going over fences with him if the races suit - Dan Skelton, trainer

quotes.race: Huyton Asphalt Handicap Hurdle (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: We gave Boombawn a bit of a break and he ran really well the last day in what was a really competitive race. He's come on for that and he's done it really well here and shown a really resolute attitude. It could have been that he was just a bit of a weaker finisher in his younger days, but he seems really resolute now and we'll keep him going this summer. We could look at chasing in the autumn  - Tom Messenger, assistant trainer.

quotes.race: Racing TV Novices' Hurdle (Listed Race) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: This was always the early season target for Boombawm and he was really ready for today. We're trying to look after him as he could be a nice chaser next year, so we're not going to over-race him. We ran him in a few handicaps last year to try and battle-harden him and it really paid off here. We'll see what the handicapper does with him. I didn't see Jamie drop the whip but Dan rang me from home and said that, so I don't know if that made a difference. We were pleased with our horse's attitude, as last season he might not have fought like that - Tom Messenger, assistant trainer.

stable_tour.quote: He won the Rising Stars Novices' Chase at Wincanton on Saturday, putting up a good performance in what looked like a grown-up race. They went a real strong gallop, he came off it well and jumped nicely throughout. He's good when he's fresh and has that good ground. I'm not sure what we do next, but I'd say the Pendil in the spring and other similar races would come on to the agenda, although when the ground goes he'll have to have a break. 12-11-24

runners.name: Croke Park
runners.comment: Two Grade 1 novice wins in Ireland in December and the form of those races reads well
runners.spotlight: Won two Grade 1 novice chases in Ireland in December (2m4f/3m, yielding/good to yielding) before bumping into Ballyburn in Grade 1 at Leopardstown (2m5f, yielding) in February, when a 5l second; had Heart Wood and Better Days Ahead narrowly behind in second for his Grade 1 wins, and those two franked the form at the Cheltenham Festival; he's one to consider.

quotes.race: Racing Post Long Distance Novice Chase (Grade 1)
quotes.quote: To be completely honest, Croke Park disappointed me so much as a hurdler last year. I expected more from him. We had big expectations for him early on, but he was probably just so big and weak and needed time. He's come back in and gone chasing and has now won two Grade 1s already this season, so I'm delighted for Michael and Eddie [O'Leary]. Maybe he didn't jump as well as he did the last day. Sam [Ewing] said he slipped going into the first, but he won and that's the main thing. He's been busy enough and probably doesn't need to run again before Cheltenham. I don't think he wants real winter-heavy ground - Gordon Elliott, trainer.

quotes.race: Bar One Racing Drinmore Novice Chase (Grade 1)
quotes.quote: Croke Park won an average enough beginners chase here the last day. I didn't know if the form was strong enough for him to run here but he has run a great race. I imagine he will go to Leopardstown now - Gordon Elliott, trainer

quotes.race: Irish Stallion Farms EBF Beginners Chase
quotes.quote: Croke Park has a lot of improvement in him. It wouldn't be a shock if he was to come back here for the Drinmore - Gordon Elliott, trainer

quotes.race: John Lynch Carpets & Flooring Monksfield Novice Hurdle (Grade 3)
quotes.quote: Croke Park is a lovely horse. He didn't do much when he got there and he will probably enjoy stepping up to 3m - Gordon Elliott, trainer.

quotes.race: Crottys Lake Maiden Hurdle
quotes.quote: Croke Park jumped great. He loved that ground and you'll probably see the best of him when he goes out in trip and over fences in time. He's a massive horse and Kilbeggan wouldn't have suited him well so he didn't run a bad race that day. He was always going to be a winter type on big, galloping tracks. He jumped the two hurdles in the straight to his left the first time around but straightened out afterwards. The stable yard is down around there so he was probably looking at that - Jack Kennedy, jockey.

stable_tour.quote: He's already won two Grade 1s this season and been second in another, so he owes us nothing. He's in the Brown Advisory and the novice handicap, but the likes of Aintree or Fairyhouse could be on the agenda for him as well. 19-2-25

runners.name: Fascile Mode
runners.comment: Won on chase debut at Punchestown in October but has had jumping issues since
runners.spotlight: Beat subsequent Grade 2 winner Touch Me Not on chase debut at Punchestown (2m, good) in October; however, others have far more substance to their form and he's had jumping issues since that win; others preferred.

quotes.race: Thank You Tom Maguire From All At Punchestown Hurdle
quotes.quote: Fascile Mode might go for the Grimes Hurdle at Tipperary next month before going for one of the good handicap hurdles at Galway. We haven't spared him but he's improving all the time and he wants that kind of ground - Tom Mullins, trainer.

quotes.race: BetVictor Predictor Maiden Hurdle
quotes.quote: We were expecting a very good run from Fascile Mode. It was a bit disappointing he did that at the third-last but it's his first day at school. Even from the time he came here today, he was gawking everywhere for a horse who has been to Cheltenham. He was very on his toes today for some reason. Michael thought the same when he was riding him but he settled well. I'd say he learned a lot and I'm very happy with him. There's a novice at Cheltenham at the November meeting or there's the Royal Bond. His jumping will have to sharpen up but he is brilliant at home - Tom Mullins, trainer.

runners.name: Gidleigh Park
runners.comment: Beat subsequent Cheltenham Festival winner Caldwell Potter with win on second chase start
runners.spotlight: Grade 2 novice hurdle winner (2m4f, good to soft) who was pulled up on chase debut in November (irregular heartbeat) but impressed in four-runner Grade 2 novice at Windsor (2m, soft) in January, when subsequent Cheltenham Festival winner Caldwell Potter was 4l behind in second; unraced on good ground; the step back up in trip seems a likely plus; firmly in calculations.

quotes.race: Fitzdares Lightning Novices' Chase (Grade 2) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: What happened at Kempton was unfortunate but thankfully Gidleigh Park came out of it in one piece. He's done everything right at home since then and we went to Lambourn last week over a fence and he was absolutely brilliant, so we've come here today with plenty of confidence. We knew we could let him roll over two miles but we've gone very quick early - I didn't think we would. He's a strong-travelling horse, he was a little bit lit up early but I let him get a breather whenever I could. He's done it really well, when we turned in he quickened up the whole way and hit the line strong. He's obviously got a massive engine, he's a pleasure to be involved with - Bryan Carver, rider.

quotes.race: SSS Super Alloys Novices' Hurdle (Grade 2) (Registered As The Classic Novices' Hurdle) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: It was a Grade 2 so Gidleigh Park had to step up and the race hasn't been run to suit - it turned into a sprint for home - but he got down and battled and got the job done. It's the first time he's had to battle, so he'll have learned again, but we've some questions now in terms of which race we run him in in March. He's won and we can't complain about that - it's what it's all about at the end of the day - Harry Fry, trainer.

quotes.race: BetVictor EBF Stallions 'National Hunt' Novices' Hurdle (Qualifier) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: I'm delighted, it's another step up the ladder. This was a step up in trip and Gidleigh Park didn't jump all that fluently to begin with, but when the race started to develop he got better. There were some nice horses we were taking on and the form keeps working out well. Johnny (Burke, jockey) said he was surprised with the amount of speed he's showing. The hardest job Johnny has at the moment is pulling him up, which is no bad thing! He's a very exciting horse and I just hope he can keep progressing into the spring. We'll go to Cheltenham at the end of January for the Grade 2 novice hurdle on Trials day - Harry Fry, trainer.

quotes.race: Exeter Novices' Hurdle (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: It was a good round of jumping and Gidleigh Park has put his head in front, so the dream lives on. He's still a very raw horse. He's a big, tall, rangy individual and he'll have learnt a bit more. It's taken Johnny (Burke, jockey) an age after the line to pull him up which is really encouraging. We've just had to be patient with him because of his size. I remember when we took him in the school first time last year he could barely get round the bends. It's about experience, we want to go again in a novice under a penalty. Whether that's at Cheltenham's December meeting, we'll see. I don't want to get ahead of myself but there's races there that can lead us into the spring - Harry Fry, trainer, speaking on Racing TV.

stable_tour.quote: We'll decide which race to go for closer to the time and the main priority at this stage is getting him there in good form. I've no doubt three miles will be his trip in due course but conditions will play a part in the decision. Hopefully he can run a big race in March but he has so much potential in years to come over fences. 20-02-24

He was very impressive on his debut at Chepstow. It looked a good race on paper but the further they went the more he lengthened clear. What was really exciting is that it took until the entrance of the back straight for Jonathan Burke to stop him. He's a really exciting prospect and he's from the family of Denman, so if he achieves half of what he did we'd be happy. He'll go over hurdles this season, probably over a stiff two miles, although he'll get two and a half no probloem. He's a smart prospect and he'll start towards the end of October. 04-10-23

runners.name: Impaire Et Passe
runners.breeder: S C E A Haras De Peyre & Mme Pascale Pa
runners.comment: Won Grade 1 Aintree Hurdle last year; major player if jumping better now in cheekpieces
runners.spotlight: Won Grade 1 Aintree Hurdle (2m4f, soft) 12 months ago and made it 2-2 over fences in the Grade 1 Faugheen Novice Chase at Limerick (2m3f, yielding to soft) in December; has also won on good ground; didn't jump well when third at Leopardstown in February (Croke Park about 5l ahead in second) but he's a major player if the first-time cheekpieces help him find fluency.

quotes.race: Guinness 00 Faugheen Novice Chase (Grade 1)
quotes.quote: Impaire Et Passe travelled really well on the bridle the whole way. He met the first four fences spot on and that gave him a lot of confidence so I just sat against him at a couple of his fences. From the back of the second-last to the last he really picked up and he was long and brave at the last - Daryl Jacob, jockey.

quotes.race: SIS Beginners Chase
quotes.quote: Impaire Et Passe  jumped brilliantly. He got a bit lackadaisical in the middle of the race but I opened him up at the back of the second last and he just took off and got a great jump at the last. He did everything I wanted him to do. He was quick over the first couple and just popped away after that. He just went asleep on me a bit and I hoped when I asked him that he would come alive and he did. I'm very happy with that - Paul Townend, rider

quotes.race: bet365 Select Hurdle (Grade 2) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: I was hoping Impaire Et Passe would come alive when I wanted him to and he did. He's not flashy at home but he keeps it for the track and that's where you need it most - Paul Townend, rider.

quotes.race: William Hill Aintree Hurdle (Grade 1) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: I would have been happier with a stronger pace and something to aim at for longer.  I thought Impaire Et Passe pulled up a little bit in front. It's nice to have him back. He's had his day today. He has a tendency to do it [jumping to the right and wandering] and I'd have liked company, but the other jockeys aren't silly, they aren't going to give me help. He quickened smartly to go and win well and then he's just had a look around in the last 100 yards - Paul Townend, jockey.

quotes.race: Matheson Hurdle (Grade 1)
quotes.quote: Impaire Et Passe is bred to stay, he won over two-five at Cheltenham last season and I don't think it will be a problem for him. But he'd be there or thereabouts coming around the last bend in a Champion Hurdle, and who knows what's going to happen between now and March. We'll keep all options open - Willie Mullins, trainer.

quotes.race: Alanna Homes Champion Novice Hurdle (Grade 1)
quotes.quote: Would you have backed him turning in? Me neither. Impaire Et Passe didn't impress me at all. I'm delighted he won, and by so far, but during the race he was not impressing me. He didn't look like he was enjoying it and maybe Cheltenham took much more out of him than we thought. At home he was on fire, and maybe I did too much with him because he was doing so well. I know it's hard to say something was wrong when he won by that much. He loved the hill at Cheltenham so much, he really got going, and maybe on this flatter track he was not as effective. I'll have a good chat with Paul about it, but he has a huge engine to win despite not looking like he was enjoying himself. We were thinking of going to France with him but we might have to think again about that - Willie Mullins, trainer.

quotes.race: Ballymore Novices' Hurdle (Grade 1) (Registered As The Baring Bingham) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: You have to look at everything, including the Champion Hurdle. Yesterday I was telling Michael Buckley, we'll have to go shopping again to find one to beat you (Constitution Hill), but maybe we haven't yet! Impaire Et Passe is in the same sort of mould with his speed, jumping and the way he came up the hill, so maybe we have one - Willie Mullins, trainer.

quotes.race: SkyBet Moscow Flyer Novice Hurdle (Grade 2)
quotes.quote: Impair Et Passe does not show us that at home, but he showed a good turn of foot today. I was very happy with him. He jumped like a buck and the only hurdle he was slow at was the last. It's hard to know how good he is because he shows so little at home yet does it on the track. I think he's very smart and he gave me a great feel today - Paul Townend, rider

quotes.race: Jack Carter Naas Member Maiden Hurdle
quotes.quote: Impaire Et Passe galloped to the line on that ground. He has a lot of scope in his jumping and he did everything right. He is very much one to look forward to. He is not in the Grade 1 here in January, something like the Moscow Flyer at Punchestown might suit - Willie Mullins, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: There's a good chance he might miss Cheltenham. He would have gone for the two-and-a-half-mile novice chase if it was still there, but he might go to Aintree or Fairyhouse instead. I think Aintree would be my preference for him at this stage. 5-2-25

A lovely French import who has impressed in each of his two runs for me. Last time he won the Grade 2 Moscow Flyer comfortably and he heads to Cheltenham now. He could be a bit special and there are two options - the Supreme and Ballymore. He could run over two miles but you'd probably looking at going further. The beauty is that with his temperament he could go for either. 08-03-23

runners.name: Jango Baie
runners.comment: Rallied to win the Arkle at Cheltenham and this step back up in trip is a likely positive
runners.spotlight: Short-headed in Grade 1 Scilly Isles at Sandown (2m4f, heavy) in February on second chase start and rallied from a very unpromising position to win the Arkle at Cheltenham (2m, good to soft) last month; unraced on good ground; ran big races over hurdles on both visits here and he's a leading contender with the step back up in trip likely to be in his favour.

quotes.race: My Pension Expert Arkle Challenge Trophy Novices' Chase (Grade 1) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: We have said the whole way through that this is not a two-mile horse. If the Turners would have been here like last year then I suspect I know what we would have been in. Jango Baie wants two and a half miles. We thought we were going to make the running, but he had no chance because he couldn't go fast enough it was as simple as that. He was flat to the boards the whole way. I don't know if we will see him out again this season, but if we do it won't be over two miles - Nicky Henderson, trainer.

quotes.race: SSS Super Alloys Novices' Chase (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: My rule is to not come here first time over fences, but Jango Baie is very clever and it was beautiful. It was very good to watch - Nicky Henderson, trainer.

quotes.race: bet365 Premier Novices' Hurdle (Grade 2) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: That's the second time he's had to come out in really good races with a 5lb penalty, it stops them. You win a Grade 1 but you can't have your cake and eat it. You pay the penalty. Jango Baie is a good horse but he wants to go up in trip, two miles two round here is a bit tight for him - Nicky Henderson, trainer.

quotes.race: William Hill Formby Novices' Hurdle (Grade 1) (Formerly Registered As The Tolworth Hurdle) (GBB)
quotes.quote: Jango Baie switched off and travelled well and I knew he would find a lot after the last. He's got a lot of improving to do again as he was a bit big at his hurdles, I'm sure he'll improve again. He finished his race off really well and will probably want further in time. I'm sure he'll probably be more of a two-and-a-half horse by then [the spring], hopefully he'll have big targets now - James Bowen, jockey.

quotes.race: GL Events Novices' Hurdle (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: They just crawled and Jango Baie is rather exuberant. He's nice but I didn't really want it going that way - it's not our normal way of riding novices first time out but they weren't going fast enough for him. He's done bloody well to put his head down and get back up. He's very talented but just needs to learn to do it the right way round - Nicky Henderson, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: In the absence of Sir Gino, it's very possible he'll switch from two and a half miles, which is what he's been running over, to two miles for the Arkle. The idea originally was to see if he stayed three miles, but our line of thought has changed, and although you can't make a horse go faster or further just by giving them speed work or running them over a longer trip, you can look at what they're naturally capable of. He did win a Grade 1 novice hurdle over two miles and half a furlong, so he's not slow, and our feeling is that he's got more chance of being very competitive at two miles than he has of staying three miles in the Brown Advisory.  16-2-25

runners.name: Mark Of Gold
runners.comment: Has run well in Grade 2 novice chases this season but it's likely he'll be vulnerable here
runners.spotlight: Experienced hurdler who won Grade 2 novice on chase debut at Ascot (2m3f, good to soft) in December and made it 2-4 over fences in warm little handicap at Exeter (2m1f, good) last time; ran well behind two of these in Grade 2 at Kempton in February but likely to be vulnerable in this company.

quotes.race: Howden Noel Novices' Chase (Grade 2) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Mark Of Gold is a good horse and we were quite confident coming here. It's a big thing to do first time over fences as Ascot is a tricky track to jump round, but it was a small field and it was like running in a normal novice chase. You used to be able to get them, but you can't get them anymore and you'd rather start him and give him a good experience. He's done that and picked up a big prize. The aim was to go to Plumpton on January 5, but I'm not sure we'll do that now. We could still do it, but we'll have to seriously consider him over fences now as he took to them so well - Josh Moore, joint-trainer.

quotes.race: Coral Racing Club Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: I schooled Mark Of Gold yesterday and he was fresh and well, so I was confident he'd run well today. He jumped and travelled well and had the turn of foot to put it to bed. I think a smaller field suits him as he's the type of horse who doesn't like to be crowded. We were disappointed he fell in the Lanzarote last time because we thought he'd have gone close - Caoilin Quinn, jockey.

stable_tour.quote: It was great to see him win the same race at Kempton in February for the second year running and he ran well on the Flat at Goodwood this month. He'll start off on the handicap hurdle route again but we'll probably school him over fences at some stage and that might give him more options, depending how it goes. 29-10-24

runners.name: Rubaud
runners.breeder: B Decouz & S C E A Du Bas Bugey

prev_owners.owner: SAS Racing D & Olivier De Seyssel

runners.comment: Has made good transition to fences; could find some improvement if good ground prevails
runners.spotlight: Prolific over hurdles (including Grade 2 wins) and 1l second to classy yardstick in Grade 2 Kingmaker at Warwick (2m, soft) in February on second chase start, before going one better in Grade 2 Pendil at Kempton (2m4f, good to soft); he's 5lb worse off with 1l runner-up Boombawn compared to last time, and others have stronger form, but his peak hurdles efforts came on good going and he could find some improvement if such ground prevails; not ruled out.

quotes.race: Ladbrokes Pendil Novices' Chase (Grade 2) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: I am amazed Rubaud has won. I thought down the back he was in a bit of trouble. As Harry said, he hates ground that like. It's the first time he has won on soft ground and he's a much better horse on better ground. He had a hard enough race at Warwick the other day and two weeks is quick enough but he toughed it out and stayed on really strongly, which was a doubt over this trip. I'd say we'll freshen him up now and go to Aintree for the two and a half mile novices' chase (Manifesto Novices' Chase) - Paul Nicholls, trainer.

quotes.race: BetMGM Elite Hurdle (Grade 2) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Rubaud is a fantastic horse and is improving. We'll go chasing now. He's a brilliant jumper, he's a big, scopey horse and that's his future now. We'll go to Kempton for the Wayward Lad but if we found a beginners chase we could look at that. I'd be happy to go straight to Kempton though.    He beat two good horses that are rated higher than him and giving them 6lb. He'll be brilliant when we go chasing - Paul Nicholls, trainer.

quotes.race: TrustATrader Approved And Reviewed Trades People Hurdle (Listed Race) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: That was awesome. Rubaud is going to be a chaser at some point, but I don't need to when there are good hurdle races and there are no novice chases at the moment. Wincanton is the obvious target, then go chasing after that - Paul Nicholls, trainer.

quotes.race: JenningsBet Elite Hurdle (Grade 2) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: The plan is to go to the Christmas Hurdle on Boxing Day then come back here for the Kingwell after Christmas. When these horses start improving you don't know where they'll end up and the Christmas Hurdle will give us a marker where we are. Someone has got to take Constitution Hill on.
