We'll go there and if we finished second we'll be delighted. Rubaud will be be a lovely two-mile chaser next season and we'll just pick our races with him this season - Paul Nicholls, trainer.

quotes.race: Trustatrader Approved And Reviewed Trades People Hurdle (Listed Race) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: I thought Rubaud looked big enough for his first run of the season, so he's going to improve and he'll go to Wincanton in three weeks for the Elite Hurdle. That was always the plan; here and Wincanton. He stays on strong and goes a good gallop, so I'm thrilled with him. It suits him going right-handed and we'll probably run him in the Christmas Hurdle as then as something has got to finish second to Constitution Hill. It's good prize-money so we'll go there and we'll stay hurdling this season and then go chasing next autumn as he's only five. We did think about fences, but I thought he'd improve hurdling and we just lacked a horse of what I'd call his calibre to do those Wincanton races, the Elite and Kingwell, which would suit him quite well. He doesn't want a bog, while he's not slow, but is a staying two-miler  - Paul Nicholls, trainer.

quotes.race: Coral Scottish Champion Hurdle (A Limited Handicap) (Grade 2) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Rubaud had been a bit keen earlier in the season but we still thought we'd try to ride him positively. He's been improving all the time, it was the best thing I ever did not running him at Aintree last week on the soft ground. He'll be some two-mile chaser next season, I can't wait - Paul Nicholls, trainer.

quotes.race: Sky Bet Dovecote Novices' Hurdle (Grade 2) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Rubaud won twice earlier in the season making all at Taunton. The ground was a bit soft here on Boxing Day, and the whole thing went wrong in the Betfair Hurdle as he got a bit lit up. Today was much better. He relaxed and jumped great and galloped on strong. He had a bit of form in France before he ran here last year but he made a bit of a noise and he bled that day, so he had his wind sorted out and we gave him some time. That was what he done earlier in the season at Taunton, he absolutely bolted in by going from the front. He is a good horse - he has just got to learn to relax a bit more. We won't go for the Supreme as we have Tahmuras for that and he is probably not ready for that. You are not going to dominate around there. Aintree is probably a bit easier for a front runner. I think a flat track suits him nicely and we will keep him nice and fresh, and though it is a big step up we will go for the Grade 1 over two miles at Aintree. The exciting thing is he will be a lovely two-mile chaser next season - Paul Nicholls, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: He's another who likes Kempton and the Wayward Lad looks an ideal race for him, so we're looking forward to that. 20-12-24

runners.name: The Kalooki Kid
runners.comment: Stylish wins in handicaps the last twice; it remains to be seen where his limitations lie
runners.spotlight: Impressed in Doncaster handicap (2m3f, good to soft) in December on second chase start and travelled well when again doing it nicely in Musselburgh handicap (2m4f, good to soft) in February; won on good ground over hurdles; this is a vastly tougher test of his credentials but he arrives fresh and it remains to be seen where his limitations lie; interesting contender.

quotes.race: bet365 Scottish Champion Chase (For The Bowes-Lyon Trophy) Handicap Chase (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: The Kalooki Kid is a good traveller, good jumper and that was a good display on just his third chase. He's doing well for a young horse and my owners are local from Kirkcaldy so they are over the moon. I don't know what the handicapper will do, but I think he's got Aintree written all over him. There's a two-and-a-half-mile handicap that might suit him, and looking towards next year, something like the Paddy Power at Cheltenham might suit - Nicky Richards, trainer.

quotes.race: bet365 Novices' Limited Handicap Chase (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: The Kalooki Kid jumped from fence to fence and travelled very well. We were up at the front end and stayed out of the carnage - Danny McMenamin, jockey.

stable_tour.quote: He was placed in two bumpers last season and then I shouldn't have taken him to Perth as the ground was wrong and it was getting late in the season. His schooling has gone well and I hope there's a good bit of fun to be had with him. 25-10-23

2:20.going_detailed: GOOD TO SOFT, Good in places on Mildmay course (GoingStick: Mildmay Hurdle 5.0, Mildmay Chase 5.4, Grand National course 5.2) (Watering)

runners.name: Aviemore
runners.comment: Has won his last two but the stable jockey is on Filibustering this time
runners.spotlight: Fairly useful on Flat for Charlie Johnston and going the right way over hurdles, winning 2m juvenile races at Warwick (soft) and Huntingdon (good to soft) in recent months; stable jockey Paul O'Brien partnered him at Huntingdon but is on Filibustering this time.

quotes.race: Join Racing TV Now Juvenile Maiden Hurdle (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Aviemore definitely took a step forward from his hurdling debut and he was entitled to. He benefited from that initial experience and he's not a bad little horse. He galloped all the way to the line and the team can have a lot of fun with him. He has Flat form on heavy ground, so he's versatile regarding conditions - Alice Stevens, jockey.

runners.name: Coconut Grove
runners.breeder: S A R L Haras De Hus
runners.comment: Won sole Flat start in France but this is a very tough introduction to hurdles
runners.spotlight: Poniros showed it is possible to win a Grade 1 juvenile on hurdle debut at Cheltenham recently but he was battle hardened from some strong handicaps on the Flat, whereas this son of Mastercraftsman has had only one start on the level, winning a 1m4f conditions event in France (good to soft) in September; can only be watched.

runners.name: Filibustering
runners.comment: Comfortable all-the-way winner on last month's Kelso hurdle debut; very promising
runners.spotlight: Developed into a quite useful middle-distance stayer on the Flat for Tim Easterby and made a promising start to his hurdle career for new connections with a comfortable all-the-way success at Kelso (2m, good to soft) last month; tougher ask trying to dominate this field but he's very promising and Paul O'Brien seemingly prefers him to stablemate Aviemore.

runners.name: Gibbs Island
runners.comment: Won first two hurdle races but pulled too hard in the Triumph; now equipped with a hood
runners.spotlight: Fairly useful on Flat in Ireland and quickly translated that ability to hurdles for new connections, winning a maiden at Sedgefield (2m1f, soft) and Victor Ludorum at Haydock (1m7f, good to soft; beat Give It To Me Oj by 6l) on first two starts; weakened after pulling too hard in the Triumph at Cheltenham (2m1f, good to soft) last month and is now equipped with a hood.

quotes.race: Victor Ludorum Juvenile Hurdle (Go North Grey Bomber Series Qualifier) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: We were quietly confident as his work had improved since Sedgefield. Gibbs Island looks a really nice prospect. He looks a better jumper than he did a Flat horse and he jumped so well. He's got a festival entry but we'll see as he's only a four-year-old with his whole life in front of him. We'll take our time and try to make the right decision - Tom Lacey, trainer.

quotes.race: Irish EBF Median Sires Series Maiden (IRE Incentive Race)
quotes.quote: Gibbs Island did it well and ground it out. He had a nice run at Roscommon and we thought that the step up in trip would be in his favour. He is a good mover and is not dependent on ground - Andy Oliver, trainer

runners.name: Give It To Me Oj
runners.comment: Placed behind useful sorts in first two hurdle races before landing odds at Newbury
runners.spotlight: Third to East India Dock and Hot Fuss at Wincanton (1m7f, good) and 6l second to Gibbs Island at Haydock (1m7f, good to soft) in his first two hurdle races, before justifying short-priced favouritism at Newbury (2m, soft) five weeks ago, his first success under either code; probably has more to offer but a good chunk of improvement will be needed to get heavily involved.

quotes.race: Get Best Odds Guaranteed At BetVictor Juvenile Hurdle (Novices' Championship Hurdle Qualifier) (GBB)
quotes.quote: Apart from the last, Give It To Me OJ jumped well. He was going a bit left-handed, but that might have been because the front horse was going left-handed. Through no fault of his own he's had a messed up season, but he needed that run the other day when he was second - Gary Moore, joint-trainer.

stable_tour.quote: He's been running well on the Flat all summer without winning but has taken well to hurdling at home and ran well on his first start over jumps at Wincanton on Sunday. He was beaten by two higher-rated Flat horses and looked like a stiffer test would have suited him better. It was a good start and he'll improve for it. There could be a nice juvenile hurdle in him this winter. 29-10-24

runners.name: Live Conti
runners.owner: G Mason, J Hales, P Hogath, Sir A Ferguson
runners.comment: French recruit who did it easily at Wetherby; potential for significant improvement
runners.spotlight: Made a winning debut at Auteuil (2m2f, heavy) in October and had little difficulty landing very short odds in a Wetherby juvenile hurdle (2m, soft) for new connections in February; it was a weak race at Wetherby but he could no more than win easily and has the potential for significant improvement.

quotes.race: Book Tickets Now At wetherbyracing.co.uk Juvenile Hurdle (Go North Grey Bomber Qualifier) (GBB)
quotes.quote: We got Live Conti in November and I'm glad we didn't run him earlier as he's really improved in the last month and keeps thriving. We had to run at some point and this wasn't a deep race, so you'd hope he wins like he has. The form of his Auteuil race is very good and we'll decide whether we go to Cheltenham or wait for Aintree, but he's a horse who is further down the line as he's already quite furnished and strong. It could be one or the other he goes to - Dan Skelton, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: He runs at Wetherby on Wednesday and we really like him. We'll just have to see whether he's a horse for the Triumph and Harry [Skelton] will tell us if he feels he's suitable for a race like that after he runs. He looks a very nice horse at home and long-term I'd say he's a proper chaser in the making.  10-2-25

runners.name: Mambonumberfive
runners.comment: Pulled up on British debut but different proposition when winning Kempton Grade 2 since
runners.spotlight: Bought for 450,000euros after placing in two of his three hurdle races in France; raced too freely when pulled up in Grade 2 at Cheltenham (soft) on British debut but showed why new connections went to such a big amount to acquire him when winning the Adonis at Kempton (2m, good to soft) in February; that doesn't look strong Grade 2 form, though.

quotes.race: Ladbrokes Adonis Juvenile Hurdle (Grade 2) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Mambonumberfive was obviously a nice horse in France and he always looked like a great big individual that was going to take time. He is 17 hands and I would say he is chaser two years down the line so this is a bit of a bonus. He didn't jump very well over the first three or four. Going down the back straight, the penny dropped with him and he then jumped and travelled well. He has seen the trip out well. He is a young horse and Ben [Jones, jockey] wanted to give him plenty of time. He is a brute of a horse and maybe wasn't tuned up for Cheltenham but that run has put him perfect for today and going forward we can look at Cheltenham now I guess. He is an exciting prospect - Ben Pauling, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: You can't believe they got three runs into him in France because he's a big horse and an outright chaser of the future. We're taking a pull with him, and if he's going to lose his novice status this season it's going to be for a proper race. If you don't see him he'll return as a very exciting novice hurdler next season. We love him. 21-11-24

runners.name: Naturally Nimble
runners.comment: Grade 3 win in second hurdle race and decent run in Grade 2; part of strong hand for yard
runners.spotlight: Flat maiden winner on good; only seventh on soft-ground hurdle debut but much improved when seeing off Willy De Houelle to win Grade 3 at Fairyhouse (yielding) just eight days later; had that reopposing rival behind him again when a respectable fourth under a penalty in Grade 2 at the Leopardstown Christmas meeting and arrives as a fresh horse with potential.

quotes.race: Bar One Racing "Price Boosts Across All Channels" Juvenile Hurdle (Grade 3)
quotes.quote: Naturally Nimble disappointed us a little last week so we thought that we would hunt around and see what happened. He did it well. They went a good gallop and the race fell apart in front of us and we were there to pick up the pieces. He stuck at it well and he enjoyed the nice ground. He ran at a high level on the Flat and hopefully he can keep improving - Richie Deegan, rider

quotes.race: Lynn Lodge Stud Maiden
quotes.quote: Naturally Nimble was entitled to do that. I always thought he was a nice horse and just took a while to come to hand - Dylan Browne McMonagle, rider.

runners.name: Puturhandstogether
runners.comment: Ready winner of Fred Winter at Cheltenham; can take the step up to Graded level in stride
runners.spotlight: Big improver back on a sounder surface when a comfortable winner of the Fred Winter handicap at the Cheltenham Festival (extended 2m, good to soft) 23 days ago, cruising into it and drawing 6l clear from the last for only hand riding; definitely capable of better and can take the step up to Grade 1 level in his stride.

quotes.race: Hallgarten And Novum Wines Juvenile Handicap Hurdle (Registered As Fred Winter) (Premier Hcap) (GBB)
quotes.quote: This race is always won by ex-Flat horses, but I suppose that is where the improvement has come from having run on winter ground then getting a bit of spring ground today as he seemed to thrive on it. Puturhandstogether did surprise me as we didn't think he was that well handicapped. I suppose at half-way it looked as if he was going very easy and he cruised into the race. Mark [Walsh] gave him a great ride as the pace was on, but he took a sit and let them all at it. I would say that was probably the difference today. I suppose we will see what the handicapper does. We have gone onto the Galway Hurdle with some of the horses in the past so that might be a logical step - Joseph O'Brien, trainer.

quotes.race: Bar One Racing "Bet 10 Euros Get 50 Euros Sign Up Offer" 3-Y-O Maiden Hurdle
quotes.quote: Puturhandstogether put in a nice performance and his jumping was a lot sharper today. I don't think he will go into a graded race, we will try and find a winners-of-one - Joseph O'Brien, trainer.

runners.name: Terrorise
runners.comment: Fair 1m2f Flat winner but big outsider at this level on hurdle debut
runners.spotlight: Fair 1m2f Flat winner for this yard last year but surely being asked too big a question on this hurdle debut.

stable_tour.quote: He's done well from two to three. His first run last year was good as he finished third at Newcastle, one place behind a smart horse of Adrian Keatley's [Ballymount Boy]. He then went downhill because he was too weak, but he didn't run badly at Newcastle on Tuesday on his return. 03-04-24

runners.name: Wendrock
runners.comment: Ran well behind Puturhandstogether at Cheltenham but it's hard to see him turning tables
runners.spotlight: Won a Leopardstown maiden (2m, yielding) just after Christmas; produced quite a useful performance under joint top weight when sixth of 20 finishers to Puturhandstogether (who received 6lb) in the Fred Winter at Cheltenham but well held in a Grade 1 at Leopardstown prior to that and it's unlikely he'll turn the tables on Joseph O'Brien's charge.

stable_tour.quote: I thought he ran better than his finishing position [seventh of eight] suggests in the Grade 1 at Leopardstown. He probably made his move a bit early in the race and got tired. He's the sort of juvenile I could see running well in the Fred Winter.  19-2-25

runners.name: Willy De Houelle
runners.comment: Fourth in Leopardstown Grade 1 in February; well held in Triumph since; Townend on Murcia
runners.spotlight: French debut winner; has some useful form in defeat since, notably his fourth in a Leopardstown Grade 1 (2m, soft) in February, but he needs to bounce back from a poor run in the Triumph at Cheltenham and Paul Townend sides with Murcia.

stable_tour.quote: We changed tactics with him at the weekend. I wanted those tactics to be carried out at Christmas, but it didn't work out. We can work on him now after that run at Leopardstown and you'd have to think the Boodles might be the race for him. 5-2-25

runners.name: Murcia
runners.breeder: Sarl De Chambure Haras D'Etreham Et Al
runners.comment: French Listed winner and better form in defeat since; place shout with 7lb filly allowance
runners.spotlight: Won an Auteuil Listed hurdle last summer; bettered that form when narrowly denied in a Naas rated event (1m7f, soft) in February and ran to a similar level when eighth of 20 finishers to Puturhandstogether (who received 6lb) under joint top weight in the Fred Winter at Cheltenham; whether a 13lb swing in the weights will be enough for her to get the better of her Cheltenham conqueror remains to be seen but she's a place contender at the least for a stable with a good record in this race with fillies.

stable_tour.quote: A sharp filly with some fine French form. She looks a nice recruit to the yard and has a lovely pedigree. She has already won a Listed race at Auteuil and she's one we can't wait to get started on the track. 25-11-24

4:40.race_name: Close Brothers Red Rum Handicap Chase (Premier Handicap) (GBB Race)
4:40.going_detailed: GOOD TO SOFT, Good in places on Mildmay course (GoingStick: Mildmay Hurdle 5.0, Mildmay Chase 5.4, Grand National course 5.2) (Watering)

runners.name: Tommys Oscar
runners.comment: Suited by a sharp 2m; back on latest winning mark; prefers good to soft or slower ground
runners.spotlight: Ideally suited by a sharp 2m and he's back on the same mark as for an Ayr win last April; however, he prefers good to soft or slower ground and the sunny forecast spells danger; looks to have his work cut out trying to give weight to all bar one.

quotes.race: Scotty Brand Handicap Chase (Premier Handicap) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: It's quite an occasion, beating all these top horses from the south and Ireland. It was a great performance. My wife made me drive 725 miles because Tommy's Oscar just doesn't settle if we stop overnight. Last time at Doncaster he jumped to the right too much but we knew he would go well because he's fresh again. Everywhere we go he has 12st but he carries it very well, it's amazing how he does because he's a light-framed horse - Ian Hamilton, owner.

quotes.race: NSPCC School Service Simply Ned Handicap Chase (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Tommy's Oscar did it so easy with 12st on his back. It was a good performance. Sean said he took a blow down the back, then came back on the bridle. He said he was still tightening the bridle just before the last and then he was idling a bit in front. I don't know where the hell we're going to run him. He'd won only two races over fences before today so we thought he could go in a graduation chase at Carlisle, but that's stopped that now. He's not a Cheltenham horse. He doesn't like the undulations. But beggars can't be choosers and we might just have to go there. We can't find anywhere else at the moment. He wants something in a month's time - Ian Hamilton, owner.

quotes.race: MND Association Race For Research Lightning Novices' Chase (Grade 2) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: That was just the job. Tommy's Oscar wants better ground and a flat track. He'll go to Aintree, I suppose. He's not a Cheltenham horse, it's too undulating for him. We'd like to find another race for him but Ann and I are getting on a bit and we cannot travel too far. Ian Hamilton, assistant trainer.

quotes.race: From The Horses Mouth Podcast Arkle Challenge Trophy Trial Novices' Chase (Grade 2) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Tommy's Oscar has done nothing wrong. it got a bit tight turning in but that's racing and he's used to it. He settled a lot better than when he ran in the Champion Hurdle. He ran a blinder. He prefers a flat track but he came down the hill okay - Danny McMenamin, rider.  He boiled over. We've got the diesel money for the way home. Danny said he needed the run again. We'll come back for the Arkle. He's entered in the Fighting Fifth and he could go there, it's just down the road for us - Ian Hamilton.

quotes.race: Book Your Christmas Party Now Novices' Limited Handicap Chase (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: They went fast and didn't hang about. Tommy's Oscar was badly in need of a run and will come on a ton. He jumped like a buck and straight as a die, so he's a super jumper. We only schooled him once but he's run in point-to-points in the past. We'll look at the valuable graduation race here next month and if he goes and wins that we'll probably stop over fences. A lot of people say you shouldn't go back to hurdles [once you go chasing] but I'm pleased we've got him and he's a fair horse - Ian Hamilton, owner.

quotes.race: 'The New One' Unibet Hurdle (Grade 2) (Registered As The Champion Hurdle Trial Race)
quotes.quote: Tommy's Oscar is a lovely horse who tries his best. He's very straightforward and does everything you ask and if we're going to have a go at Cheltenham, I suppose this is the year to do it, while the horses are well - Ann Hamilton, trainer.

quotes.race: bet365 Handicap Hurdle (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Tommy's Oscar did well off topweight after going up 9lb from the last day. I don't need to sing the praises of the trainer anymore - she's fantastic - Brian Hughes, jockey.

quotes.race: Betfair Pays Tribute To Andy Stewart Handicap Hurdle (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Tommy's Oscar was good today. He didn't get the trip at Carlisle on heavy ground. It was different today on an easier track over two mile three on better ground. He's a chaser but the other one in the next [Pay The Piper] is similarly handicapped, so where do you go? We will chase him but we always thought there was a decent hurdle in him first - Ian Hamilton, owner.

stable_tour.quote: He just didn't run his race last time at Kelso, which was his first time out this season, but he's well. There's just been little bits of setbacks, but he's on the way back and the plan is to go Kelso on December 8. It's a new two-mile open handicap at the track and we like to try to stay as local as possible with him, but a lot of the high-rated handicaps he could run in are further south. He's on track and we're happy with him. 25-11-24

runners.name: Hunters Yarn
runners.comment: Impressive in 2m1f beginners chase last January; injured on latest; interesting if at best
runners.spotlight: Has two ways of jumping but he's perfectly capable of a virtually unblemished round, as when so impressive in a good beginners chase at Fairyhouse (2m1f, soft; has won on good to yielding) last January; this season has gone badly so far but he returned with a bruised sternum when pulled up in January and would be very interesting if back to anything like his best; tongue tied for first time since 2021.

quotes.race: I.N.H. Stallion Owners EBF Novice Hurdle (Listed Race)
quotes.quote: Hunters Yarn did not jump as fluently as I hoped but he has a nice turn of foot and he is possibly Supreme Novices' bound. I liked what I saw there and he could be a very smart novice chaser next year - Willie Mullins, trainer.

quotes.race: I.N.H. Stallion Owners EBF Maiden Hurdle
quotes.quote: Hunters Yarn improved from his first run but I wasn't happy with myself the first day - Paul Townend, rider.

quotes.race: Adare (Pro/Am) INH Flat Race
quotes.quote: Hunters Yarn has a lot of ability and it was getting late in the season to lose his novice status, so Willie wanted to go back for a bumper and keep him to be a novice for next year. His hurdles run the last day was a long way below his best, he must have had some setback but I don't know off the top of my head. His work is very good and that's more like it. He's definitely a Graded horse and maybe he'll go for one of those good bumpers in the spring. He could also go for a Graded hurdle. If he won one of those, great, and if he didn't he would still be a novice for next season - Patrick Mullins, rider.

quotes.race: www.thurlesraces.ie (Pro/Am) INH Flat Race
quotes.quote: Hunters Yarn is a very nice horse and things didn't work out perfect in Naas but he came out of the race well and showed he is a very good horse - Pa King, rider

stable_tour.quote: He's strengthened up nicely over the summer and he'll probably stick to two miles over fences. He's done really well since you saw him last and hopefully might pick up a nice handicap. 25-11-24

He's doing nicely over hurdles, having won his last two races at Naas and Navan, the latter in a Listed race where he didn't jump as fluently as I'd hoped. Despite that I liked what I saw there and he's a possible for the Supreme. He's also entered in the County Hurdle. 08-03-23

runners.name: My Mate Mozzie
runners.comment: Involved in strong events on the Flat, over hurdles and fences since last summer; solid
runners.spotlight: Sterling all-purpose type who hasn't won since late 2023 but has been involved in strong events on the Flat, including at Royal Ascot, over hurdles and fences since; ran as well as he ever has when a close fourth in the Grand Annual at Cheltenham (2m, good to soft) last month; solid claims in refitted cheekpieces.

quotes.race: squareintheair.com Novices' Chase (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: That was good. I know it looked like My Mate Mozzie won on the bridle but about five times he's traded at very short odds on but got beat so it's hard to know how much was left. I'm happy with the result, he jumped ok and was still a little bit novicey. You'd love to think he'd go down the two-mile novice route, he's not going to be suitable for soft, winter ground - Gavin Cromwell, trainer.

quotes.race: For Auction Novice Hurdle (Grade 3)
quotes.quote: The only negative I'd have about My Mate Mozzie is that he was jumping right most of the way. I think a right-handed track would suit him better but he's a lovely horse, very straightforward and he travels and jumps. I gave him a squeeze after the second-last and he felt like he sprinted away from them. He's an exciting horse going forward. I gave him a squeeze after the second last but I hadn't fully gone for him and I was very happy I was always going to win - Mark Walsh, jockey

quotes.race: BetVictor Proud To Support Irish Racing Maiden Hurdle
quotes.quote: My Mate Mozzie did what I hoped he'd do. He's a lovely horse and he loves a bit of nice ground. I don't know how he'd get on on winter heavy but he looks a nice festival horse. I wouldn't like to run him on heavy. We could go for the nice ground at Leopardstown and maybe on to the spring. He's a very straightforward horse and has been good since day one. The good ones are easy to train - Gavin Cromwell, trainer.

quotes.race: Avison Young INH Flat Race
quotes.quote: My Mate Mozzie has worked out great so far. He has loads of gears and he jumps really well. It's a nice way to finish the season and hopefully he has a bright future - Gavin Cromwell, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: He's on a break at the moment. He was a bit disappointing in the Irish Cesarewitch but had been running well beforehand, particularly when third at Royal Ascot and in the Galway Hurdle. We probably won't have him back until Christmas and then we'll aim him at the spring. 12-11-24

He's on a break at the moment. He was a bit disappointing in the Irish Cesarewitch but had been running well beforehand, particularly when third at Royal Ascot and in the Galway Hurdle. We probably won't have him back until Christmas and then we'll aim him at the spring. 13-11-24

runners.name: Gunsight Ridge
runners.comment: C&D winner in 2022; back to form with 1m7f win latest; another career-high mark today
runners.spotlight: All four chase wins on heavy and soft; disappointing favourite in the 2022 running of this but he was a C&D winner that autumn; said never to have travelled when pulled up in December but he redeemed himself in refitted cheekpieces when winning from Dr T J Eckleburg at Sandown (1m7f) in February; up 3lb to another career-high mark and today's different ground is a query.

quotes.race: Boylesports Handicap Chase
quotes.quote: Jumping is usually Gunsight Ridge's forte. I like this lad, he's had his wind done as it's helped him. He raced well as he usually races very keen - Olly Murphy, trainer.

quotes.race: Unibet Horserace Betting Operator Of The Year Handicap Chase (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: I'm delighted with that as I was worried about the ground. I left Exeter a month ago like a spoiled child as I couldn't believe we got beat. However, looking at what Venetia's horse has done we clearly bumped into a good horse and I'm not sure he really stayed either. I think Gunsight Ridge could be a horse for the spring festivals. You can get fooled with pointers that they all stay a trip, but this is a sharp horse. I don't think he really stayed and the winner is very good. This is a valuable race and it's a great one to win, and he could be one for something like the Grand Annual or the Red Rum Chase - Olly Murphy, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: He's capable of winning a good handicap chase. He loves soft ground and might just want a bit further than two miles. 24-10-24

He missed the second half of last season because he had an issue behind, but he's back in training now and looking really well, so we'll start off over two or two and a half miles within the next month. I believe there's a really good handicap chase in this horse - when he's on his A game, he's very good. 01-11-23

runners.name: General Medrano
runners.comment: Quite progressive at about 2m until no real impact at Cheltenham latest; left on same mark
runners.spotlight: Generally quite progressive over the winter and there shouldn't be much between him and Dr T J Eckleburg on Haydock form (2m, soft) in November; however he couldn't play a part in the Grand Annual at Cheltenham in March and he's been left on the same mark in another warm race.

quotes.race: Macer Gifford Handicap Chase
quotes.quote: General Medrano is so straightforward. He has won left-handed on better ground at Uttoxeter and he has won on softer ground going right-handed here. Last season was all about learning. He is a big horse and he is just getting stronger. He finished fourth in the two-mile novices' championship final handicap hurdle at Sandown Park and we walked away thinking we can't wait to go over fences. We said if he wins today we can start looking at bigger options, but this is a nice prize and it is a lovely race to win with a lot of history. I think we can be a little bit excited about him now - Emma Lavelle, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: A big horse with a great stride, he was always going to be a chaser. He was a bit keen over hurdles last season but even when everything else was running poorly, he held his form well. He was really impressive on his first two chase starts this season and lost nothing in defeat against a well-handicapped horse at Plumpton on Monday. He's versatile and I think he has the potential to be a good horse. 22-11-23

He's an absolute star, his jumping is sensational and he loves the game. He ran an absolute belter to finish second at Haydock, when ours were just taking a run, and felt amazing afterwards, so I ran him in a Â£50,000 race at Newbury seven days later and he bolted up. I think we went to the well once too often when he ran there next time and he didn't jump so well but we freshened him up and he ran another cracker at Doncaster last week. The Grand Annual is a possibility and I don't think the hurly-burly of that race would bother him. He stays 2m well and the uphill finish shouldn't be an issue. 29-01-25

runners.name: Calico
runners.comment: Good 2m win in October; drying ground will suit; highish mark for this competitive a race
runners.spotlight: Can lead; his one run here was a very respectable show until falling at the last in Grade 1 novice chase at the 2023 meeting; gained a useful win at Cheltenham (2m, good) in October and drying ground will suit but he needs to show he's well enough treated for this competitive a race.

quotes.race: squareintheair.com Handicap Chase (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Calico just got chinned at The November Meeting last year when Triple Trade beat him and I said to John [Reilly] his owner that we might not win for the rest of the year now because I knew how much he'd put in. It has literally taken him a season to get over that run, not just because of that run but also because the handicapper put him up and the opposition got stronger. It was important today that he was fresh and it was nice ground on a track he is good at. Harry gave him a beautiful ride and it all came together. I think we will have to be sparing with him as he is very good fresh and on decent ground. I think we will probably look at the Desert Orchid Chase at Kempton over Christmas for him now, as that is now a limited handicap - Dan Skelton, trainer.

quotes.race: Virgin Bet Cheltenham Festival Money Back Handicap Chase (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: We came very close up the run-in and I was unable to use my stick as I wanted to and Calico responded really well just for hands and heels. I was surprised he battled back like he did and I felt like he was crying out for a lead turning away from the stands. He sees this trip out really well, but has that speed early to get him to the front. Bridget Andrews, jockey

quotes.race: MansionBet Faller Insurance Novices' Hurdle (Novices' Championship Hdl Qual') (GBB Race) (Div II)
quotes.quote: Calico was a nice horse in Germany and was entitled to win like he did. He was just denied in a strong race at Kempton and has a nice turn of foot - Harry Skelton, jockey.

stable_tour.quote: He ran a great race at Cheltenham on Friday and I was gutted to be beaten as he lost it in the final strides. He showed he deserves his place in all the big two-mile handicaps this season and we'll go back to Cheltenham for the December meeting. 21-11-23

runners.name: The Folkes Tiara
runners.comment: In fine form in warm Irish handicaps; yard won this twice in the last 5 years; respected
runners.spotlight: Lost his way a touch in 2024 until returning from a break to win a well-contested Listed handicap at Fairyhouse (2m1f, yielding) in November and he lost nothing in a narrow defeat to a rapid improver at Leopardstown on Boxing Day; the handicapper has had his say but the yard has won two of the last five runnings; has to be respected.

quotes.race: EasyFix Equine Handicap Chase (Listed Race)
quotes.quote: The Folkes Tiara had lost his form a little but great to see him back. His jumping was unreal. Brian thought he was beaten coming to the last but he just winged it. He was brilliant - Henry de Bromhead, trainer

quotes.race: New Smart View Racecards By Racing Post Handicap Chase
quotes.quote: The Folkes Tiara jumped super. Rachael was in front a lot sooner than I thought she would be but he actually jumped his way to the front so she just sat against him and took him back. He toughed it out really well. He got under the last a bit but picked up again and when the other horse came to him, he went away. This ground is key to him as he likes a bit of nice ground. He was second in this race last year and it's great to go one better. We could probably look at the two-mile handicap at the Dublin Racing Festival as he runs well here. That would be the first thing that springs to mind - Robbie Power, stable representative

stable_tour.quote: He was a bit disappointing after winning at Leopardstown over Christmas but he seems to be coming back to form. The plan is to go back to Leopardstown at Christmas. 18-11-24

runners.name: Dr T J Eckleburg
runners.comment: In good heart over the winter but best on soft/heavy ground, so surface switch is a worry
runners.spotlight: In good heart over the winter and there shouldn't be a huge amount between him and General Medrano and Gunsight Ridge on their respective Haydock and Sandown runs; however, all his best form is on soft and heavy ground so the surface switch is a worry.

stable_tour.quote: A nice staying type who should make up into a lovely middle-distance horse. He went close going up in trip at Ripon despite not handling the track. He could improve throughout the year. 10-05-21

We bought him for a bit of sport during the summer and he's taken to fences well. He was possibly gifted the race by the runner-up at Worcester in September but it was a good performance. He'll be great fun throughout the winter. He's quietly going the right way and we're very happy with him. 02-11-23

We did have him in at the five-day entry stage at Haydock last Saturday but we didn't declare him and we'll wait for Chepstow on Friday. He's just a very consistent, genuine fellow - he's won his nice pot now at Haydock last time out, and we'll just continue to run him in those 2m, and maybe 2m4f, races throughout the season. Hopefully he'll continue to give a good account of himself. 24-12-24

runners.name: Sans Bruit
runners.comment: Front-running win in this last year off this mark; disappointing of late; revival possible
runners.spotlight: Won this from the front (soft; acts well on good) 12 months ago but, although he started the winter with two respectable efforts, his form since Christmas leaves much to be desired; back on that last winning mark and market support would suggest there have been green shoots evident at home since last seen in February.

quotes.race: Close Brothers Red Rum Handicap Chase (Premier Handicap) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Last time was a sign of Sans Bruit coming to himself and he had been too keen in the first couple of races here. He took a long time to acclimatise to racing in this country. He's just coming right now and could even go to Ayr and Sandown. I wouldn't be afraid to put him in the Celebration Chase - Paul Nicholls, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: He's gone up in the handicap since winning the Red Rum but has run some solid races this season. He's a good, fun horse who always runs his race. He'll have a Grand Annual entry but is more likely to go to Aintree again. 9-2-25

runners.name: Primoz
runners.comment: Quickly made up into useful chaser before suffering from start problems at Cheltenham
runners.spotlight: Improved hurdle form when winning at Ayr last April and he looked a natural for fences when winning on chase debut at Wetherby (1m7f, good to soft) in October; the path hasn't been smooth for different reasons since and he had problems at the start of the Grand Annual at Cheltenham, thereafter unable to race as prominently as usual and losing heart; still of interest.

quotes.race: Racing TV Profits Returned To Racing Handicap Chase (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Primoz is one of the most talented horses we've dealt with and we've changed his training programme a bit. I don't know where he'll go next but he's a very talented horse if we can get some consistency into him - Lucinda Russell, trainer.

quotes.race: Mary Lofthouse Supporting Spinal Research Handicap Chase
quotes.quote: I got worried because I'd said Primoz is a lovely horse, he's been a great hurdler and is going to make a better chaser, then the chips are down and he's got to prove it. But I think he is going to be a better chaser. I loved the way he jumped - and I believe El Elefante did the same at Worcester, so happy days! Pay The Piper is a real decent two-miler and Primoz was pretty good today - Lucinda Russell, trainer.

quotes.race: Remus Uomo Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: I'm delighted with Primoz. He won well first time then he's been in the wilderness but it's the ground, he doesn't like it soft. He's got a lot of ability and we just needed to get him tighter at home. He looked great today and he'll go chasing next season - Lucinda Russell, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: He's such a lovely horse. He won twice over hurdles last season and his jumping was fantastic when he won on his chase debut at Wetherby this month. We'll take him to some of the bigger tracks now and he should stay as his breeding suggests he'll do so, so we'll probably step him up in trip sooner rather than later. He needs good ground. 30-10-24

runners.name: Petit Tonnerre
runners.breeder: A De La Motte Saint Pierre Et Al
runners.comment: Has run well in handicaps over hurdles and fences here; back to form on latest completion
runners.spotlight: Has run well in handicaps over hurdles and fences on this track; capable of better form than he showed at Newbury in November and refitting cheekpieces seemed to help when winning at Doncaster (2m, good) in January; brought down on his only start since; likely type.

quotes.race: Virgin Bet Every Saturday Money Back Handicap Chase (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: They went quick and that suited Petit Tonnerre, who needs a strong gallop. He jumped well and stuck his neck out, he never thought about stopping - Richie McLernon, jockey.

stable_tour.quote: He has ability but hasn't quite got the job done and was only just beaten back over fences at Aintree. He jumped well there but they probably didn't go enough of a gallop early on for him. He's a bit stronger this season and, while he is a little bit frustrating, I think there's a nice race in him. Left-handed tracks and decent ground suit him best. 06-11-24

runners.name: Galunggung
runners.breeder: E A R L Trinquet Et Al
runners.comment: Excellent rules strike-rate but quicker conditions and rise in class ask some questions
runners.spotlight: Kept the excellent rules strike-rate going with a Carlisle win (2m, soft; effective on good to soft) in February but quicker ground raises some doubts against this more forbidding opposition.

stable_tour.quote: A lovely horse who's had a lot of injuries. He was off for a long time after his debut and then came back and won twice over hurdles. We ran him over fences at Perth and he jumped like a buck and did everything right. He wants two and a half miles and is still fairly treated. If we can keep the wheels on him, he'll have plenty of nice days. 12-11-24

He won his point-to-point at Kirkistown before joining us and had been off for 596 days before making his rules debut for us at Kelso when finishing a most encouraging second to the useful Traprain Law. I was delighted with that return to action and he has pleased me since. He will make a lovely stayer in time but until then keep an eye out for him over hurdles as he is a lovely horse. 09-02-23

runners.name: Inedit Star

prev_owners.owner: Dominique Vigneron, Nicolas Paysan Et Al

runners.comment: Some fair chase and hurdle runs in Britain; bled from the nose in January on latest outing
runners.spotlight: Hurdle winner in France nearly two years ago; some fair chase and hurdle runs in Britain but he bled from the nose when down the field at Sandown in January on latest outing; up against it this time.

runners.name: Rath Gaul Hill
runners.comment: Progressive; narrow 2m winner at Newbury but might come on for the run and do better yet
runners.spotlight: Progressive 7yo who made it three in a row when winning on comeback at Newbury (2m, soft) where he travelled strongly until after the last but only just fended off a determined rival; effectively 8lb higher from out of the weights (3lb wrong) but he might have needed that run and do better yet.

5:15.race_name: Goffs Nickel Coin Mares' Standard Open National Hunt Flat Race (Grade 2) (GBB Race)
5:15.going_detailed: GOOD TO SOFT, Good in places on Mildmay course (GoingStick: Mildmay Hurdle 5.0, Mildmay Chase 5.4, Grand National course 5.2) (Watering)

runners.name: Amelias Star
runners.comment: The manner of her AW success was far from spectacular; doesn't look Graded material
runners.spotlight: No match for the winner at Wetherby then probably didn't need to improve at Newcastle (AW) where the manner of her success was far from spectacular; doesn't look Graded material.

runners.name: Bettys Daisy
runners.comment: Galloped on strongly at Warwick; smart prospect who represents last year's winning yard
runners.spotlight: Bred to do well in bumpers and duly created a favourable impression at Warwick (soft) where she galloped on strongly for a 7l win; smart prospect who represents last year's winning yard; interesting contender.

runners.name: Blue Betty
runners.comment: Stylishly justified favouritism in AW event; plenty to find on form but brings potential
runners.spotlight: Travelled smoothly into contention and stylishly justified favouritism at Newcastle (AW) for a promising debut; now goes in tongue-tie; plenty to find on bare ratings but brings potential.

quotes.race: Watch Unbridled On attheraces.com Mares' Open Maiden NH Flat Race (Cat 3 Elimination) (GBB) (Div II)
quotes.quote: I'll have to speak to the owners, but the idea beforehand was if Blue Betty ran well here then Aintree would be the place to be. It's only January but she may well have a break before then as she's been on the go for a while. She's a lovely mare who has always shown plenty at home and was very impressive there - Fergal O'Brien, trainer.

runners.name: Celestron Star
runners.comment: Justified support at Hereford but needs significant further progress to follow up
runners.spotlight: Justified market support at Hereford (good) but didn't do it in the style of a Graded mare and needs significant further progress to follow up that success.

runners.name: Charisma Cat
runners.comment: Unlucky at Market Rasen; gained compensation at Sandown, taking record to 3-4; big player
runners.spotlight: All starts on good to soft ground; should be unbeaten as she looked unlucky (behind Kingston Queen) in a Market Rasen Listed event that threw up the winners of this contest in 2023 and 2024; gained compensation in same grade at Sandown, ridden out and taking record to 3-4; trainer has landed this prize three times; strong credentials.

quotes.race: British Stallion Studs EBF Mares' Standard Open National Hunt Flat Race (Listed Race) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Charisma Cat didn't seem to handle the bends very well, but she has come back on the bridle. She wouldn't want this ground as it is hard work on the hurdle track. We all felt the one at Market Rasen was one that got away, but she didn't handle the track at all. She got shuffled well back, but she would have won in another couple of strides. We made up for it today, and we got a win, and some black type. If we are happy she will go to Aintree - Alan King, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: She's a homebred of the Waley-Cohen family, by Nathaniel, who's one of the most exciting stallions out there, and she won well at Southwell in the summer. She had a break but has come back into strong work and will have another run in a bumper, but we definitely think she's above average. 25-10-24

She's a homebred of the Waley-Cohen family, by Nathaniel who's one of the most exciting stallions out there, and won well at Southwell in the summer. She had a break but has come back into strong work and will have another run in a bumper but we definitely think she's above average. 07-11-24

runners.name: Getawhisky
runners.comment: Finished behind two of these rivals last time but ran well and may do better still
runners.spotlight: Both starts on good to soft; beat the consistent Roses All The Way at Carlisle; finished behind Kingston Queen and Charisma Cat at Market Rasen but ran well and may do better still.

runners.name: Highland Haven
runners.comment: Collared in the final stride by stablemate Strong Run, who received 4lb, at Warwick
runners.spotlight: Thrice-raced mare who ran well under a penalty at Warwick (soft) most recently, collared in the final stride by stablemate Strong Run; gets 4lb pull with that rival and brings a respectable rating.

runners.name: Jackie Hobbs
runners.comment: Stylish winner at Ascot; unbeaten mare who is potentially smart and commands respect
runners.spotlight: Irish point winner who was bought by current connections for Â£130,000 at the Goffs Aintree Sale a year ago; has justified favouritism in both rules attempts, latest stylishly at Ascot (good); this unbeaten mare looks potentially smart and commands respect.

stable_tour.quote: We saw her point-to-point win and then loved her again at the sales and we were delighted to get her. She's doing everything very nicely and will make her bumper debut towards the backend of next month. We're looking to run her three times in bumpers and hopefully pick up black type in the spring. 24-10-24

runners.name: Kapability
runners.breeder: S C E A De La Vallee De L'Orne
runners.comment: May progress returned to Aintree and better ground; scored over C&D in October
runners.spotlight: Promising debut in C&D contest (good) in October, beating a useful rival; unplaced favourite on soft going at Huntingdon (Listed) since; may progress returned to Aintree and forecast better ground.

quotes.race: Racing TV Mares' Open National Hunt Flat Race (Category 1 Elimination) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Kapability is a nice filly to do that first time. Anthony [Honeyball] said he hadn't fully wound her up yet. She felt above average - Harry Cobden, jockey.

runners.name: Kingston Queen
runners.comment: Improving mare; held on from unlucky Charisma Cat at Market Rasen (Listed) most recently
runners.spotlight: Improving mare whose rules record is 3211, most recently holding on from unlucky Charisma Cat in a Market Rasen Listed event (good to soft) that produced the winners of this prize in 2023 and 2024; not certain to confirm placings with that rival but is still a notable player on form.

runners.name: La Conquiere
runners.breeder: Franklin Finance & S Vidal & E Ribard
runners.comment: Close second at Thurles in sole start for Denis Leahy; heed the market signals
runners.spotlight: Belied her 80-1 odds with a close second behind odds-on shot at Thurles (good) in sole start for Denis Leahy; the betting may help to gauge whether she's likely to improve on that effort.

runners.name: La Zoubida
runners.breeder: Dr V Roger-Yves Simon Et Al
runners.comment: Probably didn't need to improve in winning at Market Rasen; this is a harder task
runners.spotlight: Both outings on good to soft; proved no match for Kingston Queen at Sedgefield then probably didn't need to improve in justifying favouritism at Market Rasen; this is a harder task.

runners.name: Oldschool Outlaw
runners.comment: Close second at Leopardstown but seems inferior to her compatriot Seo Linn
runners.spotlight: Irish mare who failed to justify favouritism in two points; belied her 33-1 odds with close second at Leopardstown (yielding) on the switch to rules but seems inferior to her compatriot Seo Linn.

runners.name: Queen Kate
runners.comment: Won with something to spare at Doncaster but has a lot to find on that bare form
runners.spotlight: Overcame some trouble to win with something to spare at Doncaster (good); however, needs major progress as she's well down the pack on bare figures in this markedly deeper contest.

stable_tour.quote: She won first time out in a bumper at Doncaster this month - Shane gave her a great ride and she has come out of it really well. She did better than we anticipated so she'll probably go for the mares' bumper at Aintree now. 26-03-25

runners.name: Roses All The Way
runners.comment: Proving consistent but is held by a few of these opponents on Carlisle/Warwick form
runners.spotlight: Proving consistent and ran well in Listed grade at Huntingdon on penultimate start; however, looks held by Getawhisky, Strong Run and Highland Haven on Carlisle/Warwick form.

runners.name: Seo Linn
runners.owner: Mrs A Phelan & Mrs Bridget Beckett
runners.comment: Irish mare who registered a 5l win in Listed grade at Cheltenham last time; leading player
runners.spotlight: Irish mare who registered a 5l success in Listed grade at Cheltenham (good) in November when last seen, taking record to 2-4 and looking very useful; the form has been boosted; leading contender.

runners.name: St Irene
runners.comment: Has finished behind some of these rivals in Listed events; limitations exposed
runners.spotlight: Won easily at Southwell (good) early in season but has since finished behind Seo Linn, Strong Run and Roses All The Way in Listed events at Cheltenham/Huntingdon; limitations exposed.

runners.name: St Jessica
runners.comment: Promising second at Huntingdon but appears to be flying too high in this grade
runners.spotlight: Promising second at Huntingdon (good to soft) and could well go one better at the right level; however, she appears to be flying too high in this grade, judged on the bare figures.

runners.name: Strong Run
runners.comment: Collared stablemate Highland Haven in the final stride at Warwick; could build on that win
runners.spotlight: Finished just over 5l behind Seo Linn at Cheltenham (second start) but looks set for an interesting rematch with that opponent, having subsequently opened her account at Warwick (soft) where she collared stablemate Highland Haven in the final stride; could well build on that win.

quotes.race: Fancave Cheltenham Preview Here 6th March Mares' Open NH Flat Race (Category 1 Elimination) (GBB)
quotes.quote: Strong Run is lovely and her owners have been so patient with her, which has been key. She ran exceptionally well at Cheltenham and she deserved this. I'm delighted with Highland Haven as well. She put a bad run behind her the last day. They're both lovely mares and can both go to Aintree. It's good timing after today and both of them could be better in the spring - Fergal O'Brien, trainer.

runners.name: Slack Alice
runners.comment: Heading in the right direction but looks a long way short of this standard
runners.spotlight: Form figures of 842 reflect that she's heading in the right direction, clear second at Huntingdon (soft) most recently; however, she looks a long way short of this standard.

runners.name: Hecouldbetheone
runners.comment: Has the form to threaten and conditions should be ideal on this return from a break
runners.spotlight: Back-to-back wins at Fontwell (2m3f, good/good to soft) last spring and good second there (2m1f, good) in November; below-par fifth next time was only 11 days later and perhaps came too soon; course winner who should hold every chance back from break in first-time visor (replacing cheekpieces).

runners.name: Shengai Enki
runners.comment: Might just be on a tough mark now as latest winner at Wincanton beat him handsomely
runners.spotlight: Similar sort of form in his last three races with the cheekpieces reapplied; might just be on a tough mark now as latest winner at Wincanton beat him handsomely (2m5f, good).

runners.name: Lumi Plugin
runners.owner: J Hinds, A Head & G L Moore
runners.comment: Up 5lb for last month's C&D success but that was cosy and he seems to be improving
runners.spotlight: Beaten in his first eight races but the breakthrough was coming and, returned to this trip from 3m1f, he kept on best to collect here last month under Rob Hargreaves; up 5lb but seems to be improving.

stable_tour.quote: He went close in both starts over hurdles in the spring and could be a nice handicap hurdler stepping up in trip this season. He's one for soft ground. 29-10-24

runners.name: Narragansett
runners.comment: He's now 2-2 in the hood and probably still on a fair mark despite latest 5lb rise
runners.spotlight: Good-ground Flat winner who is improving over hurdles; won easily here on soft and did well to follow up in a steadily run race at Sandown (again 2m; good to soft); he's now 2-2 in the hood and probably still on a fair mark despite latest 5lb rise; the step up in trip is the grey area.

quotes.race: Betfair Racing Podcasts Juvenile Handicap Hurdle (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Narragansett ran well the first time at Market Rasen but was maybe a bit too keen the second time. We tried to hold on to him a bit today and he did it well. This is just his fourth race and he's done very little wrong, he's going the right way. He needed a good jump at the last and thankfully he got it. There was no real pace but we were the best horse in the race. He wouldn't be good enough for the Triumph, so we'd be looking at Ayr or Aintree or something like that - Neil Mulholland, trainer.

3:40.race_name: BetGoodwin Supports Jamie's Farm Handicap Chase

runners.name: Leading Swoop
runners.comment: Consistent this season and was a clearcut winner when back up to 3m2f at Fontwell recently
runners.spotlight: Fontwell regular who has been consistent over fences this season and was evidently well suited by the move back up in trip when scoring by over 5l there (3m2f, good) last month; obvious contender in current form.

runners.name: Dear Ralphy
runners.comment: Ran quite well in February, after a layoff, and remains unexposed over fences
runners.spotlight: Won over hurdles at Fontwell (3m2f, good) in early part of this season and returned from 254-day absence with satisfactory chase run there (3m2f, heavy) in February, albeit he was tired and well held in the end; back on much better ground here and remains unexposed over fences.

runners.name: Kadex
runners.breeder: Mme Jocelyne Ventrou & Mr Guy Cherel

prev_owners.owner: The Sanguiners, Mrs G Redman & B Painter

runners.comment: Disappointing for Lucy Wadham last season and yet to revive for new stable this term
runners.spotlight: C&D winner for Lucy Wadham in 2023 but became very disappointing for her last year and there has been no revival after three runs for Alan Jones (hurdling last time); lurks on a dangerous mark but considered only if lively in the betting; swaps blinkers for refitted cheekpieces.

runners.name: Autumn Philtre
runners.comment: Ex-Irish 9yo; pulled-up outsider over hurdles on recent stable debut
runners.spotlight: Ex-Irish pointer/hunter chaser; pulled up when 125-1 outsider for Fontwell handicap hurdle (2m5f, good) on recent stable debut;  huge leap of faith required to support him here.

runners.name: Ballintara

prev_owners.owner: The Cockerell Cowing Racing Partnership ( B Cockerell)
The Cockerell Cowing Racing Partnership ( A Cowing)

runners.comment: Teenager; pulled up with a circuit to go when back under rules in January
runners.spotlight: Teenager who has a very uninspiring record in points in recent years and was competing for the first time under rules since 2021 when pulled up (albeit on heavy ground) with a circuit to go at Fontwell in January.

runners.name: Delgany Monarch
runners.comment: Regressive 10yo who struggled to get competitive on first three appearance this season
runners.spotlight: Regressive 10yo who struggled to get seriously competitive on first three appearance this season, most recently when fitted with first-time cheekpieces in Fontwell race won by Leading Swoop 17 days ago; needs to prove some ability remains.

1:55.race_name: Ladbrokes Supporting Jamie's Farm Conditional Jockeys' Handicap Chase

runners.name: Jolyjump
runners.breeder: Mrs D Saliou & Haras De La Haie Neuve
runners.comment: Got back on track with good second at Southwell last month and remains on workable mark
runners.spotlight: Suffered dip in form after breakthrough chase win at Southwell (2m, good) in November but looked back in good nick when second there (2m, good to soft) last month and remains on a workable mark; major player.

quotes.race: Download The At The Races App Novices' Handicap Chase
quotes.quote: Jolyjump has always looked a nice horse and his jumping was super - Caoilin Quinn, rider.

runners.name: Delpotro
runners.breeder: E A R L Elevage Des Loges

prev_owners.owner: Ecurie Herve Guerin & Ecurie Horse Avenir

runners.comment: Free-going front-runner; 0-5 in Britain but ran well at Sedgefield last month; a player
runners.spotlight: Free-going front-runner who was a dual chase winner in France last spring; 0-5 in Britain but ran well for a long way when third at Sedgefield (2m, good; hood refitted) last month and continues to edge down the weights.

runners.name: Stony Man
runners.comment: Both runs for new stable this year have been underwhelming but a revival remains possible
runners.spotlight: Became disappointing for Gary Hanmer last year (best run was over 3m) and both runs for new stable this year (2m1f/2m3f) have been very underwhelming but he may yet come good for Robbie Llewellyn.

runners.name: Miss Fedora
runners.comment: Scored over C&D in January but this high-mileage 6yo is not very reliable
runners.spotlight: Drew 14l clear to cause 18-1 surprise over C&D (soft) in January and will also be suited by today's much faster ground but two lesser efforts have followed and this high-mileage 6yo is not one to rely upon.

runners.name: Grooveur
runners.comment: Ran quite well over hurdles here last April but absent since; pulled up in only chase
runners.spotlight: Rediscovered some form when very respectable fourth over hurdles here (2m4f, good) just under a year ago, his third run after a long absence, but we haven't seen him again since and he was pulled up in his only previous chase (in 2022).

quotes.race: Irish Thoroughbred Marketing Novices' Hurdle (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Grooveur has been very green and it's taken him a few runs to get straight. Today it all came together, I was keen to be plenty positive and I pushed on when they a little bit of a dawdle on the first circuit. I didn't want it to end up as a sprint, the horse has improved with every run so he deserved that. He'll end up a three-miler, we'll look forward to him going chasing - Lee Edwards, jockey.

runners.name: Pleasure Garden
runners.owner: H J Jarvis & Mrs P Jarvis

prev_owners.owner: Charles C Walker - Osborne House II

runners.comment: Needs to better recent efforts but won over C&D off 7lb higher on good ground a year ago
runners.spotlight: Beaten about 42l on both outings this year but was probably unsuited by the soft ground when out of the weights at Fontwell on latter occasion and is now 7lb lower than when scoring over C&D (good) a year ago.

runners.name: Clondaw Robin
runners.comment: Ran well here last month but was well held in the end and is now 0-32 over fences
runners.spotlight: Ran well for a long way when fourth here (2m3f, good) last month but was well held in the end and is now 0-32 over fences; 5lb out of the weights; others look stronger.

2:30.race_name: Hottotrotracing Supports Jamie's Farm Mares' Novices' Hurdle (GBB Race)

runners.name: Blacksamssenorita
runners.comment: Comfortably won modest Exeter maiden last week and has strong claims over new trip here
runners.spotlight: Made the frame on first three hurdling starts and did not need to improve to win modest Exeter maiden (2m, good to firm) comfortably last month; has penalty to shoulder here but this race also looks uncompetitive, and her pedigree suggests the longer trip will suit.

runners.name: Back In The Bay
runners.owner: Value Racing - Back In The Bay
runners.comment: Ran poorly on hurdle debut in September but earlier point/bumper form was promising
runners.spotlight: Second in 15-runner Irish point last spring and also displayed significant ability in two good-ground bumpers for David Pipe in April; ran very poorly when switched to hurdling in September but had wind surgery during subsequent break and has possibilities here if back on song for new stable.

runners.name: Dance The Moon
runners.comment: Made promising bumper debut in 2023; subsequent bumper/hurdle form has been underwhelming
runners.spotlight: Promising fourth of 17 in soft-ground Newbury bumper in December 2023 but both bumper runs in early part of this season were underwhelming and she was well held when third on last month's hurdling debut.

runners.name: Onomaris
runners.comment: Showed only minor promise on debut and was pulled up over C&D on second start
runners.spotlight: Showed only minor promise on debut at Lingfield (soft) in November and was pulled up over C&D (good to soft) the following month.

3:05.race_name: Dine & Stay @ The Jolly Sportsman Handicap Hurdle

runners.name: Pure Theatre
runners.comment: Seemed to run well in three-runner race on Monday but this season's record is unconvincing
runners.spotlight: Seemed to run well when second to in-form rival in three-runner contest at Wincanton (3m, good) on Monday and remains well handicapped on older form but has not been firing on all cylinders this season and it's hard to predict whether she'll build on that recent effort.

runners.name: Stylia
runners.breeder: E A R L Haras De La Croix Sonnet Et Al
runners.comment: Well beaten in 2m maiden/novice hurdles; could be a completely different proposition here
runners.spotlight: A well-beaten outsider in three novice/maiden hurdles at around 2m this winter (good to soft-heavy) but came second in a good-ground Irish point last spring and is open to significant improvement under rules now she's hiked up in trip and back on a sound surface for her handicap debut.

runners.name: Ballela Blaze
runners.comment: Kept on for modest third at Sedgefield (2m4f) recently; tries a new trip today
runners.spotlight: Won good-ground Irish point in 2023 but is 0-5 over hurdles this season; kept on for modest third in recent Sedgefield handicap (2m4f, good) and is open to improvement over today's longer trip but others appeal more.

runners.name: Westtara
runners.comment: Didn't run badly when last of five over 2m here last month; can do better over this trip
runners.spotlight: 0-7 over hurdles but didn't run badly when last of five over 2m here (good) last month; will probably be better suited by today's much longer trip and has been given a good chance by the handicapper; worth a second look.

runners.name: Abbeyhill
runners.comment: Largely disappointing over fences since November; back hurdling with a point to prove
runners.spotlight: Dual hurdle winner last season (once over C&D) but was pulled up on reappearance outing in October and has largely been disappointing over fences since (five starts); seems very versatile regarding ground but reverts to hurdling with quite a bit to prove; swaps cheekpieces for first-time blinkers.

stable_tour.quote: He definitely has potential. He's just had a little break but he'll be back in. He wants a bit of nice ground. He seemed to win well around Catterick last time out and Jack Hogan gave him a good ride. He's done well since he's gone handicapping, winning two. He was second to Top Cloud, who won at Ascot afterwards, so his form is solid and fingers crossed there'll be more to come. He'll make a nice chaser in time. I haven't spoken to his owners but I suspect he'll go chasing after May. 06-03-24

runners.name: Bella Cavalla
runners.comment: In good form when last seen in the autumn (including over C&D); player if fully tuned up
runners.spotlight: 0-10 over hurdles but was in good form when last seen in the autumn, including when clear second over C&D (good to soft) two starts ago; now 1lb below that mark; major player if fully tuned up.

runners.name: Macari
runners.owner: R Vaughan, R Bisiker, M Jones And S West

prev_owners.owner: Ricki Vaughan, R Bisiker, Sheena West
Ricky Vaughan, R Bisiker, Sheena West

runners.comment: Course winner who was close 2nd over C&D in November; competitive if primed after a break
runners.spotlight: Broke his Flat duck over 1m4f in October; also a course winner over hurdles who might have won over C&D (good) in November had it not been for losing momentum at the last two flights; solid claims if primed after a break.

runners.name: Rip Wheeler
runners.comment: Dead-heated for point; no impact on 2m handicap debut; step up in trip can help
runners.spotlight: Dead-heated for a maiden point (soft) last March; all hurdle runs on soft; no serious impact on handicap debut behind an impressive stablemate at Sandown (2m) in February, but he did plug on into fourth and should appreciate the step up in trip; improvement likely.

stable_tour.quote: We haven't pushed any buttons yet but he's a winning pointer and a nice, big horse by Walk In The Park. Hopefully he's a promising chaser down the line. 29-10-24

runners.name: Leave Her To Me
runners.comment: Bang there when fell 2 out in February; made amends over 2m3f last week; unpenalised
runners.spotlight: Bumper and maiden hurdle winner; finding her feet in handicaps now, bang there when coming down two out at Huntingdon in February and then winning narrowly but a shade cosily at Hereford (2m3f, good) last week; sound chance going unpenalised (due 4lb rise in future).

runners.name: Jorebel
runners.comment: Close up in 2 Irish points; ran well for long way at Uttoxeter on Saturday; now up in trip
runners.spotlight: Close up in latest two Irish points; has some potential in handicaps and he ran well for a long way at Uttoxeter (2m, good) on Saturday in his second attempt at this level; has possibilities now upped in trip.

runners.name: Vorderman
runners.comment: Found a very ordinary race when winning on hurdle debut; tough tasks since; handicap debut
runners.spotlight: Minor form in bumpers and he was found a weak race when winning on hurdle debut at Fontwell (2m1f, soft) in December; had much stiffer tasks under a penalty since but this handicap debut is more to the point.

runners.name: Steel Dancer
runners.comment: Little to latch on to so far but handicaps should offer more scope; now tongue tied
runners.spotlight: Very little to latch on to so far, in a bumper and three qualifying events; handicaps should offer more scope, especially if fitting a tongue-tie helps.

runners.name: Smith
runners.comment: Eight Flat wins but not much truck with hurdles so far, including on handicap debut
runners.spotlight: Eight Flat wins, seven on AW and the latest over 2m in December but he hasn't had much truck with hurdling so far, including on handicap debut at Fontwell (2m1f, good) in the autumn; best watched for now.

runners.name: Gorcombe Moonshine
runners.comment: Sole win over fences in late 2023; best form at up to 2m2f; this trip is a new venture
runners.spotlight: Sole win came over fences in late 2023; he's often thereabouts over hurdles but his best form is at up to 2m2f and this trip is a new and perhaps unwelcome venture.

runners.name: Tom Creen
runners.comment: Likes it here and ran well behind a progressive sort over C&D last time; big chance
runners.spotlight: 5-12 at this venue and not far off best when chasing home in-form The Paddy Pie over C&D on a sound surface last time; likely to go well from 2lb higher.

stable_tour.quote: Sam: He's a lovely horse who's been a star, never worse than fourth in 11 runs. Jonathan: He's a very good ride. I tell the owners every time you could shut your eyes and let him do it for you. He showed last time that he stays 3mÂ½f and that might eke a few more pounds out of him, out he's another who will appreciate spring ground. He's won four races at Sedgefield and the nature of the track suits him, having a lot of jumping and turning helps him fill his lungs up. He's not done winning yet. 08-02-24

runners.name: Jackpot Cash
runners.comment: Has shown ability over fences but he'll need to raise game if he's to win back in a chase
runners.spotlight: Best effort over fences, despite beaten at odds-on, at Bangor in February and respectable effort behind a wide-margin winner over hurdles last time; improvement needed to win this, though.

runners.name: Carnet De Stage
runners.comment: Not won for a while but may appreciate return to fences and to this trip
runners.spotlight: Hasn't won since 2022 but has slipped in the weights and may be suited by the return to fences and the step back up in distance; interesting to see if there's any money for him.

quotes.race: Kelly Foley O'Connor Pyne Handicap Chase
quotes.quote: Carnet De Stage will be targeted at Listowel, there's something similar there and his owners are local to the track. He's been disappointing in between times but was on fire today - Eugene O'Sullivan, trainer.

runners.name: Valence Daumont
runners.comment: Broke losing run on penultimate start but isn't consistent and below that last time (bled)
runners.spotlight: 6-24 over fences, though hasn't been too predictable in recent times; followed Catterick win with a poor run back on a sound surface at Doncaster (reportedly bled) and he has something to prove.

runners.name: Beat The Edge
runners.comment: Mainly consistent but not always straightforward and others appeal more
runners.spotlight: Both chase wins were on a soft surface but handles quicker ground and was not far behind Tom Creen over C&D last month; respectable effort at Newcastle last time but not always straightforward and others appeal more.

2:07.race_name: Lakeland Dairies "National Hunt" Maiden Hurdle (GBB Race)

runners.name: Masterpiece
runners.comment: Bumper winner when last seen five months ago; one to consider on first hurdle run
runners.spotlight: Best effort when winning good-ground Newcastle bumper in October (third and fourth won next time) and, although off since, he's a half-brother to a hurdle winner so is one to consider on debut in this sphere.

stable_tour.quote: He's got a very good Flat pedigree, as a half-brother to this year's French 1,000 Guineas  second Kathmandu, and was beaten only two and a half lengths when third in a bumper at Sedgefield. He's well up to winning one before going hurdling. 16-10-24

runners.name: Nathan Wells
runners.breeder: Howard Barton Stud & Newsells Park Stud

prev_owners.owner: John F Doyle & Dee L'Estrange & Weld-Spec (Glasgow) Ltd

runners.comment: Ran respectably on yard debut in first-time cheekpieces; tongue-tie added and has claims
runners.spotlight: Winless for Gordon Elliott and not always consistent but he ran respectably on yard debut at Hexham in first-time cheekpieces; tongue-tie now added and he should run well back up in trip.

runners.name: Rehill Relic
runners.comment: Improved back on good ground in first-time cheekpieces (2m3f) last time; player
runners.spotlight: Improved effort back on good ground in first-time cheekpieces at Catterick (2m3f) last time and he won't have to improve much to figure in this company.

runners.name: Selectivelistening
runners.comment: Has shown ability on good ground but disappointing when last seen; needs to improve
runners.spotlight: Has shown ability on good ground over hurdles and fences but was disappointing when last seen here in November; has since had a wind op but needs to step up if he's to win this.

runners.name: Soldier In Mayo
runners.comment: Behind Nathan Wells last time but may reverse those placings over this distance
runners.spotlight: Point winner; behind Nathan Wells at Hexham (2m, good to soft) recently but that was only his second outing over hurdles and he's bred to do better now upped in distance; likely to improve.

runners.name: Tyson Magoo
runners.comment: Best effort on handicap debut (2m3f) last time and not without a chance in this company
runners.spotlight: Turned in his best effort over hurdles at Carlisle (2m3f, good to soft) on handicap debut 25 days ago and, although that form has taken a few knocks, he's not without a chance at this level.

runners.name: Far Away West
runners.comment: Inconsistent and exposed sort who comes here on the back of a recent fall; limited appeal
runners.spotlight: Exposed and inconsistent sort who comes here on the back of a recent fall; good ground and trip are fine but she makes limited appeal.

runners.name: Lautrec De Cougny
runners.breeder: Marie Aline Saltel, Guillaume Colmont, J
runners.owner: The North West National Hunt Racing Club
runners.comment: Best effort so far on soft ground; up in trip and will have to raise his game to win this
runners.spotlight: Best effort so far came on soft ground and, although he's likely to stay this trip, he'll have to raise his game if he's to win this.

3:17.race_name: Visit The New betvickers.com Website Mares' Maiden Hurdle (GBB Race)

runners.name: Away She Goes

prev_owners.owner: No Gooners All About The Lady

runners.comment: Low-grade performer who makes no appeal on these unfavourable terms
runners.spotlight: Low-grade performer who is an unlikely winner on these unfavourable terms.

runners.name: Land Girls Luck
runners.comment: Has shown ability in points/bumper/hurdles; has claims in first-time cheekpieces
runners.spotlight: Has shown ability in points, in a bumper and over hurdles; now fitted with cheekpieces and isn't without a chance.

runners.name: Love True

prev_owners.owner: James Finch, Samuel Sutton & Tobias Jones

runners.comment: Respectable effort over hurdles and not without a chance, despite the drop in trip
runners.spotlight: Respectable efforts over hurdles and, although she's starting to look exposed, she's not without a chance, despite dropping in distance.

runners.name: Scar Bridge
runners.comment: Heavy-ground point winner; ability on hurdle debut but well beaten since; best watched
runners.spotlight: Heavy-ground debut point winner just over a year ago and showed ability on hurdle debut for Tony Mullins; well beaten both runs since and best watched on a sound surface.

runners.name: Cancelled
runners.comment: Useful on the Flat in Ireland and could outclass these rivals on this hurdle debut
runners.spotlight: Useful on the Flat in Ireland and, although below best in a 0-105 at Lingfield on AW/yard debut in January, she could easily outclass these rivals on this hurdle debut.

runners.name: Lara Kaleo
runners.comment: Promise at a moderate level on debut; open to improvement and could figure
runners.spotlight: Showed ability at a moderate level on debut at Hereford in February; that form took a few knocks but she's open to improvement and she could run well.

3:52.race_name: Canine Premier Flex Plus Joint Supplement Handicap Chase

runners.name: Cest Quelquun
runners.comment: Ran well at Doncaster on penultimate start and didn't stay 4m last time; claims here
runners.spotlight: Form patchy since last win in autumn 2023 and, having shaped as though coming to hand at Doncaster (over this trip on good) in February, he didn't stay 4m last time; this may be more to his liking.

quotes.race: Majestic Hotel Handicap Chase
quotes.quote: C'Est Quelqu'un's owners are local and it's really nice to get a winner here for them. He is lowly rated and will be kept to similar contests. Jack did really well to stay on him at the last - Gordon Elliott, trainer.

runners.name: Old Page
runners.comment: Has won two of last five starts and 3lb rise not enough to prevent him going in again
runners.spotlight: Has won two of last five starts (all over C&D) and 3lb rise for last month's success not necessarily enough to prevent him going in again.

runners.name: Ann Darabie
runners.breeder: S A R L Elevage Des Vallons Et Al
runners.comment: Stepped up on hurdle form when second on chase debut; should do better
runners.spotlight: Stepped up on previous efforts when second on chase debut over 3m2f on good ground following break of just over three months last month; should benefit for that experience and she's capable of better.

runners.name: Muroor
runners.comment: Has had plenty of chances since last win in 2020 and out of sorts since September
