runners.spotlight: Has had plenty of chances since last win in 2020 and although he ran respectably over C&D on good ground last September, he's been below that level since; best watched.

quotes.race: hannontravel.com Most Appropriately Dressed Lady Win A Trip To The Dominican Republic Handicap Chase
quotes.quote: He jumped very quick and was lightning for a small horse. I thought at the weight he would run well, not as well as those who backed him, I don't know where that [money] came from. He's just a real specialist for up here - Tom McCourt, trainer

quotes.race: Portman Dentalcare Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: Muroor loves it up here and Conor [Maxwell] has him down to a tee. He has plenty of ability and tracks like this suit him - Tom McCourt, trainer

quotes.race: Ulster Carpets Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: Muroor loves these type of tracks. He's getting it together. There's another meeting here next month and he might come back, the stiff finish here suits him. Last day was a real sickener but it's great to get this one - Tom McCourt, trainer.

quotes.race: Stoat Selling Stakes
quotes.quote: The other horse brought me across but I just had to try and keep Muroor going. He's a little bit quirky but he's won in the end. I was pretty sure I'd got up - Jamie Spencer, rider.

runners.name: Onenightintown
runners.comment: Triple chase winner whose form has been patchy since last win over a year ago
runners.spotlight: Triple chase winner whose form has been patchy since last win over a year ago; didn't show enough at Newcastle last month to suggest he's the one to be on this time.

runners.name: Scottsdale

prev_owners.owner: A Barnes, P W O'Mara & P Winks
P W O'Mara, P Winks & R H Lee

runners.comment: Not won since 2019 and hasn't been in much form this season; opposable
runners.spotlight: Long time since last win and altogether too many letters in form figures; hasn't been in much form this season and no appeal over a trip he's still to prove he stays.

4:27.race_name: BetVickers Supporting British Racing Handicap Hurdle

runners.name: Fabuleux Du Clos
runners.breeder: A Jollivet, C Lecomte & F Lecomte
runners.comment: Dual hurdle winner who reappeared after long break last week; this may come too soon
runners.spotlight: Dual hurdle winner in 2023 but only run once since on AW at Newcastle last week and, although this isn't a strong contest, this may come a bit too soon.

runners.name: The Wise Traveller
runners.comment: Yet to show his best form over this C&D and needs to raise game
runners.spotlight: Multiple hurdle winner who handles a sound surface but was again below best over C&D last time and needs to fare better.

quotes.race: Newlands Developments Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: We were despairing of The Wise Traveller last year and nearly sent him to the sales but this year he's done nothing but improve. It was a low-grade race but he did it well - Charlie Longsdon, trainer.

runners.name: Star Vantage

prev_owners.owner: Exors Of The Late John Wade

runners.comment: Yet to win in 18 hurdle starts but should stay and likely to give a good account
runners.spotlight: Respectable effort in a stronger event than this last time and shapes as though he'll stay this trip; yet to win in 18 hurdle starts but likely to go well in this company.

runners.name: Balkotic
runners.breeder: E A R L Haras Du Mondant & J Le Roux
runners.comment: Not won since 2022 and hasn't shown enough of late to make him of interest
runners.spotlight: C&D win was one of three hurdle successes in 2022 but he hasn't added to tally since and has been well beaten of late; will be 3lb lower in future and makes limited appeal.

runners.name: Ocean Legacy
runners.comment: C&D winner in first-time blinkers in February; below that since but now gets cheekpieces
runners.spotlight: C&D winner in first-time blinkers returned to hurdles in February but below that level since; cheekpieces tried this time; can't rule out.

5:02.race_name: Paxtons No1 Caseih Dealer In UK&Ireland Handicap Hurdle

runners.name: Ambassador
runners.comment: On same mark as last win and has conditions to suit but out of sorts when last seen
runners.spotlight: Multiple hurdle winner on a sound surface but wasn't in much form when last seen at the end of 2024; return to a sound surface should suit and on same mark as last win but only of interest if the market speaks.

quotes.race: Brit Direct Handicap Hurdle (Div II)
quotes.quote: Ambassador came to us in good form and all we've had to do is tick him over. He was given a good ride by Brian Hughes and it just sort of fell right for us really - Micky Hammond, trainer.

runners.name: Tara Iti
runners.comment: Broke losing run on penultimate start and backed that up last time; should run well
runners.spotlight: Broke losing run when beating a subsequent winner on good ground at Huntingdon on penultimate start (second run for yard) and ran at least as well up in trip at same venue last time; likely to go well.

quotes.race: Veolia Nursery Handicap (Div II)
quotes.quote: Tara Iti is bred to go on this testing ground. He travelled well despite being a little keen early. I took it up early enough, but he kept it up all the way to the line - Andrea Atzeni, jockey.

runners.name: Trailblazer
runners.comment: Good-ground 2m winner at Perth; respectable efforts when last seen; has had a wind op
runners.spotlight: Good-ground 2m winner at Perth last summer; respectable efforts when last seen in February and has since had wind surgery; on a good mark if that has a positive effect.

runners.name: Normandy Legend
runners.comment: Yet to win a race and opening mark looks tough but could step up on back of a wind op
runners.spotlight: Fair Flat maiden who has yet to win over hurdles; switch to handicap and return to a sound surface should suit and has had a wind op; opening mark on the harsh side but he's likely capable of better.

stable_tour.quote: He is owned by Bon Ho, whose support for the yard has been fantastic from the start and continues to be. This colt is a strong, good moving individual who is doing alright. You would not expect him to be an early type with Sea The Stars being his sire, but he looks like he will make into a nice racehorse in time. He would be very much a backend type with a three-year-old career in mind, but he is definitely worth a mention in this tour. 29-03-23

runners.name: My Little Toni
runners.comment: Hurdle winner over further here and pointing when last seen nearly a year ago; opposable
runners.spotlight: Sole hurdle win came at this venue over further (on quick ground) in 2022; hasn't had too much racing since and has been pointing; plenty to prove after absence on first run for trainer.

runners.name: Milajess

prev_owners.owner: Exors of the Late Nicholas Kelly

runners.comment: Yet to win over hurdles but running well of late and should give a good account
runners.spotlight: Running well of late and, although she's 0-23 over hurdles, there's no reason why she won't give another good account.

runners.name: Balranald
runners.comment: Ran well after a break last week and no surprise to see him run well here
runners.spotlight: Suited by a sound surface and back to winning ways (twice) in October; shaped as though latest effort was just needed following a break of over three months; likely to run well.

runners.name: Jackhammer

prev_owners.owner: Dennis J Coppola & Mrs Dianne Sayer

runners.comment: Multiple Flat/hurdle winner; off since 2024 and not run over hurdles for nearly two years
runners.spotlight: Multiple Flat winner who has scored twice over hurdles; below best over fences when last seen in November and probably one to watch on this first hurdle start for over two years.

quotes.race: Carlisle Bell Consolation Race Handicap
quotes.quote: Jackhammer has been running well for us over hurdles and at the start of the year we were struggling to find a rhythm and find races for him, but then he dropped into it at Perth and we had a nice couple of wins up there. He's been a great horse for us so we're delighted - Dianne Sayer, trainer.

quotes.race: Carlisle Bell Consolation Race Handicap
quotes.quote: Jackhammer was highly rated as a two-year-old so we knew he had the engine - it's just been a bit of a thinking process - Dianne Sayer, trainer.

quotes.race: Whitsbury Manor Stud EBF Stallions Blagrave Maiden Stakes (Plus 10 Race)
quotes.quote: That's not really a surprise, although we don't have many first-time-out 2yo winners. We didn't have our first runner until Windsor on Monday, and that one ran quite well, and Jackhammer was working best of ours, although we don't have a grass gallop so that was a question mark. He's a big horse and a May foal, so there's no rush. He's one for next year, but I think he's pretty useful - William Knight, trainer.

runners.name: Chantilly Rose
runners.breeder: Mr & Mrs D Futter & Mrs R Patterson
runners.comment: Well beaten on yard debut following near five-month break last time; plenty more needed
runners.spotlight: Low-grade maiden who was well beaten after a near five-month break back over hurdles on yard debut last month; good deal more needed.

runners.name: Foshan
runners.comment: Achived little so far and makes no appeal from out of the handicap
runners.spotlight: Achived little on the Flat or over hurdles and, although he's had wind surgery since his last start, makes no appeal from 6lb out of the handicap.

1:25.race_name: Pat O'Hare Bookmakers Maiden Hurdle (Div I)

runners.name: Allo Al Khawaneej
runners.comment: Half-brother to the smart Delegator, weak form in three runs on the Flat for Owen Burrows
runners.spotlight: Half-brother to the smart Delegator; weak form in three runs on the Flat for Owen Burrows.

runners.name: Buckaway Freddie
runners.comment: Second in a small-field bumper, a remote seventh on his first two runs over hurdles
runners.spotlight: Second in five-runner Naas bumper last February; failed to build on that a month later at Leopardstown; a remote seventh on his first two runs over hurdles.

stable_tour.quote: He's had a nice break and he should be well up to winning a bumper judging by the way he ran first time out at Naas. 28-10-24

runners.name: Colvin
runners.comment: Betrayed his inexperience at Down Royal, showed some ability and seems likely to improve
runners.spotlight: Betrayed his inexperience first time out at Down Royal last month; showed some ability and seems likely to improve.

runners.name: Doorman Moe
runners.comment: Dam placed over hurdles, tongue-tied for debut, not an obvious contender on pedigree
runners.spotlight: Second foal; dam placed once from 13 starts over hurdles, half-sister to bumper/hurdle winner Carrow Queen; wears a tongue-tie for debut; not an obvious contender on pedigree.

runners.name: Georgie Green
runners.comment: 66-1 when finishing towards the rear in a Thurles bumper, can be ruled out
runners.spotlight: 66-1 when finishing towards the rear in a Thurles bumper four weeks ago; can be ruled out.

runners.name: High Court Cave
runners.comment: Point-to-point and bumper winner, not yet showing a similar standard of form over hurdles
runners.spotlight: Point-to-point and bumper winner; back from a break with two moderate efforts in maiden hurdles here and Punchestown on testing ground.

runners.name: I Feel Fine
runners.comment: Dam is a half-sister to good hurdle/chase winner Bamako Moriviere, down the field on debut
runners.spotlight: First foal; dam placed in bumper and over hurdles, half-sister to 1m4f AQPS Flat and smart hurdle/chase winner Bamako Moriviere; down the field first time out at Gowran.

runners.name: Kara Sacre
runners.comment: Has come from a good nursery, winner of a maiden point for Sam Curling 12 months ago
runners.spotlight: Has come from a good nursery, winner of a maiden point for Sam Curling 12 months ago; comes from the family of the great Sprinter Sacre.

runners.name: King Jon Oliver
runners.breeder: M Emmanuel Dibatista & M Paul Dibatista
runners.owner: Mrs A Frost & R H Fowler & Jon Owen & Oliver Slipper
runners.comment: Dam unraced half-sister to high-class hurdle/chase winner Gaillard Du Mesnil, interesting
runners.spotlight: First foal; dam unraced half-sister to high-class hurdle/chase winner Gaillard Du Mesnil; interesting with a top claimer booked.

runners.name: Lips Freedom
runners.comment: Two Listed wins in Germany for Andreas Suborics, suited by good ground, noteworthy recruit
runners.spotlight: Dual Listed winner in Germany for Andreas Suborics; bought by current connections for 43,000euros last August; fourth in a 1m4f Leopardstown handicap on stable debut last October; ran in a Listed race on final start; suited by good ground; noteworthy recruit to hurdling.

runners.name: Los Blanco
runners.comment: Form of his hurdling debut over C&D has been strongly advertised by Honesty Policy
runners.spotlight: A 20l runner-up on second start in point-to-points in April; form of his hurdling debut over C&D (third behind a Willie Mullins-trained favourite) has been strongly advertised by Honesty Policy in winning his next two starts; strong chance.

runners.name: Mags Nelson
runners.comment: Point winner, made little impact in midfield on hurdling debut at this venue last month
runners.spotlight: Point winner on the fifth attempt after two seconds; made little impact in midfield on hurdling debut over a longer trip at this venue last month.

runners.name: Monnow Valley
runners.comment: 0-13 on Flat, placed twice at modest level, has shown nothing in two maiden hurdles
runners.spotlight: 0-13 on Flat, placed twice at modest level, has shown nothing in two maiden hurdles.

runners.name: Orkneys Jack
runners.comment: Half-brother to point winner Peeping Tom, unraced dam, not a likely debut winner
runners.spotlight: Half-brother to point winner Peeping Tom; unraced dam; not a likely debut winner.

runners.name: Polemon
runners.comment: Three-time Flat winner, has shown potential for success over hurdles, place chance here
runners.spotlight: Three-time Flat winner; has shown potential for success over hurdles; not far off subsequent winner Le Grand Peinture at Leopardstown; most recent run was at Dundalk.

runners.name: Zoffman
runners.comment: Useful sort on the Flat, has something to build on after second to an easy winner at Navan
runners.spotlight: Two wins and placed 11 times on the Flat (from 22 starts); signed off last season with a second over 1m4f at Cork off a respectable 91; has something to build on after second to easy winner Le Grand Peinture at Navan.

quotes.race: Leopardstown October Handicap (Premier Handicap)
quotes.quote: I think going up in trip and getting on to easy ground has been a help to Zoffman. Today he even looked like getting further. He's very small and I thought with a low weight he had a great chance. You're always surprised when they win as easy as that, but you're probably getting a free 7lb with Jamie Powell. He jumps quite well but won't be going hurdling at this time anyway. I couldn't imagine he'd make a jumper being so small - Noel Meade, trainer.

quotes.race: William Hill Play Responsibly Maiden
quotes.quote: Zoffman has run some very good races and it's only clear to us now that he wants ease in the ground, and maybe 1m4f. He really quickened for Dylan too. He might win a good handicap on soft ground - Noel Meade, trainer.

runners.name: Buttermere Ridge

prev_owners.owner: S Hyland & Mrs Caren Walsh & David L'Estrange

runners.comment: Flat winner for Willie McCreery, failed to reproduce the form of his debut win last April
runners.spotlight: Flat winner for Willie McCreery, failed to reproduce the form of his debut win last April and dropped 8lb from his initial handicap mark; best watched in the circumstances.

runners.name: Catch Fire
runners.comment: 1m4f winner on good ground for Francis-Henri Graffard last August, best watched
runners.spotlight: 1m4f winner on good ground for Francis-Henri Graffard last August, best watched.

runners.name: Lets Go Mans
runners.breeder: M Gerard Antone Delorme, Mme Valerie Elisabete Fuzy & Mme Le
runners.comment: Half-brother to Willie Mullins-trained winners Coquin Mans and Egality Mans, worth a look
runners.spotlight: Sixth foal; half-brother to Willie Mullins-trained winners Coquin Mans and Egality Mans; worth a look for future reference.

runners.name: The Eggler
runners.comment: Midfield on debut at Clonmel last Thursday, will need to pick up more experience
runners.spotlight: Midfield on debut at Clonmel last Thursday; will need to pick up more experience.

2:35.race_name: Irish Stallion Farms EBF Mares Maiden Hurdle

runners.name: Baroness Orczy
runners.comment: Half-sister to winning hurdler Ernie From Nurney, pulled up on recent debut at Navan
runners.spotlight: Half-sister to winning hurdler Ernie From Nurney; pulled up on recent debut at Navan.

runners.name: Creadan Grace
runners.comment: Last of nine on debut at Punchestown, slight improvement at Wexford, much more needed
runners.spotlight: Last of nine on debut at Punchestown; slight improvement at Wexford; much more needed.

runners.name: Danielle D
runners.comment: Fair bumper run last June, has struggled in four subsequent outings, others preferred
runners.spotlight: Not a bad effort on sole start for former yard when sixth on debut at Kilbeggan last June; has struggled in four subsequent outings; others preferred.

runners.name: Fiver Friday
runners.comment: Four-time Flat winner, reached a career-high of 90 after course win last summer, respected
runners.spotlight: Four-time Flat winner; reached a career-high of 90 after a middle-distance course win last summer; respected on introduction to hurdling after a winter break.

quotes.race: TRM Speedxcell Multi Vitamin And Mineral Tonic Handicap
quotes.quote: Fiver Friday handled the course here from her maiden form  and for her to get her head in front in Ireland is brilliant. They went plenty hard early on and set it up for her - Paul Traynor, trainer.

runners.name: Getaways Charm
runners.comment: Dam French Flat winner, placed in a Listed hurdle; 0-3 in point-to-points but of interest
runners.spotlight: Dam French Flat winner, placed in a Listed hurdle; 0-3 in point-to-points but of some interest

runners.name: Glory Sky
runners.comment: Minor Flat winner, big price when too keen and tailed off on hurdling debut at Punchestown
runners.spotlight: Minor winner for Richard Hannon; huge price when raced too keenly and tailed off on hurdling debut at Punchestown.

runners.name: Lady Bee Great
runners.comment: Sixth of eight in a Tramore bumper on her only start last year, has changed stable
runners.spotlight: Sixth of eight in a Tramore bumper on her only start last year; has changed stable.

runners.name: Lucy Alpine Jade
runners.owner: John Kilroy & Thomas Kilroy & Cian Walsh & Piaras Walsh
runners.comment: Half-sister to winners including a mare who won seven races over jumps in France
runners.spotlight: Twelfth foal; half-sister to winners, including the versatile Catmoves who won seven races over jumps in France; dam 1m Listed winner, out of 1m4f Group 3 winner.

runners.name: Ma Belle Etoile
runners.owner: P Haughey & P M Haughey & John Ball
runners.comment: Bumper winner, first of two hurdle runs was satisfactory, has joined Henry de Bromhead
runners.spotlight: Decent form in bumpers, featuring a Limerick win on heavy ground in November 2023; solid hurdling debut at Tipperary last May; failed to improve at Listowel in June when unplaced favourite; has left the Kielys to join Henry de Bromhead.

runners.name: Mahlers Best
runners.comment: Dam unraced half-sister to Troytown Chase winner Chris's Dream, tailed off on debut
runners.spotlight: Dam unraced half-sister to Troytown Chase winner Chris's Dream; tailed off on debut at Gowran.

runners.name: Mile End
runners.comment: Three wins on Flat, made a solid start over hurdles when second in a weak Thurles maiden
runners.spotlight: Two wins for Johnny Murtagh at two and gained a third win for her current trainer in a 1m Bellewstown handicap last August; never ran further than that on Flat but made a solid start over hurdles when second in a weak Thurles maiden last November.

quotes.race: Barberstown Castle Nursery Handicap
quotes.quote: I fancied Mile End in Down Royal the last day but she was drawn 11, missed the kick and never got into the race. Ben [Coen] said he was forced wide all the way, stayed on well and probably wants a mile, but I worked her in blinkers the other day, gave her a sharpener, and they seemed to have brought her alive. It looked like a winnable nursery. She got out there in front, flowing along, and Ben said she did it well - Johnny Murtagh, trainer.

runners.name: Neska Blue
runners.comment: Placed in a point, nothing in her racecourse form to provide encouragement
runners.spotlight: Placed in a point; nothing in her racecourse form to provide encouragement.

runners.name: Paudies Wings
runners.comment: Distant third at Fairyhouse in November, jumped badly at Thurles the following week
runners.spotlight: A distant third at Fairyhouse in November; put a blot on her record when making several errors at Thurles the following week.

runners.name: Sea Of Doubt
runners.comment: Has changed stable twice this season, merit in her penultimate bumper run at this track
runners.spotlight: Has changed stable twice this season, merit in her penultimate bumper run at this track.

runners.name: Stormie Outlook
runners.owner: Sean H Reynolds & E J Ogrady
runners.comment: Experienced Flat handicapper with 2-24 record, well beaten in two hurdle starts in 2023
runners.spotlight: Experienced Flat handicapper with 2-24 record, both wins gained on good ground last summer; well beaten in two hurdle starts in 2023; not at her best on final Flat starts last year.

runners.name: Walk On Annilog
runners.comment: First of three bumper runs was respectable, readily discounted on hurdling debut
runners.spotlight: First of three bumper runs was respectable; readily discounted on hurdling debut.

runners.name: Kentucky Bluebird
runners.comment: In good hands but best watched after her failure to complete at Gowran last month
runners.spotlight: In good hands but best watched after her failure to complete at Gowran last month.

runners.name: Sing A New Song
runners.comment: Very weak form on the Flat and in one run over hurdles, nothing to suggest she can feature
runners.spotlight: Very weak form on the Flat and in one run over hurdles; nothing to suggest she can feature.

runners.name: Small Bucks
runners.comment: Low-rated filly on Flat, impossible to make a case for her on hurdling/stable debut
runners.spotlight: Low-rated filly on Flat; impossible to make a case for her on hurdling/stable debut.

runners.name: Wilsons Prom
runners.comment: Decent pedigree, eased after three out and completely tailed off at Gowran last month
runners.spotlight: Decent pedigree; eased after three out and completely tailed off on debut at Gowran last month.

runners.name: Music Of Life
runners.comment: Placed in a bumper, down the field on his first two maiden hurdle starts; reserve
runners.spotlight: First reserve; fair third at Tramore on the second of three bumper runs; remote eighth on hurdling debut at Punchestown, similar at Leopardstown a month ago; first reserve.

runners.name: Belle Of Boston
runners.comment: Dam an unraced half-sister to winners notably useful stayer Sego Express; reserve
runners.spotlight: Second reserve; dam an unraced half-sister to winners, notably useful stayer Sego Express.

runners.name: Joshsue
runners.comment: Made little impact at Ballinrobe last July, tongue-tie fitted for return; reserve
runners.spotlight: Third reserve; made little impact at Ballinrobe last July, tongue-tie fitted for return.

3:10.race_name: Colm White Bookmakers Rated Novice Hurdle

runners.name: Shuffle The Deck
runners.comment: Point winner, 19.5f maiden win here has worked out, excuses latest, drop to 2m a concern
runners.spotlight: Point-to-point winner got off the mark at the second attempt over hurdles in a 19.5f maiden at this venue and that form has been boosted since by those in behind; reportedly coughing due to kickback after struggling in a Grade 1 here on latest; he has the best form, but the drop back to 2m does not look an obvious move.

quotes.race: Sign Up To GavinLynchRacing.com Maiden Hurdle
quotes.quote: Shuffle The Deck has come on from a good race at Punchestown and that rode like a good race today. I had a good lead all the way round, it was an end-to-end gallop and hopefully he's a good one - Mark Walsh, jockey, speaking to Racing TV.

runners.name: Casheldale Lad
runners.comment: Flat winner scored on hurdles debut, ground too soft latest, these conditions suit better
runners.spotlight: Flat winner for Andrew Kinirons; made a winning start over hurdles for this stable in an ordinary maiden at Gowran over 2m despite making a couple of jumping errors; latest run in a novice here was too bad to be true, the soft ground possibly didn't suit; today's conditions should be more to his liking.

quotes.race: PRL Group Maiden Hurdle
quotes.quote: Casheldale Lad did it well. He jumped good overall but had a couple of little mistakes, one down the back and he got in under the last as well. For a horse to do that much and be able to quicken up again down to the second last shows he obviously has an engine - Jack Kennedy, jockey.

quotes.race: Irish Stallion Farms EBF Median Auction Maiden
quotes.quote: Casheldale Lad is a horse we think a lot of. He showed an awful lot of ability at home, he is a massive horse and I think he could have a big future - Andrew Kinirions, trainer

stable_tour.quote: He won a Flat maiden at Punchestown for Andrew Kinirons and the horse he beat into second that day is now rated 96 so the form looks decent. We're looking forward to getting him out in a maiden hurdle soon. He's nice. 28-10-24

runners.name: Rockymountainbleu
runners.comment: Shock 40-1 win on Rules' debut at 2m4f, hasn't excelled dropped back in trip, needs more
runners.spotlight: Pulled off a shock on his Rules' debut when winning a Punchestown maiden (2m4f, good) at 40-1; dropped back in trip for his next three starts, his best effort a 2l third at Down Royal (2m1f) in a rated novice hurdle; needs to pull out more to win in this company.

quotes.race: Connolly's RED MILLS Irish EBF Auction Maiden Hurdle
quotes.quote: Rockymountainbeau had a good run in a point-to-point and his work at home has been good. We knew he'd be competitive but didn't know whether he needed the run but he did it well. It will sharpen him up a lot as he was looking for a bit of company - Tiernan Power Roche, rider, speaking to Racing TV.

runners.name: Sonny May
runners.comment: Back to back h'cap wins in November, trip too far latest, more exposed than most of these
runners.spotlight: Notched up back to back handicap wins at Gowran (2m) and Punchestown (2m1f) in November off 105 and 113 respectively; winning run came to an end when upped to 2m4f off 122 at Leopardstown in December and off since; drop back to 2m a plus but he's more exposed than most of his rivals.

runners.name: Scotcantou
runners.comment: Won a Galway maiden for former yard, outclassed in Gr3 latest, new yard now, check market
runners.spotlight: Got off the mark at the fourth attempt for Eoin McCarthy in a maiden hurdle at Galway last October (16.5f, yielding to soft); struggled in a Fairyhouse Grade 3 when last seen in November and has since joined Henry De Bromhead; probably best watched unless the market speaks in his favour.

quotes.race: Connolly's RED MILLS Irish EBF Auction Maiden Hurdle
quotes.quote: Scotcantou stuck at it well. He would not want it any softer than that and he was ridden by a young man riding with great confidence - Eoin McCarthy, trainer

runners.name: Adela Icon
runners.comment: Hooded and won hurdles debut at Punchestown latest, chance if effective going left-handed
runners.spotlight: Showed promise in bumpers for Harry Kelly, including on good ground; won on hurdles debut in a first-time hood (retained) on second start for Willie Mullins at Punchestown (16.5f, heavy) in February; unraced going left handed, leading claims if she is effective on the track.

runners.name: Positive Energy
runners.owner: M J Smith/David Lestrange/Oisin Mahon/Mrs M D Ocallaghan
runners.comment: Flat winner, won hurdles debut on stable bow, unexposed, ground fine, interesting
runners.spotlight: Flat handicap winner at Navan (1m2f) for Willie McCreery off 64; landed a maiden hurdle (2m, heavy) at the same venue on debut for this yard early last month on return from 143 days off; this better ground is fine and he's unexposed in this sphere; interesting.

quotes.race: Meath Farm Machinery Maiden Hurdle
quotes.quote: He's done nothing wrong at home since we got him. Positive Energy went to Robbie Power's for three weeks just to teach him the basics. He had a run in a schooling bumper at Naas recently so that told us he might handle the ground but he's never been on anything this heavy. Sean (Flanagan) just said he made a couple of mistakes, he was a little in his hands as they went a sensible gallop but they needed to in order to get home. He might have a few runs on the Flat and then there might be a novice hurdle for him in Galway, we'll have a bit of craic - Michael O'Callaghan, trainer, speaking to Racing TV.

runners.name: Action Plan
runners.comment: Flat winner, given break after Punchestown win, may have needed latest, outrun likely odds
runners.spotlight: Flat winner; promise first three starts over timber before landing a 3yo hurdle at Punchestown (2m, good); given a break afterwards, presumably to wait for spring ground; raced keenly early when well-beaten on return at Limerick (2m, yielding); this ground should suit better and he could improve for that run; may outrun likely odds.

runners.name: River Vale

prev_owners.owner: Exors Of The Late Trevor Hemmings

runners.comment: Point winner on good; second of 18 at Limerick on handicap debut; third boosted the form
runners.spotlight: Point-to-point winner on good; showed ability in maiden hurdles; improved for handicap debut when second of 18 at Limerick (2m3f, yielding to soft) in December, beaten a length; the third has boosted the form; drop in trip is fine.

runners.name: Star Official
runners.comment: Unseated rider over C&D last month; ran well over this trip a couple of times in December
runners.spotlight: Won off 95 at Thurles in October 2023 and is 4lb higher now; ran well over this trip a couple of times in December; backing out of things when unseating rider over C&D last month.

runners.name: Jerrari
runners.comment: Hasn't shown enough in 4 maiden hurdle runs so far & pedigree suggests he may need further
runners.spotlight: Hasn't shown enough in four maiden hurdle runs so far and pedigree suggests he may need further than this; first-time cheekpieces applied on his handicap debut; others preferred.

runners.name: Kalanisi Dubh
runners.comment: Wasn't disgraced when 6th at Gowran last month after a short break; good ground a concern
runners.spotlight: 2-17 over hurdles with her latest win at Clonmel (2m, heavy) in December 2023 off 92; still 6lb higher now; wasn't disgraced when sixth of 20 at Gowran last month after a short break; good ground a concern.

quotes.race: Adare Manor Opportunity Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: Seamus had Kalanisi Dubh in great form, she was very fresh and came on plenty from the last day. She was great and it's great to do it for a small owner and trainer. This is my first double and a huge day for me - Niall Moore, jockey.

runners.name: Party President
runners.comment: Hasn't offered much in three maiden hurdles; entitled to improve for switch to handicaps
runners.spotlight: Okay efforts in two point-to-points but hasn't offered a huge amount in three maiden hurdle outings; entitled to improve for a switch to handicaps but he will need to.

runners.name: Real Empire
runners.owner: Global Bird In The Hand Syndicate
runners.comment: Well beaten on handicap debut at Fairyhouse; Shark Hanlon is at least in good form
runners.spotlight: Showed promise in bumpers but hurdles form so far hasn't matched up; possibly needed the run when well beaten on handicap debut over 2m4f at Fairyhouse in February; Shark Hanlon is at least in good form.

runners.name: Weston
runners.comment: No sign of a revival in four hurdles starts and three tries on the level for this yard
runners.spotlight: Two middle-distance wins on the Flat in Germany in 2022; has lost form since fifth in 2m4f Ascot Stakes in 2023; no sign of a revival in four hurdles starts and three tries on the level for this yard.

runners.name: Maries March
runners.comment: Dropped away rapidly at Leopardstown but excellent third over C&D (soft) last month
runners.spotlight: Ordinary form in three maiden runs for Willie Mullins; decent effort on first start for this yard in mares' maiden at Fairyhouse; dropped away rapidly next time at Leopardstown but excellent third of 19 over C&D (soft) last month; contender.

runners.name: Highland Earl
runners.comment: Wasn't disgraced in 3rd maiden start at Thurles; related to couple of winners over timber
runners.spotlight: Handicap debutant; wasn't disgraced in third maiden hurdle start at Thurles (15.5f, good); related to a couple of winners over timber and he's worth a market check.

runners.name: Chesterbaylad
runners.comment: Has always looked like one with handicaps in mind; 170-day absence to overcome
runners.spotlight: Beaten a fair way on all three hurdle outings to date but has always looked like one with handicaps in mind; 170-day absence to overcome; the market should tell the story.

runners.name: Sydney Cruiser
runners.comment: Some solid efforts in defeat over trips ranging from 2m1f-2m6f; each-way possibilities
runners.spotlight: Disappointing favourite for Clonmel handicap (2m4f, good) in October off the back of some solid efforts in defeat over trips ranging from 2m1f-2m6f; midfield at Fairyhouse in November; each-way possibilities if she's ready to roll after a break.

runners.name: Gilded Moon
runners.comment: Placed in Kilbeggan maiden hurdle last summer but handicap form very modest so far
runners.spotlight: AW winner in Britain over 1m2f; placed in Kilbeggan maiden hurdle last summer but handicap form very modest so far; difficult to recommend at this moment in time.

runners.name: Cnoc An Locha
runners.comment: Second run was an improvement but she's always looked like more of a handicapping prospect
runners.spotlight: Finished down the field in her first three starts in maiden hurdles; second run was an improvement but she's always looked like more of a handicapping prospect; market will guide.

runners.name: Creative Dancer
runners.comment: Can't be ignored for a shrewd yard but he has another lengthy absence to overcome
runners.spotlight: Dual-purpose maiden returned after a long absence last year when down the field three times on the Flat for this yard; can't be ignored for a shrewd yard but he has another lengthy absence to overcome.

runners.name: Patty Ofarrell
runners.comment: Well beaten in three maiden hurdles; stable struggling at present; can only be watched
runners.spotlight: Pulled up in a point-to-point; well beaten in three maiden hurdles, triple-figure odds each time; stable struggling at present; can only be watched on handicap debut.

runners.name: Go Gill Go
runners.comment: Hit the frame in 3 of her seven starts last season; repeat of Clonmel third offers hope
runners.spotlight: Losing run since maiden hurdle win in 2021; hit the frame in three of her seven starts last season; repeat of Clonmel third on penultimate gives her a squeak; each-way claims.

quotes.race: RSS Document Storage Maiden Hurdle
quotes.quote: Go Gill Go ran well at Wexford over too long a trip. She saw it out well today. She will handle better ground and we will try and find a handicap hurdle somewhere - James Grace, trainer.

runners.name: Mrs Wemyss
runners.comment: Has shown close to nothing in two bumpers, four hurdle starts and on latest at Dundalk
runners.spotlight: Has shown close to nothing in two bumpers, four hurdle starts and on latest when down the field on her Flat debut at Dundalk; impossible to recommend; first-time cheekpieces tried.

runners.name: You Make Me Smile
runners.owner: T & R Hennessy & A Fahy Partnership
runners.comment: Dual-purpose maiden has produced no worthwhile form in 19 career starts; passed over
runners.spotlight: Dual-purpose maiden has produced no worthwhile form in 19 career starts and hasn't been seen since tailed off over hurdles at Sligo last July.

runners.name: Masterstonemason
runners.comment: Veteran whose most recent win came more than three years ago; very weak form since
runners.spotlight: Veteran whose most recent win came more than three years ago; very weak form since; seems safe to rule out.

quotes.race: Adare Manor Opportunity Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: We had Masterstonemason tuned up for today and everything was going to plan at home. He has a turn of foot and that's what you need. He always showed it at home. He had problems in the last few years with his back but we got that sorted and this is great - Flan Costello jnr, representing the trainer.

quotes.race: Golf Memberships 2018 From 500euros 3-Y-O Hurdle
quotes.quote: Masterstonemason's experience was a big help and I think he'll go on any ground. He's a biggish horse, about 16.2, and is only growing into himself - Flan Costello, trainer.

runners.name: Nicoles Getaway
runners.comment: Detached in February's comeback run after huge break; didn't fare a lot better at Limerick
runners.spotlight: Soon detached in February's comeback run after huge absence; didn't fare a lot better when last seen at Limerick; big drop in trip now; best watched.

runners.name: Mooretown Lad
runners.comment: Flat winner at Leopardstown last summer but no show in three maiden hurdles; reserve
runners.spotlight: First reserve; won 1m1f handicap on the Flat at Leopardstown last summer on good; triple-figure odds and no show in three maiden hurdles.

quotes.race: BoyleSports Lengthen The Odds Handicap (Div II)
quotes.quote: Mooretown Lad is a work in progress. He is a brother to I Am Superman but he is a slow learner and more like his half-brother Fastnet Crown. He has taken time and he will be a better horse next year - Michael O'Callaghan, trainer.

runners.name: Queen Of Seduction
runners.comment: Dual Flat winner in 2023; failed to finish in last 3 hurdles starts this season; reserve
runners.spotlight: Second reserve; dual Flat winner in 2023; failed to finish in last three hurdles starts this season; passed over.

quotes.race: Irish Stallion Farms EBF Fillies & Mares Maiden
quotes.quote: Queen Of Seduction was fit and I was told not to get beaten for stamina. She is a big filly and I would say she is only filling into herself. She could be one to keep improving - Ronan Whelan, jockey.

runners.name: Welcome Aboard
runners.comment: Well beaten in three maiden hurdles; interesting if he gets a run on handicap bow; reserve
runners.spotlight: Third reserve; ran okay despite being well beaten in three hot maiden hurdles, including two around here; interesting if he gets a run on handicap bow.

runners.name: The Nagger Reidy
runners.breeder: Mill House Stud & Mr N Farrell
runners.comment: Listowel winner on return; second at Limerick over 2m latest; unraced on good ground
runners.spotlight: Winner at Listowel (2m2f, soft) on return before a narrow defeat at Tipperary; sent off favourite or joint-favourite last three outings, including when a staying-on second at Limerick over 2m latest; unraced on good ground; cheekpieces tried.

runners.name: Littlefoot
runners.comment: 2m7f maiden winner ran well over 2m6f in Ballinrobe handicap; not out of things here
runners.spotlight: Won his maiden over 2m7f and was strong in the finish when third in 2m6f handicap at Ballinrobe (good); never involved at Cheltenham when last seen in November; his classy bumper form is by no means forgotten; player.

quotes.race: Connolly's RED MILLS Irish EBF Auction Maiden Hurdle (IRE Incentive Race)
quotes.quote: In Gowran Park (last September) Littlefoot got a very nasty injury and it was touch and go whether he would come back. He's really coming into himself now, he jumped brilliantly, travelled, and we know he has an engine so it's nice to see him back - Mark Molloy, trainer, speaking to Racing TV.

runners.name: Sargent Lightfoot

prev_owners.owner: M McLoughlin, A Murray, A F McLoughlin & S Coyne
M McLoughlin, A Murray, A F McLoughlin & S Coyne

runners.comment: Good run in defeat when 2nd in Limerick handicap chase 11 days ago; respected over timber
runners.spotlight: In good form over both hurdles and fences last summer on good ground, winning 2m3f Punchestown handicap off 102; gallant effort in defeat when runner-up in Limerick handicap chase 11 days ago; respected back over timber.

quotes.race: Mullingar Beginners' Chase
quotes.quote: Sargent Lightfoot loves it here and that's his second win this year. He jumped well except for one fence. We were hoping he'd finish in the first three or four but thought it would be a big step for him to win. I'd say we might look at a hurdle race again for him - Adrian Murray, trainer.

runners.name: Miss Mini Bee
runners.comment: 2nd to Mullins-trained winner at Punchestown in January; badly hampered at Leopardstown
runners.spotlight: Won Fairyhouse bumper on heavy on debut; best effort over hurdles when second to Willie Mullins-trained winner at Punchestown in January; badly hampered at Leopardstown last time; handicap debut.

quotes.race: Irish Stallion Farms EBF 4-Y-O Fillies INH Flat Race
quotes.quote: Miss Mini Bee is a big filly but only a frame. She should hopefully improve a good bit from this - Pat Foley, trainer.

runners.name: In For The Night
runners.comment: Pulled up at Fairyhouse when last seen but looks a big contender with conditions to suit
runners.spotlight: Opened account in 2m4f Gowran handicap (good) in October and equally good second at Fairyhouse following month; pulled up on soft at that venue when last seen but looks a big contender here with conditions to suit.

quotes.race: Thomastown Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: In For The Night deserved that. He is not the easiest horse to train and has had a few niggly problems. From the third-last I was always confident. You would be hopeful that he could improve again - Mark Walsh, rider.

runners.name: Washington Parks
runners.comment: 7th behind Ethical Diamond at Punchestown and was beaten 3l at Thurles (2m) four weeks ago
runners.spotlight: Sent off triple-figure odds for his first three maiden hurdles but caught the eye when seventh behind Ethical Diamond at Punchestown (2m4f) and was beaten only 3l at Thurles (2m) four weeks ago; shortlisted on handicap debut.

runners.name: Mi Lucky Cailin
runners.comment: Bumper winner; second four times in maidens; makes handicap debut; not a lost cause
runners.spotlight: Bumper winner (soft) on debut; 0-10 over hurdles but has run well in defeat, runner-up four times in maidens; makes handicap debut; not a lost cause.

quotes.race: Front Door 4-Y-O Fillies (Pro/Am) INH Flat Race
quotes.quote: Mi Lucky Cailin is a smart mare and this wasn't really a surprise. She was very impressive in a schooling bumper at Tipperary ten days ago. She's tough, genuine and loves pleasing you - William McLernon, trainer.

runners.name: Riggs
runners.owner: Paul M Butler & James Patrick Byrne
runners.comment: Pulled up in 4 of his last 5 starts including handicap chase debut when last seen; risky
runners.spotlight: Pulled up in four of his last five starts including handicap chase debut when last seen; risky proposition; 216-day layoff.

stable_tour.quote: He ran nicely at Aintree and for quite a while I've had the Â£100,000 long-distance hurdle in mind for him at Haydock on Saturday. The time has come to go up in trip to 3m. He was second in the EBF Final at Sandown last season and that's always a good race. 16-11-21

runners.name: Syracus Du Houx
runners.comment: Brought down when mid-division on handicap debut at Thurles; too early to write him off
runners.spotlight: Has failed to build on second placing at Punchestown last May; brought down three out when mid-division on handicap debut over 2m6f at Thurles 19 days ago; too early to write him off.

runners.name: Paul Collins
runners.comment: Remote third at Punchestown on final start for Gordon Elliott in February; best watched
runners.spotlight: Placed in two point-to-points; best effort over hurdles on rules debut at Wexford over 2m4f; hasn't backed that up since, only a remote third at Punchestown on final start for Gordon Elliott in February; best watched on first start for new yard.

stable_tour.quote: Made a few mistakes on the way to finishing third in a maiden hurdle at Wexford on Sunday. If we can iron out his jumping, he should do okay. He'll improve plenty from that first run. 28-10-24

runners.name: Walk Away Harry
runners.comment: 4th at Fairyhouse on penultimate; disappointed at Clonmel; new headgear combination tried
runners.spotlight: Bumper winner a couple of seasons ago; has run with promise in a couple of starts for this yard, including when fourth at Fairyhouse on penultimate run; disappointed at Clonmel latest; new headgear combination tried.

quotes.race: Avison Young INH Flat Race
quotes.quote: Walk Away Harry had a great run the last day in Clonmel, but we were a bit concerned the ground today wasn't soft enough for him. The trip helped and he got a brilliant ride - Charles Byrnes, trainer.

runners.name: Beautiful Chaos
runners.comment: Three fourth places in trio of maiden hurdles; could sneak into the frame at a price
runners.spotlight: Flat winner in 2022; handed a rating of 103 after three fourth places in trio of maiden hurdles; jockey takes off another 7lb; could sneak into the frame at a price.

runners.name: Queenie St Clair
runners.comment: Ran in the Mares' Novices' Hurdle at Cheltenham; this is her easiest assignment to date
runners.spotlight: Has been set some extremely stiff tasks in all five outings for this yard, including last time when far from disgraced in the Grade 2 Mares' Novices' Hurdle at Cheltenham; this is by far her easiest assignment to date on handicap hurdle debut.

runners.name: Steps In The Sand
runners.comment: Two handicap hurdle wins last summer on sharp right-handed tracks; first run for new yard
runners.spotlight: Two handicap hurdle wins last summer on sharp right-handed tracks (Sligo & Downpatrick), both on good, and some decent Flat efforts in defeat too; first run for new yard after midfield finish at Cork in November.

runners.name: King In Love
runners.comment: Won 2m handicap here off 90 last month, forging clear; seemingly wants softer conditions
runners.spotlight: Ordinary form in maidens; returned in February with fine third over 2m4f at Punchestown off 90 before winning 2m handicap here off that mark last month, forging clear; seemingly wants soft conditions but must be respected.

runners.name: The Dawn
runners.breeder: S C E A Elevage De La Croix De Place
runners.comment: Ran worst race of his career on better ground at Wexford last month so conditions a worry
runners.spotlight: Came on from his reappearance at Limerick when third over 20.5f at Fairyhouse; second next time over 2m at Clonmel on handicap bow; ran worst race of his career on better ground at Wexford last month so conditions are a worry.

runners.name: Kellys Birr
runners.owner: John P Kelly & Eoin Gerard Kelly
runners.comment: Won 2m6f handicap hurdle on her debut for Gordon Elliott; first run for new yard; layoff
runners.spotlight: Won 2m6f handicap hurdle on her debut for Gordon Elliott at Downpatrick in 2023; off for a year when making no impression in Tramore beginners' chase last May; very hard to assess but has since left Elliott.

runners.name: Alright Darling
runners.comment: Recent 2m4f fourth was a step in the right direction but seems to be crying out for a trip
runners.spotlight: Recent 2m4f Leopardstown fourth was a step in the right direction but she seems to be crying out for further than this; more required.

runners.name: Arnacoeur
runners.comment: Three no shows since joining this stable, including on handicap debut at Leopardstown
runners.spotlight: Placed form in maidens in 2023 on better ground; has clearly had his issues since with three no shows since joining this stable, including on handicap debut at Leopardstown last time.

runners.name: Smackwater Jack
runners.comment: Went close at Gowran (2m4f, soft) last month when clear of the remainder; respected
runners.spotlight: On a long losing run but went close at Gowran (2m4f, soft) last month when clear of the remainder; stable had a winner on the Flat at Dundalk on Friday; respected.

stable_tour.quote: He had a very good start over fences at Aintree but has missed 18 months. He's back in good form now and we'll start in a handicap chase with him in about six weeks. He could become a very nice staying chaser. 27-10-22

runners.name: Silent Flight
runners.comment: Won at Punchestown (2m4f, heavy) in January off 85 but well below that recently; reserve
runners.spotlight: First reserve; won at Punchestown (2m4f, heavy) in January off 85 but well below that level in recent outings.

runners.name: Toor Moon
runners.comment: Maiden has a fair bit of placed form; stays much further; looks vulnerable; reserve
runners.spotlight: Second reserve; maiden has a fair bit of placed form; stays much further; looks vulnerable after 241-day absence.

runners.name: Are You Busy
runners.comment: Good maiden win over 2m4f at Thurles; respected again on handicap bow but tough mark
runners.spotlight: Built on three promising runs in maiden hurdles when winning at the fourth attempt at Thurles (2m4f, good to yielding) under a positive ride; respected again on handicap bow but tough opening mark.

quotes.race: Holycross Maiden Hurdle
quotes.quote: She doesn't do a whole lot in front but she got the job done. At Fairyhouse Are You Busy ran a blinder and looked to get a bit tired but she's from a staying family. I couldn't go with them early but she travelled into it well. The nicer ground worked - Aidan Kelly, jockey, speaking to Racing TV.

runners.name: Butchers Bill
runners.comment: Average form so far; still early days for top yard; can't be discounted upped in trip
runners.spotlight: Hasn't set the world alight in first four starts, including when beaten around 17l into fourth on handicap debut over 2m4f at Punchestown; still early days for top yard so can't be discounted stepping up in trip.

runners.name: Glendine Billy
runners.comment: Runner-up in 2m6f handicap hurdle off 1lb higher at Tramore last June; had excuses latest
runners.spotlight: Good effort when runner-up in 2m6f handicap hurdle off 1lb higher at Tramore last June; had excuses when pulled up there in August; more needed on return from 231-day break.

runners.name: Cullig
runners.owner: Miss Patricia Coghlan & Diana Edwina Oakes & Guy Culliford
runners.comment: Won by 20l at Cork two weeks ago; 13lb higher here but is in rude health; respected
runners.spotlight: Left all known form well behind when bolting up in Cork handicap hurdle for amateur riders (24.5f, good) by 20l two weeks ago; 13lb higher here and won't have the services of a claimer but is in rude health.

runners.name: Aleish Lass
runners.comment: Fortunate winner at Limerick three weeks ago; Master Of The Sums back in third; chance
runners.spotlight: Point-to-point winner last term; fortunate winner of 18-runner handicap hurdle at Limerick (22.5f, yielding) three weeks ago with Master Of The Sums back in third; the runner-up won easily since.

runners.name: Kings Halo
runners.comment: Doesn't look particularly well treated back over timber; unraced on good ground
runners.spotlight: Better record over fences, with three wins and three seconds from eleven starts; made no impact in the Leinster National last time; doesn't look particularly well treated back over timber; unraced on good ground.

quotes.race: Clinton Higgins Chartered Accountants Novice Handicap Chase
quotes.quote: Kings Halo jumped and travelled, Danny got the fractions right. The drop back in trip made no difference. The ground and weigh suited him - James Dullea, trainer.

runners.name: Master Of The Sums
runners.comment: Never-nearer third behind Aleish Lass; 12lb better off and may well reverse the form
runners.spotlight: Point-to-point winner; improved for the step up in trip on handicap debut when a never-nearer third behind Aleish Lass at Limerick three weeks ago; he's 12lb better off with that rival and may well reverse the form.

runners.name: Danny The Fence
runners.comment: Unconvincing overall form since landing Fairyhouse handicap hurdle in November 2023
runners.spotlight: Unconvincing overall form since landing Fairyhouse handicap hurdle (23.5f, soft to heavy) in November 2023; switches from chasing to hurdles; best watched.

runners.name: Glenetty
runners.comment: Good effort last time at Leopardstown over 2m4f when remote second off current mark
runners.spotlight: Best effort to date was when third at Leopardstown (23.5f, heavy) in February, beaten 4l; good effort last time at Leopardstown over 2m4f when remote second off current mark; may need softer ground than this.

runners.name: Hanoi Jane
runners.comment: Won Punchestown handicap hurdle off 89 in May 2023; well treated if she can find that form
runners.spotlight: Won Punchestown handicap hurdle (19.5f, good to yielding) off 89 in May 2023; fell here over 2m4f on chasing debut off the back of a lengthy absence in January; shrewd yard and well treated if she can build on that.

quotes.race: Join Us For Summer In Town Mini Festival Handicap Hurdle (Div I)
quotes.quote: Hanoi Jane will win another one. She jumps well, stays well and might win a little novice chase - Ted Walsh, trainer.

runners.name: Roc My Haarth
runners.comment: Two fine efforts at Limerick and Gowran; fair mark; drying ground a niggle; 3m will suit
runners.spotlight: Some promise in maidens but ran a career-best on handicap debut when beaten 1l into third at Limerick (2m5f, heavy) in January; followed that with a third at Gowran (2m4f, soft) from same mark; drying ground the only niggle but 3m should suit.

runners.name: True Destiny
runners.breeder: M J & L A Taylor Llp

prev_owners.owner: Exors Of The Late Sultan Ahmad Sha
H R H Sultan Ahmad Shah

runners.comment: Second at Limerick and Sligo last October; decent chance if reproducing that form
runners.spotlight: Second at Limerick and Sligo last October; decent chance if reproducing that form; behind Butchers Bill when sixth of 14 at Punchestown in February; should improve for better ground.

runners.name: Nettuno Italia
runners.comment: Big eyecatcher when fourth at Fairyhouse on handicap debut; big player over 3m now
runners.spotlight: Little to take from three maiden runs at 2m but was a big eyecatcher when fourth of 23 at Fairyhouse (2m4f, soft) on handicap debut in February, making serious gains late on; this trip can only enhance his chance.

runners.name: Tangental
runners.comment: Two hurdles wins on soft; fairly treated on the pick of his form in this sphere but risky
runners.spotlight: Two wins over hurdles on soft; 0-9 over fences since January 2024 which has resulted in connections trying hurdles again; looks fairly treated on the pick of his form in this sphere but he's risky.

quotes.race: Easter Festival 3rd - 5th April Handicap Hurdle (Div I)
quotes.quote: Tangental coped with that ground well and when I asked him he took off and did the job well. He might be able to win another one and he'll jump a fence in the summer time - J.J. Slevin, rider.

runners.name: Mellem
runners.comment: Bolt from out of the blue when close third at Leopardstown; huge player with a repeat
runners.spotlight: 0-8 and showed no worthwhile form until beaten half a length into third in Leopardstown handicap hurdle (3m, yielding) last month, clear when entering the straight and only headed inside final furlong; 2lb higher; shortlisted.

runners.name: Apples In Winter
runners.comment: Plenty on to reverse the form with Mellem judged on latest effort at Leopardstown
runners.spotlight: 0-13 over hurdles, placed twice; encouragement from Punchestown run in February when far from disgraced under this rider but has plenty on to reverse the form with Mellem judged on latest effort at Leopardstown.

runners.name: Tango Theatre
runners.comment: 0-22 under rules but has placed six times and her best efforts have come on better ground
runners.spotlight: 0-22 under rules but has placed six times and her best efforts have come on better ground; didn't fare all too badly when beaten around 10l on first start in 497 days at Clonmel in February but more needed.

runners.name: Barryroe Madam
runners.comment: 13-race maiden but her best efforts have come at around 3m; better can be expected here
runners.spotlight: 13-race maiden but her best efforts have come at around 3m, third of 20 at Galway in October and a close-up sixth of 18 at Tipperary a month later; inadequate test over 2m at Clonmel latest; better can be expected here.

runners.name: Kiln Time
runners.comment: Tailed off on all five starts since joining this yard, including on chase debut last month
runners.spotlight: Dual handicap hurdle winner early last season on heavy; tailed off on all five starts since joining this yard, including on chase debut last month; readily passed over.

runners.name: Joes Turn
runners.comment: Solid third at Punchestown back over timber; merits consideration from same mark
runners.spotlight: Staying type who won Kilbeggan handicap chase (25.5f, good to yielding) last August off 82; solid third at Punchestown back over timber (2m4f, heavy) in February; merits consideration from same mark back on more suitable ground.

runners.name: Ballerina Boxer
runners.comment: 0-15 under rules; won a weak point in January; pulled up on last point start; reserve
runners.spotlight: First reserve; 0-15 under rules; won a weak point-to-point in January; pulled up on last start in that sphere; avoid.

runners.name: Mahler Appeal
runners.comment: In fine form at Wexford last May but hasn't been in good form lately; reserve
runners.spotlight: Second reserve; in fine form at Wexford last May, winning 3m1f handicap chase by 12l on soft and runner-up there next time in 3m handicap hurdle; not at best lately.

runners.name: Royal Cave
runners.comment: Had race at her mercy when a faller at the last at Fairyhouse in November; reserve
runners.spotlight: Third reserve; fair form in bumpers without winning and went close over this trip at Kilbeggan in September; had race at her mercy when a faller at the last at Fairyhouse a month later; poor at Navan in December.

5:30.race_name: Irish Stallion Farms EBF Auction (Pro/Am) INH Flat Race (IRE Incentive Race)

runners.name: Ifallgoeswell
runners.comment: Fav when brought down on debut, pleasing run here latest, conditions fine, leading chance
runners.spotlight: Brought down early on debut at Galway when sent off the 2-1 favourite; ran a fine race second time up over this C&D in December, beaten 3.25l into second of 12 and has been off since; trip, track and ground all fine and he holds leading claims if ready to go after his break.

runners.name: Kofino
runners.comment: Pulled up in both points, brother to a 3m winner so may need further, best watched
runners.spotlight: Bought for 4,000GBP at Goffs in January; sent off short odds in two starts in point-to-points but pulled up in both; brother to a 3m winner so this trip may be too short; best watched.

runners.name: Keep Kool Coko
runners.comment: Best effort over 20.5f on good in a Cork maiden, lacks a run but ground will suit, chance
runners.spotlight: 0-2 in bumpers and 0-2 over hurdles; best effort a 0.5l second in a 20.5f Cork maiden hurdle in October, his sole start on good ground; off since 10.5l hurdles defeat at Wexford (2m4f, yielding) when sent off the 9/4 favourite; could go well back in a bumper on ground he'll like if fit after a 158-day absence.

runners.name: King Song
runners.comment: Pulled up in two points, 100-1 and never figured in Gowran bumper latest, needs more time
runners.spotlight: Pulled up in both starts in point-to-points; 100-1 and ran accordingly in a 2m2f bumper at Gowran early last month; may need more time.

runners.name: Jamada
runners.comment: Promise both starts, 4.25l behind subsequent winner latest, improve for that, interesting
runners.spotlight: Showed promise in bumpers at Punchestown (16.5f, soft) and Thurles (15.5f, good) 103 days apart; shaped as though the run was needed on latest and was only 4.25l behind Sunny South West, who has since won easily at Clonmel; interesting runner with improvement likely to be forthcoming.

runners.name: Portnablagh
runners.comment: Pulled up in sole point; 22-1 and beaten 17l at Ayr in November; off since, best watched
runners.spotlight: Pulled up in sole point-to-point; 22-1 and beaten 17l in an Ayr (2m, good) bumper in November; off since and likely best watched on return.

runners.name: Saint Peregrine
runners.comment: 33-1, raced keenly and ran out when leading after 6f at Clonmel, risks attached
runners.spotlight: 33-1, raced keenly, led and ran out before the race had developed at Clonmel on debut a week ago; risks attached.

runners.name: Times A Wastin
runners.comment: 0-5 in bumpers, long odds for all starts and hasn't shown enough, others preferred
runners.spotlight: 0-6 under Rules and 0-5 in bumpers; long odds for all his starts and hasn't shown enough to make him of interest here; cheekpieces tried last time discarded; others preferred.

runners.name: All For Brooke
runners.comment: Marcel gelding, related to bumper winners, probably best watched unless money comes
runners.spotlight: Marcel gelding cost 20,000euros as a foal and 15,000euros as a 3yo; seventh foal; half-brother to winners Hillcrest (bumper/smart 2m4f-3m hurdle), Bold Record (2m4f hurdle) and Disco Dancer (bumper/2m1f hurdle); dam bumper, Flat and useful hurdle/chase winner; nicely bred but yard 3-53 in bumpers last five seasons; watch unless money comes.

runners.name: Two Pair
runners.owner: Exors Of The Late Philip Byrne
runners.comment: Decent debut behind Bambino Fever, related to bumper winners, could go well
runners.spotlight: Offered something to work with when sixth of 16 behind Champion Bumper winner Bambino Fever on debut at Punchestown (18.5f, soft); sister won a heavy ground bumper at Ayr in February and her half-sister won a listed bumper on good ground for Fergal O'Brien; go well if fit after a 93-day break.

2:00.race_name: Pat O'Hare Bookmakers Maiden Hurdle (Div II)

runners.name: Black Heather
runners.comment: Bumper winner, not suited by testing ground, should be effective on the predicted going
runners.spotlight: Six bumper runs; won on good ground at Ballinrobe last July; has struggled in testing conditions; should be more at home on the predicted going; could be good enough to win an ordinary maiden at the first attempt.

runners.name: Brave Soldier
runners.comment: Three different trainers for his three runs, midfield on yard debut at Thurles last month
runners.spotlight: Three different trainers for his three runs; down the field in a bumper at Killarney last May; shaped quite well when 20l fourth in maiden hurdle at Cork in November; well beaten in midfield on stable debut at Thurles last month.

runners.name: Centaq
runners.comment: Sixth foal, half-brother to winners Ginnets Girl (bumper/hurdles) and Navy Girl (point)
runners.spotlight: Sixth foal; half-brother to winners Ginnets Girl (bumper/3m1f hurdle) and Navy Girl (point); dam 2m4f hurdle winner; hooded for debut.

runners.name: Charlies Gift
runners.comment: 150-1 and struggled from an early stage at Cork a fortnight ago, cheekpieces tried now
runners.spotlight: 150-1 and struggled from an early stage at Cork a fortnight ago; cheekpieces tried now.

runners.name: Gatehouse Boy
runners.comment: Stable is enjoying a fine season but this one has shown no promise in three outings
runners.spotlight: Stable is enjoying a fine season but this one has shown no promise in three outings.

runners.name: Jazz De Cotte
runners.comment: Ayr bumper winner last April, reported coughing after poor hurdling debut at Tipperary
runners.spotlight: Second in a point during the autumn points campaign in 2023; stayed on strongly to get up late in a bumper at Ayr in April on his sole start; pulled up on his hurdling debut at Tipperary in October, reported coughing; good chance here if restored to health.

stable_tour.quote: He won a bumper at the Scottish Grand National meeting at Ayr. He's got a lot stronger since then, too, and he's one we're looking forward to sending over hurdles. 28-10-24

runners.name: Lecales Diamond
runners.comment: Second in a point for the influential Pat Turley, has joined a leading stable
runners.spotlight: Half-brother to three winners; second in a point at Ballinaboola two months ago for the influential Pat Turley; has joined a leading stable.

runners.name: Light On His Feet
runners.comment: Tailed off in a bumper last year, struggled on hurdling debut at Thurles
runners.spotlight: Tailed off in a bumper at Killarney last year; struggled on hurdling debut at Thurles.

runners.name: Net Boy
runners.breeder: Mme Clarence Signol & M Xavier Brelaud
runners.comment: Staying on when unseating his rider at Leopardstown, capable of making his presence felt
runners.spotlight: Showed promise on debut in a Navan bumper last winter despite racing keenly; failed to that up at Wexford in October; was keeping on when unseating his rider at the last at Leopardstown a month ago; capable of making his presence felt.

runners.name: On The Cards
runners.breeder: E A R L Haras Du Quesnay
runners.comment: Eight-race maiden on the Flat, 100-1 when down the field on hurdling debut at Down Royal
runners.spotlight: Eight-race maiden on the Flat, placed three times for Marcus Tregoning; 100-1 when down the field on hurdling debut at Down Royal.

runners.name: Patrick Street
runners.comment: Two wins from 29 starts on Flat, unlikely to make an immediate impact over hurdles
runners.spotlight: Formerly trained by Pat Martin who has retired; two wins from 29 starts on Flat; his new trainer tries him with a hood instead of previous tongue-tie/cheekpieces combination; unlikely to make an immediate impact over hurdles.

runners.name: Sean Mc
runners.comment: No sign of winning potential in three maiden hurdle outings in recent months
runners.spotlight: No sign of winning potential in three maiden hurdle outings in recent months.

runners.name: Sky And Sand
runners.comment: Made the frame in three starts in points, brother to bumper/hurdles winner Cappucino
runners.spotlight: Made the frame in three starts in points for Jonathan Fogarty; brother to bumper/hurdles winner Cappucino.

runners.name: Tsavo Park
runners.comment: Did not show much in points and failed to make much impression on his first hurdles run
runners.spotlight: Did not show much in points and failed to make much impression on his first hurdles run at Clonmel last week.

runners.name: Union Alley
runners.breeder: E A R L Elevage Des Loges
runners.owner: Patrick M Hogan & Ms Margaret Mullins
runners.comment: Towards the rear in two bumper outings, down the field on hurdling debut at Gowran
runners.spotlight: Towards the rear in two bumper outings, down the field on hurdling debut at Gowran last month.

runners.name: Way Down We Go
runners.comment: Sent off at three-figure odds when showing nothing in two outings; no apparent chance
runners.spotlight: Sent off at three-figure odds when showing nothing in two outings; no apparent chance.

runners.name: Youlita
runners.comment: Point winner, probably capable of improving on his first hurdles effort at Punchestown
runners.spotlight: Point winner for Paul Cashman, 4l third in a Fairyhouse bumper in November was not a bad run, since he was hampered at a crucial stage; probably capable of improving from his hurdles/stable at Punchestown.

runners.name: Heslostthehunger
runners.comment: Huge price when tailed off in a bumper at Thurles last month, can be ruled out
runners.spotlight: Huge price when tailed off in a bumper at Thurles last month; can be ruled out.

runners.name: Kanog Bay
runners.comment: Last of four finishers in a point last month, unlikely to make an immediate impact
runners.spotlight: Last of four finishers in a point last month; unlikely to make an immediate impact.

runners.name: Screaming Eagle
runners.comment: 73-rated Flat maiden, best form was for the first of his two British trainers
runners.spotlight: 73-rated Flat maiden; best form was for Andrew Balding, the first of his two British trainers.
